- See more at: http://www.youcaring.com/other/i-m-going-hairle...

Update from July 8:Heidi was denied coverage again and told that she will receive a medical bill of 34K to pay back the governent. What is the country coming to? If the government won't help our people, we need to step up and help while we can. - See more at: http://www.youcaring.com/other/i-m-going-hairle...
Update from July 8:
Heidi was denied coverage again and told that she will receive a medical bill
of 34K to which she needs to pay back the government.
Updates from Heidi June 20:

Heidi was dropped from SSD after an incomplete medical review. Right now, she is in appeals awaiting a decision. If they still come back and determine she's no longer disabled under the eyes of the government, she will lose her income, her Medicare, AND have to pay back the money she's received while in appeals.
Updates from Heidi May 12:

Heidi was diagnosed with white Lupus plaques throughout her frontal lobe and her disease is progressing rapidly. She was told that she must start Imuran treatment immediately and that she will be starting full blown Cytoxin/Rituxin chemotherapy infusion within six to eight weeks time. This treatment will cause her to be very weak, needing a scooter to get around.
You also have an option to give on the youcaring campaign page: http://www.youcaring.com/other/i-m-going-hairless-for-heidi/70017
Thanks for reading and contributing!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Paypal:Mykelmarie@gmail.com
Thank YOU for your time and attention!

That's my daughter in the picture above, we were both excited about the back to school shopping trip they took last Monday. She came back with school supplies, a backpack, shoes, and some clothing- awesome! We're both so thankful!

It's been two years now- living in shelters, motels, with Beautiful friends. I've spent this time being grateful for the roof, focusing on self-improvement, Loving, learning from, and teaching my daughter, and trying to find a way to provide for her without being neglectful.

It wasn't until I saw this news story http://m.nbcmiami.com/nbcmiami/pm_108209/contentdetail.htm?contentguid=mp2XX9wN that I felt the sting of my childhood homelessness. Seeing my daughters face under the heading sent me into the past. I began to recall the sadness, the feeling of having nowhere to call home and the anxiety from the lack of stability. Being teased on the playground when schoolmates saw ME on a News segment done at the shelter I was in.

It saddened me, to have my child experiencing the same, to be the Mother, who as I child I felt so sorry for. I remembered being 7 years old, packing my little suitcase and writing a runaway note, telling my Mom I wanted to make things easier for her and heading around the corner to hide (of course she found me). I remembered the day my Mother died, while we were living in a transitional shelter, and the devastation that followed.

It's not for lack of effort that I ended up here. I once accepted a job that required three buses and five hours of commute time to get there. But the pay was decent, great by Miami standards , so I tried anyway. Dragging her out in the streets at 6:00am from one bus stop to the next. The stories of struggle are countless, I'm sure many can relate.
Now my time in this shelter is up, any day I could be discharged. Thankfully, I'll be transferred to another shelter since I have a child, and I'm grateful for that.
I'm asking for your hand because this isn't the life she deserves. She's so bright, loving and energetic, and I can slowly see a change in her.
She was recently able to get  into preschool, but I have yet to find a job,
I'm not hopeless, I know things will workout.

I'm asking for your help to get a jump start, in providing Babesters with a more stable life. It would relieve the pressure of move-in costs once I find a job, I'd really Love to pay a years rent, it would make it easier to get a place since I have an eviction on my record, and most will be reluctant to rent to me, many won't at all.
They say it takes a village to raise a child, with that thought I put pride to the side to ask for help.
Please spread the word, ask your co-workers, friends, family etc.
I appreciate YOU, much Love to you and yours!
*Myke
","Paypal:Mykelmarie@gmail.com

<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
Qu’est ce que Comptoir De Styles ?
<div>

column2: >Comptoir De Styles est un endroit pas comme les autres !

column1: C’est bien
plus qu’un salon de beauté, on y propose des prestations personnalisées,
de coiffure, de maquillage et de conseil en image, dans un cadre intimiste
et original
column2: un lieu unique où tout tourne autour du conseil, centré sur vos

column1: attentes et vos objectifs.
Basé à Lyon,
sur les pentes de la Croix Rousse, face au Jardin des Plantes.
Ici
vous êtes accueilli et pris en charge par Eva, la fondatrice et Aurore,
collaboratrice du salon, Coiffeuse et Esthéticienne diplômée, arrivée en
septembre 2014.
Le salon est ouvert du lundi
au vendredi, à partir de 10H30 et jusqu’à 21H (!) et le samedi de 9H à 13H,
dans un cadre unique et chaleureux, sur rendez vous.
Notre
ambition est d’agrandir notre lieu d’accueil en utilisant tout l’espace
disponible, notamment à l’étage, avec une surface dédiée à l’esthétique. Nous
souhaitons pousser encore plus loin notre concept, en approfondissant nos
prestations autour du bien être, avec des soins du corps, massages, manucures…
Nous
souhaitons communiquer autour de notre projet et en obtenir votre
feedback.
C’est
également une manière de faire connaître notre savoir-faire et de partager
notre expertise avec un public toujours plus nombreux.
Grâce à votre participation,
vous pouvez contribuer à la réussite d’une jeune entreprise familiale, et
continuer à profiter d’un lieu privilégié et de prestations sur-mesure.
Comptoir De Styles
Cette petite
affaire familiale, qui a vu le jour en Mars 2013, a été menée pendant 18 mois,
uniquement par Eva.
Après sa
formation en coiffure et plus de 7 années d’expériences, Eva, Coiffeuse
spécialisée Styliste-Visagiste, a aussi suivi une formation de Maquilleuse
Professionnelle et possède un diplôme de
Maquilleuse-Perruquière-Plasticienne.
Elle a aussi
travaillé avec des photographes de mode, pour des spectacles et des
particuliers
column2: enfin, elle a approfondi sa formation en suivant le

column1: cursus et obtenu le diplôme de Coach-conseil en image de l'IDRI, Institut
de Relooking International, à Paris.
C'est pour
réunir son savoir faire, ses compétences et son expérience, qu’elle a créé Comptoir
De Styles.
Malgré le
succès rencontré depuis l’ouverture, le volume d’affaire généré ne lui a pas
encore permis de se rémunérer. Cependant, nous entamons cette nouvelle année
avec fierté et conviction en notre concept novateur.
Nous sommes
aussi fiers de débuter ce 3ème exercice, dans les Pentes de la Croix
Rousse. Ce quartier, situé entre les Terreaux et le plateau de la Croix Rousse
est actuellement en réhabilitation. Il y a ici peu de commerces, contrairement
à une dizaine d’années. Nos clients nous soutiennent et nous encouragent à
continuer de contribuer à cette belle ambiance de quartier.
En
participant à ce projet, vous contribuerez à entretenir la vie de ces lieux
chargés d’histoire, en quête de dynamisme commercial et soutiendrez également
l’Artisanat Français.
Tout cela
nous pousse à grandir.
<h4>Comment y
arriver ?
C’est
maintenant que nous avons besoin de vous et faisons appel à votre soutien pour
franchir ce cap.
En effet,
les financeurs classiques (banques et intervenants locaux), ne peuvent nous
aider au delà de leur intervention initiale, lors du lancement de notre
affaire.
L’entrepreneuriat
n’est pas un long fleuve tranquille…
A quoi va servir votre contribution ?
Voilà une idée de comment sera utilisée votre contribution, par ordre de priorité.
Notre besoin s'établi autour de 30 000€, comme décrit ci dessous dans le plan d’investissement.
Nos besoins, pour voir plus loin !
• Travaux du local :
Enseigne lumineuse, Peinture, sol, murs, agencement (étage + mezzanine), plomberie, électricité 8500€
Ces modifications physiques sont primordiales pour transformer durablement l’utilisation de l’espace disponible.
Une enseigne, pour être visible de loin, le jour comme la nuit étant ouvert jusqu’à 21H.

Des travaux de plomberie vont être nécessaires pour installer un 2ème bac à shampooing. L’installation de plusieurs points de lumières aux différents niveaux du salon est à prévoir, pour le confort des clients et pour le bon déroulement des prestations.
De la peinture est à envisager, au sol et sur les murs, notamment pour la création de l’espace esthétique/massage.
• Matériel/Mobilier :
Bac, fauteuil coiffage, comptoir caisse, onglerie, fauteuil esthétique (massage + stock) 5000€

Le matériel de coiffure et d’esthétique professionnel représente un coût important. Nous avons besoin d’un bac à shampooing, un fauteuil de coiffure, un autre pour l’esthétique, un bar à ongles, du matériel et des produits d’esthétique.
Pour finir nous devons déplacer notre caisse, suite à la modification de l’agencement de l’espace.
• Crédit Bancaire : Solder le crédit
(Charge importante + non soutien de la banque)
Pour lancer notre entreprise, nous avons dû faire appel à un financeur classique.

Le remboursement de ce crédit représente une charge lourde à assumer et désormais, la banque ne peut plus nous soutenir et nous octroyer d’autres financements. Nous voudrions donc solder cette dette, pour investir cette charge mensuelle différemment, pour continuer à évoluer.
D'autres façons de nous d'aider
Nous savons que certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider :
• Vous pouvez passer le mot et faire de la publicité autour de notre projet.
• Utilisez les outils de partage Indiegogo !
• N'hésitez pas à partager sur vos comptes Facebook, Twitter, par mail, etc... et en parler à vos amis !

Grâce à votre participation,
vous pouvez contribuer à la réussite d’une jeune entreprise familiale, et
continuer à profiter d’un lieu privilégié et de prestations sur-mesure.
Comptoir De Styles
Cette petite
affaire familiale, qui a vu le jour en Mars 2013, a été menée pendant 18 mois,
uniquement par Eva.
Après sa
formation en coiffure et plus de 7 années d’expériences, Eva, Coiffeuse
spécialisée Styliste-Visagiste, a aussi suivi une formation de Maquilleuse
Professionnelle et possède un diplôme de
Maquilleuse-Perruquière-Plasticienne.
Elle a aussi
travaillé avec des photographes de mode, pour des spectacles et des
particuliers
column2: enfin, elle a approfondi sa formation en suivant le

column1: cursus et obtenu le diplôme de Coach-conseil en image de l'IDRI, Institut
de Relooking International, à Paris.
C'est pour
réunir son savoir faire, ses compétences et son expérience, qu’elle a créé Comptoir
De Styles.
Malgré le
succès rencontré depuis l’ouverture, le volume d’affaire généré ne lui a pas
encore permis de se rémunérer. Cependant, nous entamons cette nouvelle année
avec fierté et conviction en notre concept novateur.
Nous sommes
aussi fiers de débuter ce 3ème exercice, dans les Pentes de la Croix
Rousse. Ce quartier, situé entre les Terreaux et le plateau de la Croix Rousse
est actuellement en réhabilitation. Il y a ici peu de commerces, contrairement
à une dizaine d’années. Nos clients nous soutiennent et nous encouragent à
continuer de contribuer à cette belle ambiance de quartier.
En
participant à ce projet, vous contribuerez à entretenir la vie de ces lieux
chargés d’histoire, en quête de dynamisme commercial et soutiendrez également
l’Artisanat Français.
Tout cela
nous pousse à grandir.
Comment y
arriver ?
C’est
maintenant que nous avons besoin de vous et faisons appel à votre soutien pour
franchir ce cap.
En effet,
les financeurs classiques (banques et intervenants locaux), ne peuvent nous
aider au delà de leur intervention initiale, lors du lancement de notre
affaire.
L’entrepreneuriat
n’est pas un long fleuve tranquille…
A quoi va servir votre contribution ?
Voilà une idée de comment sera utilisée votre contribution, par ordre de priorité.
Notre besoin s'établi autour de 30 000€, comme décrit ci dessous dans le plan d’investissement.
Nos besoins, pour voir plus loin !
Travaux du local :
Enseigne lumineuse, Peinture, sol, murs, agencement (étage + mezzanine), plomberie, électricité 8500€
Ces modifications physiques sont primordiales pour transformer durablement l’utilisation de l’espace disponible.
Une enseigne, pour être visible de loin, le jour comme la nuit étant ouvert jusqu’à 21H.

Des travaux de plomberie vont être nécessaires pour installer un 2ème bac à shampooing. L’installation de plusieurs points de lumières aux différents niveaux du salon est à prévoir, pour le confort des clients et pour le bon déroulement des prestations.
De la peinture est à envisager, au sol et sur les murs, notamment pour la création de l’espace esthétique/massage.
Matériel/Mobilier :
Bac, fauteuil coiffage, comptoir caisse, onglerie, fauteuil esthétique (massage + stock) 5000€

Le matériel de coiffure et d’esthétique professionnel représente un coût important. Nous avons besoin d’un bac à shampooing, un fauteuil de coiffure, un autre pour l’esthétique, un bar à ongles, du matériel et des produits d’esthétique.
Pour finir nous devons déplacer notre caisse, suite à la modification de l’agencement de l’espace.
Crédit Bancaire : Solder le crédit
(Charge importante + non soutien de la banque)
Pour lancer notre entreprise, nous avons dû faire appel à un financeur classique.

Le remboursement de ce crédit représente une charge lourde à assumer et désormais, la banque ne peut plus nous soutenir et nous octroyer d’autres financements. Nous voudrions donc solder cette dette, pour investir cette charge mensuelle différemment, pour continuer à évoluer.
D'autres façons de nous d'aider
Nous savons que certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider :
Vous pouvez passer le mot et faire de la publicité autour de notre projet.
Utilisez les outils de partage Indiegogo !
N'hésitez pas à partager sur vos comptes Facebook, Twitter, par mail, etc... et en parler à vos amis !",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

I need your help.  My name is Richard and was doing okay until I lost my job on
4/11/14. My background has been in manufacturing for more than 26 years.
That is what happens when you get old, they just
throw you out like garbage!
So in 2010, I took up competitive shooting in the long range f-class on a
local level, joined a couple of private gun ranges, one of which has a
1000 yard range. Then on a state level as I continued improve my stats &amp
ladder. See we are ranked by the NRA by a percentage of others around
the country with similar scores, Marksman being the lowest, Sharpshooter
next up, Expert in the middle, Master and High Master being the top of
your class.  I have excelled and currently am ranked as ""High Master"" in the mid range (300 &amp
yards) and ""Expert"" at 1000 yards, and still working on my ""High Master"" degree in this
class.  I currently hold range record @ 300 yards of 600-50 X match
winner. My goal is to hold some national records as well.

Without your help, I will not be able to go and compete this year if i don't get your help in funding.  Please help as this is very important to me and my goal of becoming a great marksman.  With your help, I will be able to attend this year as this will be my 3rd nationals.
<h3>What I Need &amp
I need roughly $4,000.00.  I know, it sounds like a lot, but the National's competition is over a week long which includes many financial requirements, some of which are:
$1600 for hotels during the trip to and from for 16 days
$800 for food during the 16 day trip
$260 entry fee
$600 for fuel to and from

$360 - a 9% fee that will be charged 380 just in case of tire blow out or road side assistance
I
can not thank you guys enough for giving me this opportunity.  Reaching this goal and attending the National's championship tournament means
the world to me!!!  Even if i don't reach my goal, the funds will still
be used to get to nationals, even if i have to bum a ride and bunk up
with someone.
The Perks
<h3>When I am on my way to and from and at the match, I will send back
pics of the match and daily scores of how I am doing in my class and
over all.

The Impact

By contributing to any shooter, you
continue to grow and bring awareness to this important sport, which has seen record level's of interest over the last

several years.  They have capped this match at 320 participates.  I need your support to make this happen.  If I don't get to go I will be heartbroken.


Risks &
wind will be the biggest factor in how well everyone does or does not
do.  See, some of us (meaning me) shoot better in windy conditions as we
have wind at our range every match since we are so close to the coastline.  I
also shoot better in a boil (that is when the wind is not blowing).  The
target actually moves up  and dances around because of the Marge (heat
waves). That is a very tricky way to shoot, but i have mastered it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Ask folks to get the word out.
• Add to the fight and make some noise about my campaign.
• Forward my campaign to others in your email address book, as those other people may know other fellow marksmen who might want to contribute.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank you very much for allowing me to go to Nationals!!!
Richard

What
We’re All About
DoYouRemember is the digital destination for people who love nostalgia.
Whether it’s old TV and movies, classic rock, vintage clothing or sports
memorabilia, you can find original, compelling content on DoYouRemember.com.
The company was founded by Michael Gitter, who wrote the best-selling
series of coffee table nostalgia books, <i>Do
You Remember? in the 1990s. He’s also a 15-year advertising industry
veteran. He’s supported by a team of experienced editors, writers, graphic
artists and programmers.
We launched the site about nine months ago, and already it has a large,
rapidly growing audience of millions of fans that love all things retro.
What
We Need
We’ve been asked many times by people how they can get involved. Now you
can, as we continue to grow our business by introducing compelling new features
and develop foreign language versions of the site. With your help, we can build
the only true community of people who are eager to indulge their passion for
nostalgia. In a world gone mad, our fond memories help keep us
grounded and connect with humanity. We’re raising $250,000 to help us
continue to delight and entertain our loyal fan base.
What’s
In It For You
When you participate in this campaign, we’ll show our appreciation by
sending you a DYR hat or T-shirt
advertising and promotional opportunities, including Tweets to our 300,000
Twitter followers, Facebook posts for the millions of people who follow us
there, and editorial coverage on our site’s homepage.
The
Impact
Unlike other campaigns you may have seen, we’re up and running—fast! And
based upon a recent poll we conducted, we’re doing lots of things right, as our
users tell us they love following us.
We’re experiencing double-digit traffic growth nearly every month, and
we’re adding 2,500 Twitter followers a day! Soon, we’ll be carrying advertising
on the site, as we begin to monetize this great platform.
Risks
&amp
Having already launched and having been successful in drawing a large
audience, we’ve already proved our concept, eliminating a huge potential risk. Our
challenge is to continue growing our fan base by providing features that
inspire people to visit our site frequently, and tell their friends about it.
There’s no other site like DoYouRemember.com, and therefore, there’s no
direct competition. There are many great sites, fan clubs, blogs and Facebook
pages devoted to great old movies, musical idols and TV personalities from the
past, but there’s no place that addresses all of these interests in one
location.
We have advantages over any new player in the space as we’ve spent
several years working on our product and marketing it
column2: as such, we have a great

column1: competitive advantage.
Other
Ways You Can Do
We’ve grown our following by people discovering our site, and telling
their friends and family about it. We’d greatly appreciate you to tell others
you know who love all things retro about DoYouRemember and our IndieGoGo
campaign.

The Short Story

The moment I left base camp I knew I would never be the same.

When I went on my Vision Quest and spent 4 days completely alone in the forest, without food, I stepped through a doorway catalyzing my spiritual awakening, into a part of myself that contained my truth, my wisdom, my inner knowing. I had walked in a warrior, my spirit was awakened and a Goddess was born.

Hi, I'm Angela Wilkinson and ever since I can remember I have been fascinated and drawn to the metaphysical and spiritual - meditation, crystals, chakras, alternative healing, reiki, channeling, atlantis and everything in between.

Professionally I'm trained as a relationship therapist, I have a Masters in Counseling Psych, I love what I do and now I'm wanting to serve on a greater level by expanding how I give back. This will be my weekly Awakened Goddess radio show.
I am embracing my divine calling to serve as a leader. I am passionate about supporting women (and men) who have brilliant knowledge and a message to share, expanding love and light in the world.

This campaign and your contribution will help me launch the weekly Awakened Goddess radio show. I have 20 experts (and counting) on board and ready to share their expertise with you but to do this I need purchase equipment and pay for start-up production expenses.
UPDATE: The show is live and can be found on iTunes here:
http://bit.ly/awakenedgoddessitunes
You can also go to my website at http://thegoddessnextdoor.com/awakened-goddess-... for the current line up of show just released this week!
<div style=""background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)
column2: >Currently scheduled experts in their field include:

• Bertrand Dory - Freeing yourself from guilt
• Shakima Martinez - Starting a service based business with spirit
• Maureen Muldoon - Creating more miracles in your life
• Annie Anderson - Doing epic sh*t
• and check the campaign updates for more as they get added each day.
Some of our favorite experts I aspire to interview include:
<ul>
• Denise Duffield-Thomas - Author of Lucky Bitch
• Daryl Anka - Channel of Bashar
• Danielle LaPorte - Author of The Desire Map
<li>Leonie Dawson - Creator of Amazing Biz &amp
<li>Margaret Lynch - Creating a Wealthy Life of Meaning &amp
• Esther Hicks - Channel of Abraham
• Doreen Virtue - Angel Communicator
• Dr. Christiane Northrup - Women's Health Wisdom
• and many more!

The Awakened Goddess radio show is available on iTunes and will reach thousands, possibly millions of people. The ripple effect of those listening can exponentially support, transform and inspire many others as these gems of wisdom are shared.

Why I Need Your Help

Here's the break down...
<ul>
• Microphone - Heil PR-40 Dynamic Microphone - $327
• Heil Sound PL-2T Overhead Broadcast Boom - $120
• Ecamm call recorder - $30
• Libsyn hosting - $40/mos

• Production - $120/mos
  • Every additional dollar will go towards buying equipment and covering the start-up expenses to run the show.

Why this matters to you...

Your contribution will help me bring The Awakened Goddess radio show to life.
<li>Every Sunday you'll learn practical tools &amp
column2: tips from top experts in their field.

column1: <li>Learn <span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >new ways to increase your financial abundance, improve your relationships, and expand your awareness starting immediately.

column1: • The 30 minute Awakened Goddess radio show will be an enlightening exploration into the minds of spiritual mentors who have achieved the dreams you aspire to also have.
• Each interview will end with a very specific and practical gem you can implement into your daily spiritual practice.

I understand if you're unable to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

• I'd love your help to get the word out about my campaign. Every bit helps me on my quest!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below. It makes sharing a snap. Plus it'll track your referrals and you'll know when your friends contribute.

It's as easy as that! 

Many blessings and my heartfelt thanks to you for helping me serve on a greater level.

""Expand into your greatness, everyone will benefit""

Angela

PS...

If you are an expert in a spiritual or metaphysical topic and you'd like to be a guest please contact me through the campaign and I'll email you soon!

If you are interested in becoming a show sponsor please contact me through the campaign and I'll contact you soon.

column5: >Our first edition is due to hit the digital newsstands by October 2015. We are aware that there are issues that could arise beyond our control. We have a strong group of people
column6: editors, writers, and a creative team who will move heaven and earth to keep the work on track! We do promise to keep you informed should we need to push the date back.

column1:
How You Can Help

We would love you to pass on the word.....

The more people know about what we are doing, the easier it is to reach our goal. There are many ways to support, financial contribution, or being our evangelist - telling your friends, family, and contacts about us through social media, email, or maybe even write them a nice letter! Whatever it is, we really appreciate your support.
","Who we are

We are passionate about Africans, we want to create a platform where they can be seen as they really are: creative, resilient, entrepreneurial, artistic and innovative. We have this BIG BOLD vision to showcase the people, music, fashion, culture, media, technology and businesses from the continent and globally, in a bi monthly interactive digital magazine, ReAfrica.
What is ReAfrica?
ReAfrica puts all the content that you would usually see in a lifestyle magazine into an engaging, visual multimedia experience.

The magazine will portray the sounds and images of Africans through video, audio and animation. Each edition will have interviews, the art scene, culture, music, film, businesses,fashion and even feature a particular city in Africa so you can discover the best places to visit, things to do and meet the people.
The first edition will feature Kampala, Uganda
Angela is a budding fashion designer in Kampala. Discover the nightlife, the Boda Bodas, the budding community of animators, authentic food, and much more the city has to offer.
We need you to help us achieve this HUGE dream. Africa is large with a lot of people and a lot of stories. We want you to partner with us to tell them.
This is what the reader will get from ReAfrica magazine
6 Issues a year
80+ pages of  well researched stories, high resolution photography, high definition videos, an African city feature, celebrity profiles, informative 'How To' sections, Interviews, Events, and
A themed issue including: The Entrepreneur Issue, The Money Issue, The New Media Issue, The Music Issue, The Fashion Issue
A Multimedia Experience

ReAfrica will bring you all the great things Africans are doing in the diaspora, from those threading the board in London's West End, making independent film in Hollywood. The first feature interview will be of two Nigerian sisters making building an artisanal skin care brand in New York.
Your bit

We want to publish a digital magazine that will give the reader an indelible, unforgettable experience.  Creating an interactive digital magazine can be expensive especially the first edition,  so we have broken down the costs for the edition below

Our biggest expense is publishing the magazine which includes all the research and design that goes into creating a sustainable design, that is going to set our magazine apart from other independent magazines similar in the app store. Our team of creatives are really passionate, working tirelessly and are only being paid their expenses. The other costs involved are the cost of creating and collating content locally and internationally, design and layout, app development and campaign costs.
The Perks
'However far a stream flows, it never forgets its origin.' Yoruba Proverb
Your contribution would be extremely valuable and go a long way to make this campaign a success.
To show our gratitude, we have included a few perks. We will be adding more as we go along so please do check back often
Risks & Challenges
Our first edition is due to hit the digital newsstands by October 2015. We are aware that there are issues that could arise beyond our control. We have a strong group of people
column2: editors, writers, and a creative team who will move heaven and earth to keep the work on track! We do promise to keep you informed should we need to push the date back.

Spectral Alchemy, creators of DMT: The Spirit Molecule, presents - MYTHAPHI (pronounced mith-uh-fai) - an innovative experience from director Mitch Schultz. Welcome to the multi-dimensional storyworld and transmedia platform that aims to recode human mythology.

MYTHAPHI is four-part narrative framework, expansive online experience, and evolutionary media platform that collects and curates concepts from the leading edge of human experience, bringing visionaries together from around the world to hack culture and reality

ALL the media produced for The Spirit Molecule, AND the ENTIRE Spectral Alchemy media archive, will be fully available to stream or download for the MYTHAPHI community. Through an open source and transmedia approach to the storytelling process, we can co-create the first-ever integrated media studio for the global community.

MYTHAPHI seeks to actively engage the world so that we may collectively rediscover who we are, and re-imagine who we might become. Join us to redefine culture, reframe mythology, and redirect our purpose as a species.
Platform Features:
<ul>
• Media arts production &
• Cloud hosted open source media library: audio/music, video, FX, photos, etc
• Online RMXLab with authoring tool to create transmedia experiences
• Mesh economy/marketplace with ethical income opportunities for members
• Community hub with social media and collaboration functions
• Active forum with exclusive access to various change makers
Design Philosophy:
<ul>
• Rediscover the art of celebrating life in all its forms
• Co-create a new mythology that guides an integrative planetary culture
• Discover the latest news and information on leading edge culture and emerging technology published by expert curators from various disciplines
• Foster the emergence of innovative ways of thinking and socially conscious media - movies, music, e-books, art, apps and more
• Link with like-minded efforts to create an active network of networks
• Encourage a reconnection with nature and sustainable living practices
• Host a global community dialogue on human culture, recoding mythology
• Support the development of clean technologies designed for positive impact
MYTHAPHI’s users and curators create, connect, and trade with individuals who share a common purpose: explore paradox and support human evolution.
<div>
<div>

We live in a time of rapidly increasing complexity. As world-altering technologies continue to develop, the reality we experience as individuals changes faster than our social systems can react, pushing them to their limit. Because of this tension between aging social constructs and humankind’s newfound and ever-evolving connectivity, it may seem as if our world is fracturing — even going backwards in some ways.
But nothing could be farther from truth. As a species we are entering a new era
column2: a time when we can actively cultivate the ground we all share, rather than focusing on the differences that divide us.

column1: We firmly believe that humanity goes where we put our focus, essentially creating our own reality. So MYTHAPHI’s content will be thoughtfully produced and carefully selected to help create an entirely new story that reflects the world we wish to live in. A world that inspires and connects. A world built on transparency and ethical networks that serve the greater good. A world that celebrates our differences while subscribing to the simple truth that We Are One.
The path forward is uncharted and unknown. Through MYTHAPHI, we hope to walk that path together as an informed and engaged community dedicated to tangible change in our world.
FOUR CHANNELS, LIMITLESS POSSIBILITY

MYTHAPHI is comprised of four main channels, each focusing on a key area of exploration: MIND, ECO, MUSE and EPOCH. These channels will host a collection of hand-picked, expert curators — artists, musicians, philosophers, scientists, storytellers — all of whom operate at the very edge of emerging culture and technology.
MIND: Science, Spirit, Logos
Question the past, present and future of consciousness and our interpretation of awareness by uncovering the similarities between traditionally opposing modes of knowing.
ECO: Animal, Mineral, Plant
Explore the infinitely complex symbiosis between all things living and inert, and learn how we can rediscover a respectful relationship with our planet.
MUSE: Motion, Music, Still
Embrace the forces that move us to be makers: through art, music, video, fashion, performance — any creative expression celebrating the human spirit.
EPOCH: Act, Ethos, Conduit
Consider how MIND, ECO and MUSE come together to create a new human narrative — a story of the times in which we live, and the future we envision for ourselves.
THE PROCESS HAS BEGUN, SUPPORT ITS GROWTH

With the successful completion of our IndieGoGo campaign, MYTHAPHI will accelerate the production and delivery of four feature length iDocs (interactive documentaries), each focusing on sparking dialogue across all MYTHAPHI channels: MIND, ECO, MUSE and EPOCH. As mentioned above, ALL the media produced for these unique projects will be fully available to the community for education, remixing, and sharing.
Learn more about these documentaries and media ecologies below.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
CO-CREATE THE MYTHAPHI STORY

At launch, MYTHAPHI will offer two tiers of access. Public access is, and always will be, free. Most of our web-based content will be available at no cost, or for a very small pay-per-view donation for streaming media (feature films, documentaries, or educational collections.
For a minimal subscription fee of $2.99/month, you can become a MYTHAPHI member and enjoy the full range of benefits outlined below.
The funds raised through this campaign will go toward MYTHAPHI platform development, media production, cloud hosting and distribution, and marketing and public relations.
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
With these elements in place and securely funded, MYTHAPHI will be perfectly positioned for a robust launch and sustained growth over time.

You can participate and support this project in many ways. Donate via IndieGoGo, PayPal, and/or Bitcoin. We are also open to any other support you feel could help the project get off the ground and create positive impact around the world.
PODCASTS: Aubrey Marcus’ Warrior Poet | Christopher Ryan’s Tangentially Speaking | Amber Lyon’s Reset.me

column12: > with Talet Phillips |
column22: >Human Evolution: Who are we becoming?
column26: > by Steve McDonald |

column5: >MISC:
column12: > |
column19: > hosts Mitch/Steve |
column26: > Australia 2012 |

Texans say everything is bigger in Texas. Well, that may be but everything is better, brighter and more beautiful in California. Help us show our pride and love for California with this big billboard in Texas. Hey, maybe we can even attract some of them to come enjoy California with us.

Visit our gallery to see the full 14'x48' billboard.

Will you donate one dollar?

We're asking for a thousand people to donate $1 to help this project and when the funds are raised, Sovereign California, Inc. will purchase this billboard space from CBS Outdoors.

At its creation, the idea of Limber Tree was to find roots in its original location and to ""branch"" out from there.  At Limber Tree, we believe we can better serve the community if we have more space to hold more varieties of classes.  Wouldn't it be nice if you could attend a yoga class while your child is also taking a yoga class? Or maybe today you want a restorative class, but the scheduled class time doesn't fit in your schedule.  With an abundance of extremely skilled teachers, we want to give more options of yoga and aerial arts to serve the community more widely and we need your help!

Eat Naked: Organic, Clean, and Stripped Eating for a Better, Spicier You. Weather you're vegetarian or omnivore, raw or cooked, macrobiotic, or traditional—eating naked will boost the health benefits, and help you look great, even without your clothes on!

Eating naked is the philosophy of the Naked Chef, Jacques Laventure, from MTV's Snack Off and the 14 Minutes Snacks Cook Book. Here are a few of his Naked tips that he'll be discussing during the Cooking Demo:
•       The fresher the food, the more nutrient-dense it is.
• •       Prepared properly, so that the food’s nutritional value is preserved, even enhanced.

• Mighty tasty. Fresh food tastes better. Period.
 FOX 32 Good Day Chicago

http://www.myfoxchicago.com/clip/10764183/naked-chef-inspiring-people-to-eat-clean-and-get-fit 
 Check out his Clip on MTV's Snack Off
https://screen.yahoo.com/naked-chef-040000071.html
JOQ Cafe is attached to LA fitness Signature Club. They get 800 Check ins Daily.
I am also a Chef personality where I travel and do live cooking demos for Media, Supermarkets and corporate events.
What We Need &
We need $10,000 to have a proper Grand Opening!

Money will be used to get right Equipment and produce.Grown without toxic pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizers. • Whole, unrefined, and unpackaged. As soon as food is modified, its nutritional value is compromised.
We will be recording the behind the scenes of Opening the Cafe. We will email exclusive footage for backers.

The Impact

Called the Naked Chef as he explained that his way of cooking was to strip everything down to the basics of cooking.
Risks &

This will be a new risky approach and we are pushing the envelop with our marketing.   Jacques, also known as Fitness Joq, does tend to cook somewhat naked, but not completely. He just happens to wear nothing on top except an apron.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

• Would love if you get the word out.
  • Indiegogo share tools!

Battle for a Greener Tomorrow

Greetings, patriot! The Advertising Arts Building, the biggest little artist community in Santa Ana, has been hard at work renovating its community garden. The good news: we're already almost through! We have reached the last phase of our project (procuring plants), and we need your help with purchasing the plants.

A Special Dedication for Each Donor

We are looking to raise from $300-$500 to buy the plants we need. If you contribute (no matter how much or little), you get to name the plant you help us buy as well as a commemorative tag with your plant's name, which will be permanently displayed in our garden!

Help Us Help US!

Gardens should never feel drab. This force of unspeakable evil and adversary of freedom is exactly what we set out to destroy when we started the ""PATRIOTS FOR GREENER PASTURES"" initiative. We want make our community more beautiful both for ourselves and our guests, as well as for AAB tenants of the future. Unlike with other ""potato salad"" crowdfunding projects, where returns from generous investments are unlikely at best, you will be able to see and enjoy 100% of what your proceeds are going to if you contribute to our project!

We're Already Almost There!

This project started a month ago with two people and an idea: to beautify our communal space with minimal means and maximal creativity. Now, we're happy to say that the ""hard part"" is over.
<ul>
• Removing old/rotten furniture
• Clearing and prepping back fence
• Initial garden clean-up
• Collecting materials (pallets, soil, burlap, and chicken wire)
• Fighting off ogres and garden gnomes
• Buying paint/painting materials
• Modifying and painting pallets
• Waterproofing pallets
• Building the trellis and planters with pallets
• Attaching chicken wire to trellis
• Lining planters with burlap and filling them with soil
• Buying plants
• Planting!
We are so close to finishing our project, but we can't stop here--a garden is not a garden without plants. Please help us reach our goals today with your donation!

If You Can't Donate:

We will accept any donation, no matter how small, but if it's not the right time for you to donate, you can still help us. Please contact us if you would like to help planting the plants and seeds we buy. We would deeply appreciate your time and willingness to help this worthy cause.

Short Summary

I am a 23 year old call center manager and writer who has recently fallen on hard times and wound up living in my car, staying in parking lot, showering and getting ready for work in gyms or wherever I can.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I need a couple grand to pay the first month's rent and deposit on an appartment to get myself off the streets and catch up on some bills I've missed while I've been spending all my money just to survive.

column1: I can't offer much in return besides a personized thank you note and the promise to pay it forward.

Promote this campaign through social media.

Who am I:  Experience the ""gift of giving""!!!  I’m
a giver. I have always looked forward to surprising my friends and family with a special gift that I knew
they would love. Bringing a smile to a face is a joy in itself.  Over
the years I created and developed a variety of gift options. One of them was a bag full of
goodies.  The
bag eventually evolved into baskets filled with hot beverage items, pastries and gifts. My friends and family loved them!  Whether you drink coffee, tea
or hot chocolate,
everybody enjoys a warm treat.  My hot
beverage baskets are accompanied with a gift for the special gifting occasion at

hand.

Building my business from ground up:  When
I got laid off of my teaching position with Los Angeles Unified School District
I decided to make my hobby a business. I am an artist and a giver. Now I create

Our Story

 

""I am an 81 year old man living alone since my wife passed away and every day the Meals On Wheels people come to my house with a hot meal.  Imagine my surprise the other day when they gave me a shopping bag filled with goodies, as a Christmas gift.  The spirit of the gift far outweighed any intrinsic value.  It really gladdened my heart and brightened the day""

Meals On Wheels of Tampa is a private organization that relies on the Tampa community for volunteers and funding. We serve almost 700 homebound and elderly each day. Our mission is to Nourish the body with our hot and nutritious meals, Enrich the spirit of both the recipient and volunteer, and Strengthen the community by working with various corporations, schools and groups in the Tampa area. Most of our recipients do not have family or friends nearby and therefore, are unable to leave their home to get food or other necessities. Our oldest recipient is 103 years young and can no longer drive, while the youngest is 33 and is too weak to stand from terminal cancer.

Our recipients depend on us for a hot meal and a friendly smile from a daily volunteer. Since most of our recipients are elderly or weak from illness, they have a hard time opening water bottles, soda bottles, and cans of food. It's a task most of us take for granted, but imagine not being able to open your own drink and having to wait on someone to open it for you?

What We Need

This holiday season we would like to give our seniors and homebound recipients a magicOpener as part of our holiday gift bag.  This device will allow our recipients to easily open bottles of water or cans of food with no pain or strain.
• We need $3,000 USD to purchase 650 openers
• Watch the video to see how easy this opener is for our recipients to use and the smile on their face
• Helping your neighbors this season will bring you much happiness

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

• Please share this message to help make this holiday season a special one!
  • Visit our website to learn more about volunteer opportunities or other ways you can help at www.mowtampa.org
• Follow our story and photos on Facebook at www.facebook.com/mealsonwheelsoftampa

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3 style=""text-align: center

The General Store Seattle is specifically designed to be a distributor for a wide variety of products that fulfill the daily needs of our locavore communities. While locavorism itself is usually confined to food and beverage products, The General Store Seattle aims to broaden this “farm to table” mindset to include your everyday item needs as well.

Our goal is to provide goods that only come from local, regional, and national suppliers to help Seattleites and those in the surrounding areas live more thoughtful, healthy, and happy lives. By giving customers an efficient way to put their money where their values are, we hope to make thoughtful purchasing decisions as easy as possible.

All of our products, ranging from food, to household, to body products, to clothing and accessories, to entertainment, are hand-picked by us and come from the Pacific Northwest and the United States. Over time, this will improve not only our economy but also our self-sufficiency as a region.

Retail sales will generate the company’s profit and we are projected to make $35,788 net profit within the first year. At present, just under $50,000 start up capital is needed to launch the business. This encompasses the initial purchase of inventory for the store as well as a year of operating costs. These operating costs include rent, salaries, marketing, maintenance, sales tax, and necessary equipment.

Our first brick and mortar hub is located in the up-and-coming neighborhood of West Seattle. Inventory will be sold both in person and online so that customers who wish to put their hard-earned money directly back into their communities can shop in our store, pick up online orders, or receive bike or mail carrier delivery. The store will move to a larger location chosen for its proximity to shopping centers and foot traffic once a solid customer base and revenue flow has been established.

The General Store Seattle, LLC is an Limited Liability Company founded by Claire Jones in 2014 and owned by herself, Mark Jones, and Morgan Dolan. Claire will manage and operate the store. Claire’s retail experience is extensive - she has worked in retail for eight years in a variety of positions. Her mother was a public school teacher and her father worked redeveloping inner city neighborhoods and assisting small businesses. As such, she was raised to believe in creating opportunities within our communities. As the locavore movement grows, we hope to establish additional locations across the US.

To cover a portion of our start-up costs, we created this Indiegogo fund to generate numerous small donations. We are maximizing our online reach by promoting this fund via our website and social media sites as well as an email newsletter campaign. To thank our contributors, we will be offering a selection of one-time thank-you gifts based on donation amounts.

The financial analysis for The General Store Seattle, LLC was based on a variety of factors. Overall, we both over-estimated on costs and under-estimated on profit to provide us with a sizable “buffer zone” to prepare for the unexpected. That said, we calculated our costs using industry averages as well as the expected costs of an average rented retail space in and around West Seattle. We calculated our revenue using industry averages, the averages of our competitors, and averages based on retail square footage.

The yearly net costs projection brings us to just under $50,000 which was calculated by subtracting the estimated yearly expenses and inventory purchases from the estimated sales projections. Expenses include rent, deposits, registrations, advertising, maintenance, salaries, inventory, insurance, and necessary equipment and software.

The revenue projections, averaged between four possible retail spaces, are estimated to be around $129,500 for the first year. We were conservative in our revenue projections and graduated our sales with $3,500 for the first month of operation, $6,000 for the second month, and $12,000 per month beyond that. This does not include online sales.

We need just under $50,000 of start up capital to cover the net costs in our first year of operation. Claire Jones has pledged $5,000, Mark Jones has pledged $10,000, and Morgan Dolan has pledged $7,125 so far. These will be paid over time for a total of $22,125. If subtracted from the $50,000 start-up amount, that brings us to $27,875 still needed.
The rewards for donating to our Indiegogo campaign are as follows:
- Donate $10 &

column1: The future of our industry looks extremely bright as part of the worldwide movement toward community-based living. These mindsets are returning to the forefront and movements like locavorism, vegetarianism, organic farming and production, and the push against climate change and pollution are gradually reshaping the economics of agriculture and commercial industries thus spurring a revival of small farms and businesses.

Under the current global system, 73 cents of every dollar spent on food goes to production, distribution and advertisement. The farmer only pockets seven cents. This reflects a dire need to build a system closer to our American roots and values.

Local products, on the other hand, are more sustainable, healthier, better for the environment, and more economically positive than products sourced from large-scale, globalized production systems. A national study conducted by the Food Marketing Institute in 2009 uncovered the top three reasons consumers already buy local:

• 82% – freshness of the products
column2: >• 75% – support for the local economy
column3: >• 58% – knowing the source of the product

column2:
>

The locavore movement is growing, and the opportunities for entrepreneurs are ripe. Based on research conducted by the USDA Economic Research Service, the movement was estimated to have generated $4.8 billion in sales in 2008, and it was projected that locally grown foods generated nearly $7 billion in sales in 2012. Not only is it a sound lifestyle choice, but it is a sound business choice as well.

column1: In Seattle specifically, King County farmers’ markets are pulling in an estimated $30 million annually. Small farms are popping up everywhere in the region, ringing up annual sales ranging from $10,000 to more than $1 million. The Pacific Northwest area is particularly ripe for an ethically-minded business like ours because it serves as the fertile crescent of the United States. Not only do we have all kinds of environmental habitats and climate zones that are ideal for many different crops, but we have an abundance of local craftspeople and artisans who are devoted to quality, handmade products.

Not only do consumers and producers benefit, but the regions’ economies benefit as well. Michael Shuman, a business-development specialist, completed studies on Cleveland, Detroit and New Mexico, quantifying the economic impact localized food can make on a community: What if Cleveland produced 25% more of its food locally? A seismic shift occurs: $4.2 billion in revenues, $125 million in taxes, and 27,000 new jobs.

According to Shuman’s work with the Community Food Enterprise (CFE), a nonprofit partially funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, local businesses keep dollars in local circulation, stick around longer, and have a higher obligation to the community at large.
column2:
>Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

column1:
• Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Or simply use the Indiegogo share tools!

We are asking you to please help make our dream a reality, so let’s join forces and get to work!

Woof Woof
Who doesn’t need help with
their children practicing healthy habits by eating more fruits and
vegetables?  Look no further Jasper State is here to the rescue! I
entertain children ages 3+ by eating my green beans. Yes, in real life I eat
lots of green things, like peas, snow peas, broccoli and asparagus.
I make the word “Green Things”
fun! Because we all know, kids don't like the word “vegetables.""  I'm a cute pooch, a Miniature Chocolate
Poodle, who travels with Judith Johnson, my bark interpreter. My books and
games promote physical activity and healthy eating habits.
“Feeling Great with Jasper
State Eat Your Green Things Every Day” was my first book. It's entertaining and
comes with a CD that reads the book to your kids while you’re busy. When you
hear me bark turn the page.
I use fun language such as
calling vegetables “green things, yellow things, red things, and orange
things.” It’s a great way to teach children, not to mention the adults in their
lives, to be healthier eaters and active players! It’s all in a days work for me
at the ""FDA,"" the Food and Doggie Administration.
I need your financial support to complete my
second book in my thirteen book series. Your donation will help with the costs
of illustrating and printing  ""Jasper State: Rainbow Garden Party."" It
will also help fund my updated website – which is not only entertaining but has
plenty of information for kids and parents. Your help will allow me to get the
word out about healthy eating and exercise to even more children! That’s
wooftacular, barkalicious, it's almost as great as a bowl of green beans!
<span>Thanks for your support and

don't forget our pledge, ""Eat your green things everyday!""

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

My bark interpreter, Judith Johnson is one smart cookie. She published my first book with barely a dollar but a big dream. She's learned quite a few lessons about navigating the publishing world and with your help she can do it bigger and better with my second book. A former public relations manager she's worked with celebrities (none as cute as me of course) and ran a successful production company.

column1:
No Money, No Problem

I totally understand if you are unable to donate to our campaign at this time, I usually just deal in kibble and tail wags. You can still play a large part in our success by sharing our campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, strangers, any and every body! (even mailmen)!  We're not picky. Send them a link to this page. We want to get the word out and appreciate your help!

endLine

We are a small team based out of MIT in Cambridge, MA. Our team, Aditya Mishra, Andrew Wooten, Rafael Zardain and Valentin Perez, is developing an app that is going to save people from lines! With endLine, you can pre-order and pre-pay for your morning coffee or tea, and pick it up when it's ready!

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

To help turn our project into a sustainable business we need your help! Our goals for the near future include signing up 60 independent cafes, and opening our app to android users and browsers. Our dream is to get endLine to your favorite coffee shop, but we need your help to do it!

column1: As a reward for your donations, we will send you our limited edition fundraising endLine produce! Moreover, you get to be part of a project that will change the world in the little way we know how!

The Impact

endLines is an idea that first originated from a summer program called Launch. Our team came together and tried to solve the problem of wasting time. Time is the one thing people cannot get back in their lives, therefore we set out eliminate lines and waits in order to give customers instant satisfaction and a greater experience at coffee shops and cafés.
So please spread the word!
Share about us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! #endline

Short Summary (note some recent changes*)

The pool on HMCC grounds has been in use for over 60 years.  The Town of Hantsport has been operating the pool for nearly a decade, and have recently decided not to open it for the summer of 2014.  For the first time in its history, the pool would be closed. 

But........
column2: >'Save our Pool', a group of citizens and friends of the Hantsport Pool formed as a response to Hantsport Town Council's decision that they could not afford to operate the pool.
column3: >HMCC was approached and asked if they would operate the pool if enough money could be raised.  The HMCC board of directors met, and passed a motion to operate the pool, conditional upon monies being raised and insurance, staff and preparation of the pool being taken care of.
column4: >Nearly 100 people came out on short notice to a barbecue to support our efforts to raise money so that Hantsport Memorial Community Center could operate the pool.  Many have pledged their intentions to buy Family Passes to the pool for the summer.
column20:
What You Get

The Town estimates that the pool cost just under $25,000 to operate last year.  Options exist (such as: reduced hours, different staffing models, etc.), that could allow the pool to open and operate with less money, but our goal will be to raise enough to fully operate the pool for the summer.

We have set a modest goal for this online campaign ($2,500 in 45 days).  

*If you have already pledged to purchase a Family Pass (at our barbecue), thank you.  You will receive a phone call with more information.  You can also contribute here, note the perks added to the right of this page.
column23:
>(you can also email: hantsportpool@gmail.com for more information). 

  • If we do not raise enough money to open the pool, *any passes purchased will be refunded at the buyer's request*.  All donations will be put toward an effort to open the pool next summer (2015).  In the event that the pool proves to be impossible to open, even next year, all monies will be donated to youth recreation at HMCC.

The Impact

Your contributions will help!  Every dollar we raise gets us closer to our goal of opening the pool and providing this facility to our community and everyone who comes to visit.

Please help us reach (and, hopefully, exceed!) our goal of raising $2,500 through this campaign.  Everything raised here will be added to our other efforts and put toward Hantsport's Pool.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

column1: • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
• We may need some help (labour, etc.) to get the pool ready before opening.

<li>If you know a company that might want to help, send them our way!  We are developing a signage campaign also, that would allow supportive companies to advertise around the pool.  <b style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column4: >Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

column1:
Thanks!  Let's get the ball rolling!

About our ""Tough Mudders!!!""

Living with a rare genetic condition or with a family member with a rare genetic condition can be tough, although for some it is a challenge that they take on head first...  This group are one ""Tough Mudder"" and they are doing it for us...
• Victoria is the fearless leader of team ruby
• Saraya is the mother of Ruby who is a part of OzEd community
• Stan is the father of Ruby and will be doing the heavy lifting on the day of tough mudder :)

• Harrison is our fitness army expert and will be guiding us on the day


    • What is Ectodermal Dysplasia?

Ectodermal Dysplasia (ED) is a rare genetic condition and is estimated to affect approximately 1 out of every 100,000 births.  The condition affects Ectodermal structures including Sweat and Tear Glands, hair, skin, nails and teeth.  There are almost 200 types of ED ranging from mild through to types where a child will die by the age of around two years.

One of the more common affects of ED include reduced or absent sweat glands meaning the child cannot sweat and regulate body temperature.  This in Australia can have significant impacts on the lifestyle of the person and in children their whole family.

Who are ozED?

We are a 100% volunteer operated organisation which means 100% of donations go to our programs and not ""administration"".
ozED - Australian Ectodermal Dysplasia Support Group is a fully registered Australian (DGR and TCC) charity. We were established in 2004 to help families and people affected by a rare genetic condition called Ectodermal Dysplasia (ED). 
We have state representatives in each state where we have members (all states except Tasmania
column2:
Northern Territory and Australian Capital Territory).  As well as the Camphrence we hold family days.

Being a rare genetic condition and given the size of Australia are members are not only isolated because of the condition but may be geographically isolated as well.  To address this issue we teleconference each of our meetings.  This allows members to participate regardless of their geographic location.

We are actively involved with Australian based programs such as Rare Voices Australia.  We are members of the International Ectodermal Dysplasia Network (IEDN) and we are leading an international project on behalf of the IEDN to introduce an Ectodermal Dysplasia platform to RareConnect which is a European Rare Diseases Organisation program.

column1:
Some of the stuff we do!!!

Case Study One

A teenage boy affected by HED (non-sweating form of ED) attends the first camphrence.  In the lead up to the Camphrence he had been withdrawn from the family including avoiding family times like meals.

The night after returning home from Camphrence with his Mum, he went up to her at bed time and gave her a kiss and said ""Thanks for the best weekend of my life, I love you"".  The Mum rang ozED at 10.30PM to tell us of this, she was in tears, and that was the impetus for these Camphrences as they make a real difference to our members life.

Case Study Two

At camphrence we were talking to our parents about one impact, being the lack of effective tear ducts leading to dry eye condition.  This needs to be treated with eye drops three or four times per day. 

One mother who had not had her male child eye tested expressed real concern as her son hated any treatment about his ED.  She contacted ozED a couple of weeks later and let us know she had the eye test and her son had dry eye and needed the eye drops.  She told him and explained that he needed eye drops, his reply was ""Don't stress Mum, I have ED and the other kids need eye drops..."" This demonstrated the success of our subtle sessions on ED with the kids.  The Mum was amazed to say the least.

THRE ARE OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!!!!!

We appreciate that not everyone can help financially and with so many causes to support..

There are a couple of ways of helping.
<li>Forward this campaign to all of your friends
column3: colleagues and businesses that you know.  If only one of them makes a contribution, you will have helped our members, and that is a brilliant outcome.

column1: • Support our sponsors and tell them that you are supporting them because they supported ozED.
• Encourage your workplace/local school to run a free dress day with a small gold coin donation with the proceeds to go to ozED.
• Join our Facebook page and be kept up to date with what is happening in our world.
• Encourage your family and friends to join the ozED Facebook page as the more awareness we can generate about this rare condition the better informed our whole community is.

Nickle Creek's Annual Take Child Fishing Derby is a one day free, event held the last Saturday In June. We have over 200 children that participate in the derby, plus their family. Each and every child that participates receives a prize bag filled with fishing tackle and other goodies. Each bag has a value of over $200. Grand prizes are issued to 1st, 2nd &
column2: 3rd place for the largest sunfish or blue gill in 4 age groups. Grand prizes are combo rods &amp
column3:
reels, tackle boxes and tackle. A total of 12 grand prizes are issued. We provide door prizes and many other giveaways as well as a full lunch for all participants and family members at no cost. The derby is built on the mission to make a differnce for the youths in our community. Our goal is to provide at least one day that families come together and just spend time together having fun and not spending money. We do provide an optional Chinese auction as a fundraiser. We hope, and have been whitness to this event also providing fishing as a life long hobby, which in turn teaches the children patients, respect for the outdoors , family value and that fun can be had without getting in to trouble, drugs or being stuck indoors.

Our efforts are paying off, this years derby will be our 12th year. We have grown in record numbers over those years. However, our support has sadly decreased with respect to product donations that we use as prizes. We need help to continue to provide the derby in the fashion it has become known for. HUGE &
column4:
SO MUCH FUN!!! We adverege about $5000 in prize give aways during a single derby year. Our goal at this point is to buy in bulk at our wholesale pricing and attempt to have several years of stock. We hope to raise this money with crowdfunding. Can you help?

We're grateful — no, floored!  by your support: more than 75% above our  goal. Thank you, thank you, Indiegogo community. If you're ever in the Philadelphia suburbs, please stop by the store to check out our selection and for us to thank you in person:

Open Book Bookstore
7900 High School Rd
Elkins Park, PA 19027
<h1 style=""font-weight: bold

column2: >We're so grateful! We not only surpassed our initial goal, but now we've passed our stretch goal! The ""Open"" sign is on the door, the ""Grand Opening"" banner is in the window, and new bookshelves are set up. Books are on shelves, orders are placed with distributors and publishers, and we've picked up QuickBooks (which we guess we need to learn to use now). Thank you to all of you who have contributed to our campaign, ordered books or gift certificates, and shared the news that ""there's a new bookstore in town!""

column1: All that said, we're going to push our luck, and ask for you to keep those contributions coming. Per our previously stated stretch goals, we will split additional funds we collect as follows:
<ul>
• Inventory: 70%
• Furnishing/Fixtures: 15%
• Working Capital: 15% for marketing, advertising &

We've already had more than 100 contributors—neighbors, friends, colleagues, and anonymous patrons—and passed all of our expectations, so I'm not sure what we dare to expect, so I'm not going to state any specifics. We still have several perks available (including Open Book mugs, free books, or Lynn at your dinner party), and we've added new perks (for instance, lifetime discounts) as incentives,
How far can you dare to go? You decide!
UPDATE: 1-13-2015
column4: >There's no turning back! We're in the final stretch!
column7: >Our Indiegogo campaign is starting its final week, our bookshelves, window, and display table are filling with books, and we're preparing for our official Grand Opening. Tomorrow, I'm heading out to purchase some little banners like these:

column1: It’s unbelievable! We are thrilled and grateful for the support we have received so far from our friends, colleagues, and community for our new Open Book Bookstore. Only 12 days into the campaign and we already achieved our initial goal.

But we’re not going to stop! Now that our campaign reached its first milestone, we’re adding another. That’s right, we’re continuing our campaign and adding a stretch goal of $8,000. With your continued help we can do more than we initially imagined!
Your CONTINUED contributions to the Open Book Bookstore will help as follows:
<ul>
<li>

Inventory Expansion: 50% of additional funds raised will be committed to adding more non-fiction, young adult/teen, and classic titles, and to add to the fiction and children’s books sections we’ve been developing.

column2: >Also, we’ve had requests to add a poetry section and some art books.
