column2: Fixtures: 30% will go towards things like

column1: • More shelving units to hold book inventory.
• A cashwrap/checkout station with a locked cash drawer.
<li>
We have our eye on some small “vintage” (read “old”) pieces of furniture for our window display (to go along with the vintage Smith &
column2: Corona typewriter we put there already).

column1: <ul><li>
Working Capital: 20% will be set aside, allocated to ongoing need for marketing &
• Designing and printing flyers for store events
• Running occasional ads in local publications
• Better signage for the store exterior
• Printing bookmarks and other branded store items such as mailing labels
• Event funds: for refreshments and author travel-related expenses.
INITIAL POST 12-19-2014
We want to bring a much-needed bookstore to the Philly suburbs.
<span style=""font-size: 24px
More and more people these days care about supporting local businesses and eating locally-grown
food. <span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column4: >There’s something else we believe in and support.
column7: >We like to say:

column1: That’s
why, following up on our long careers in the book publishing industry,<b> we’re opening a
bookstore in our town.
The independent bookstore is making a comeback.
There are more than 2,000 independent bookstores in the U.S. for the first time since 2005. And indie bookstores play a very important role in their communities.
According to the American
Booksellers Association:
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Spend $100 at a local bookstore and $68 of that stays in your

column1: community. Spend the same $100 at a national chain, and your community only
sees $43.
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >More independents means more choice, more diversity, and a truly

column1: unique community.
Why Us: What We’ve Already Accomplished
Books have always been our shared passion, and throughout our various jobs in publishing, our mission has been to help get books into the hands of readers:
<ul>
• Lynn has been an editor, literary agent, bookstore event manager, professor of English and graduate publishing, and an author.
• Evan has been a book marketer, ghostwriter, copywriter and a proofreader, and managed a bookstore.
For the last several years, Lynn has been running Open Book, a popular program of author events and book discussion classes.
Two years ago, we opened a wholesale account with a distributor so Lynn’s students and class attendees could buy their books from her.
Last year, we added a “pop up” mobile bookstore, which appeared periodically at the local co-op, preschool, and elsewhere.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
Now we’re about to embark on a new project that is the culmination of all we’ve loved, learned and done: making Open Book a real bricks-and-mortar bookstore!
Our little bookstore will be a place where people gather, not only to find good books, but to talk about them with others who care about books
column2: where people can attend author readings, book discussion classes, after-school story hours and more.

column1: We will put our expertise and experience in the publishing industry to work, along with our skills choosing and recommending books.
We'll sublet a few hundred square feet
column4: >in town for a small, highly-curated collection focused on literary and classic fiction and nonfiction, young adult &
column5: children’s books, and a range of books by local authors in the Greater Philadelphia area.

column1: We're looking for $5,000 in funding to help us during the important first few months to
• Build up our inventory
• Purchase additional shelving
• Implement a point-of-sale system that includes printing receipts, a cash drawer and perhaps a barcode scanner
• Join the regional and national bookselling associations and local business merchant group, securing our role in the community
<li>
Promote and advertise the store in the region
• Setup an effective online presence
Help us out and you could also get some nifty bookmarks, a stylish tote bag, a year's worth of personal book recommendations, signed books, or even a dinner party with an author!
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
With your help, Open Book can become a shopping destination
for our community, a place that <b>supports reading, culture, conversation, and
learning.
column4: >If you can't contribute right now, you can still help:

column1: <ul>
<li>
Like us on Facebook and tell your friends on Twitter (#openbookphilly)
<li>
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread to word about our campaign
<li>
Share the news with friends, neighbors, soccer moms, little league dads, folks at your place of worship, and with your kids' teachers,
• Get the word out! Buy indie! Read local!

We're grateful — no, floored!  by your support: more than 75% above our  goal. Thank you, thank you, Indiegogo community. If you're ever in the Philadelphia suburbs, please stop by the store to check out our selection and for us to thank you in person:
Open Book Bookstore7900 High School RdElkins Park, PA 19027

We're so grateful! We not only surpassed our initial goal, but now we've passed our stretch goal! The ""Open"" sign is on the door, the ""Grand Opening"" banner is in the window, and new bookshelves are set up. Books are on shelves, orders are placed with distributors and publishers, and we've picked up QuickBooks (which we guess we need to learn to use now). Thank you to all of you who have contributed to our campaign, ordered books or gift certificates, and shared the news that ""there's a new bookstore in town!""
All that said, we're going to push our luck, and ask for you to keep those contributions coming. Per our previously stated stretch goals, we will split additional funds we collect as follows:
Inventory: 70%
Furnishing/Fixtures: 15%
Working Capital: 15% for marketing, advertising & events

We've already had more than 100 contributors—neighbors, friends, colleagues, and anonymous patrons—and passed all of our expectations, so I'm not sure what we dare to expect, so I'm not going to state any specifics. We still have several perks available (including Open Book mugs, free books, or Lynn at your dinner party), and we've added new perks (for instance, lifetime discounts) as incentives,
How far can you dare to go? You decide!

UPDATE: 1-13-2015 There's no turning back! We're in the final stretch! Our Indiegogo campaign is starting its final week, our bookshelves, window, and display table are filling with books, and we're preparing for our official Grand Opening. Tomorrow, I'm heading out to purchase some little banners like these:
UPDATE: 1-2-2015

It’s unbelievable! We are thrilled and grateful for the support we have received so far from our friends, colleagues, and community for our new Open Book Bookstore. Only 12 days into the campaign and we already achieved our initial goal.

But we’re not going to stop! Now that our campaign reached its first milestone, we’re adding another. That’s right, we’re continuing our campaign and adding a stretch goal of $8,000. With your continued help we can do more than we initially imagined!
Your CONTINUED contributions to the Open Book Bookstore will help as follows:

Inventory Expansion: 50% of additional funds raised will be committed to adding more non-fiction, young adult/teen, and classic titles, and to add to the fiction and children’s books sections we’ve been developing.
Also, we’ve had requests to add a poetry section and some art books.
Furnishing & Fixtures: 30% will go towards things like
More shelving units to hold book inventory.
A cashwrap/checkout station with a locked cash drawer.
We have our eye on some small “vintage” (read “old”) pieces of furniture for our window display (to go along with the vintage Smith & Corona typewriter we put there already).
Working Capital: 20% will be set aside, allocated to ongoing need for marketing & advertising and author events:
Designing and printing flyers for store events
Running occasional ads in local publications
Better signage for the store exterior
Printing bookmarks and other branded store items such as mailing labels
Event funds: for refreshments and author travel-related expenses.
INITIAL POST 12-19-2014
We want to bring a much-needed bookstore to the Philly suburbs.
Why We Are Here
More and more people these days care about supporting local businesses and eating locally-grown
food. There’s something else we believe in and support. We like to say: Read Local.
That’s
why, following up on our long careers in the book publishing industry, we’re opening a
bookstore in our town.
The independent bookstore is making a comeback.
There are more than 2,000 independent bookstores in the U.S. for the first time since 2005. And indie bookstores play a very important role in their communities.
According to the American
Booksellers Association:
Spend $100 at a local bookstore and $68 of that stays in your
community. Spend the same $100 at a national chain, and your community only
sees $43.
More independents means more choice, more diversity, and a truly
unique community.
Why Us: What We’ve Already Accomplished
Books have always been our shared passion, and throughout our various jobs in publishing, our mission has been to help get books into the hands of readers:
Lynn has been an editor, literary agent, bookstore event manager, professor of English and graduate publishing, and an author.
Evan has been a book marketer, ghostwriter, copywriter and a proofreader, and managed a bookstore.
For the last several years, Lynn has been running Open Book, a popular program of author events and book discussion classes.
Two years ago, we opened a wholesale account with a distributor so Lynn’s students and class attendees could buy their books from her.
Last year, we added a “pop up” mobile bookstore, which appeared periodically at the local co-op, preschool, and elsewhere.
What's Next: What We Need & What You Get
Now we’re about to embark on a new project that is the culmination of all we’ve loved, learned and done: making Open Book a real bricks-and-mortar bookstore!
Our little bookstore will be a place where people gather, not only to find good books, but to talk about them with others who care about books
column2: where people can attend author readings, book discussion classes, after-school story hours and more.

column1: We will put our expertise and experience in the publishing industry to work, along with our skills choosing and recommending books.

We'll sublet a few hundred square feet in town for a small, highly-curated collection focused on literary and classic fiction and nonfiction, young adult & children’s books, and a range of books by local authors in the Greater Philadelphia area.
We're looking for $5,000 in funding to help us during the important first few months to
Build up our inventory
Purchase additional shelving
Implement a point-of-sale system that includes printing receipts, a cash drawer and perhaps a barcode scanner
Join the regional and national bookselling associations and local business merchant group, securing our role in the community
Promote and advertise the store in the region
Setup an effective online presence
Help us out and you could also get some nifty bookmarks, a stylish tote bag, a year's worth of personal book recommendations, signed books, or even a dinner party with an author!
Other Ways You Can Help
With your help, Open Book can become a shopping destination
for our community, a place that supports reading, culture, conversation, and
learning. If you can't contribute right now, you can still help:
Like us on Facebook and tell your friends on Twitter (#openbookphilly)
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread to word about our campaign
Share the news with friends, neighbors, soccer moms, little league dads, folks at your place of worship, and with your kids' teachers,
Get the word out! Buy indie! Read local!",7.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Elkins Park, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/open-book-campaign-success-you-can-still-donate/pica

    ","Organic Mechanics & Mogreena Garden Project (MGP)

Organic Mechanics Soil Co has been making earth friendly & artisan potting soils, soil amendments, and fertilizers since 2006. The Mogreena Garden Project was founded in 2010. Both were heavily damaged after experiencing the worst flood in 42 years.

This campaign helps offset expenses associated with the flood. Funds will be used to help keep the doors open and lights on at Organic Mechanics and will help the Mogreena Garden Project feed more people through the Chester County Food Bank in 2015.
By donating to this campaign, you are also helping to support all the educational demonstration gardens supported by Organic Mechanics throughout the year.
Learn more about us and our 100% Organic products us at www.organicmechanicsoil.com
What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking $40,000 in funding. We lost more than this as a result of the flood. The funds will be used as follows:
50% used to help keep the lights on and doors open at Organic Mechanics
38% used for the amazing rewards & perks available to donors (including all the donations to the Mogreena Garden Project)
9% paid to indiegogo for their hosting service
3% paid out for processing fees

If we don't reach the goal of $40,000 we will still fulfill all donor perks purchased, but we wouldn't be able to continue our history of donating to community organizations. We would struggle to be successful in 2015.
Last minute gifts for gardeners! We have lots of options for Organic Mechanics products, including soils and fertilizers, and our famous T-Shirts!
Need a present for someone who has everything? Give them the gift of philanthropy by choosing a perk that plants a garden at the MGP.
The Impact

Each year Organic Mechanics donates an average of 40 cubic yards of soil to community based projects that teach people the value in growing your own food, eating healthy, and giving back to the local community.

In 2014, recipients of such donations included Temple (University) Community Garden, PHS (Pennsylvania Horticulture Society), Chipping Hill Micro Farm, Awbury Arboretum, The Land Conservancy, Baylor Women's Correctional Institution, Nuture Nature Center, Conestoga High School, Seashore Childrens Garden (Children's Hospital of Philadelphia), & The Peterson Garden Project.

Your campaign contribution helps us continue this mission, both by direct impact on Organic Mechanics, Mogreena Garden Project & Chester County Food Bank and indirectly by helping us donate more soil to community projects.

Donating to this project helps feed people in need. 1 in 10 people in Chester County need the services provided by the Chester County Food Bank to put food on the table each day. Choosing perks that benefit the MGP will increase the size & diversity of the MGP, thereby increasing the amount of produce donated each year!
We helped conceive the MGP in 2010 and this campaign renews our commitment to expanding the size and scope of this beautiful and philanthropic garden.
If you're local and want to see the gardens planted as a result of YOUR donation, please join us on a garden night! For more information contact us at mark@organicmechanicsoil.com

Risks & Challenges  We know we may not achieve this goal, but we have to try. We can build this garden together! We are going to utilize all our connections to get this project in front of as many eyes as possible! It starts with YOU.
Our horticultural skills will be put to good use planting all gardens donated to this project. We have a dedicated core of volunteers ready to plant all these gardens in spring 2015.

We are choosing the flexible payment option, which means if we don't get funded 100%, we will still receive all pledged donations. All product perks will be sent out and all donated garden perks will be implemented at the MGP.
Other Ways You Can Help  Please help us share this story via Facebook, Twitter and all forms of social media!
Even if you can't donate, please share to spread the word. The wider net we cast, the closer we can come to achieving our goal.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word!   THANK YOU!!!!!!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column3: >The Bukhari family needs your help to raise money to pay for four US residency application fees. With any additional monies that are raised, we will open a CD for their future. The Bukhari’s have overcome persecution and imprisonment in a foreign country and now they finally call Houston their home. Despite hardships, Syed Bukhari and his family have a new start and are working to better their lives.
column7:
>

Thanks to Neighborhood Centers Inc., the largest non-profit in Texas, ranked in the top 1% of charitable groups in the nation,Syed’s two daughters are attending school while building a foundation to a brighter future.  Neighborhood Centers Inc. provides families like the Bukharis with services for educational, economic, and social development in the Houston area. With their help, the Bukhari family is working toward establishing roots and contributing to their community.  We are asking for your contribution to help Syed and his family build a better foundation for their future. We want to help provide them with a realistic opportunity to succeed in this community they love to call home.
column10: >Citizenship and Immigration program at Neighborhood Centers, the Bukhari family will use your contributions to pay for the applications for permanent residency.

column1: Who We Are:
column2:
>

We are Adeola, Brenda and Sandra, students at the University of Houston-Downtown. We are taking the opportunity to raise money for Syed and his family in order to fill a group project requirement for the Non-Profit Organizations in America Course led by Mary Rodriguez. We are excited to be a part of this project and help such a wonderful family.

column1: Your Contributions:

column2:
>The funds will pay for four residency application fees for Syed, his wife and two daughters. The remainder of the money will be used to open a 36 month CD for the family at the Promise Credit Union. This credit union serves low-income families with exceptional rates for CD’s and other services. 

Your Help:
column3: >We often find ourselves thinking of ways to help others without making it past just thoughts. We now have the opportunity to help an entire family and all future generations with the chance of a better life
column4: “a slice of the American dream”. Your contribution, no matter the size, will make a great impact in their future. Thank you in advance for your kind support.
column5:
>Other Ways You Can Help:

You can also help this campaign by sharing it with your friends. Please help spread the word and help us reach our goal! Please share it on your Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter page. Any help is greatly appreciated by us, the college students, and the family that is not aware of this initiative.

Short Summary

Hi, my name is Melanie Clark. I am a healthcare contractor currently without a contract. I am not on unemployment or receiving any assistance. I am actively seeking full-time work. My husband is a hard-working OTR (over the road) truck driver who just started a new job. He has not gotten a paycheck yet. We are behind on our rent and face eviction by the end of this month. It is just a matter of terrible timing.

What We Need &
This is just to bridge the gap until my husband gets paid. However, I am willing to put my sewing skills to good use and give something in return.
For $5, I will make you a fabric bird ornament for your Christmas tree, or just for decoration.
For $25, I will make you a mini photo album/brag book.
For $60, I will make you a  cotton lap quilt or a baby quilt, 45"" x 50"".
If there is one person willing to contribute the full amount, I will make you a custom cotton quilt with matching pillow shams, up to a King size.
Examples of some of my work can be found here:
https://mellieqwilts.squarespace.com
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Honestly, we're just in a bad spot. Your help will allow my family to have a roof over our heads and alleviate the feelings of dread and panic that accompany a situation like this.
In return, you will have both a unique, hand made item and my eternal gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help spread the word. Thank you!

Other ways you can help the library

  • Spread the word about our website amongst your friends.
• Donate Spanish language children's books and/or educational materials to the project.
• If you are in Lobitos, spare a few hours and spend time helping children read.

• Put us in touch with people you know who work in education and have the resources to help our project.

If you wish to contribute outside this website, please email us at librosalobitos@gmail.com

","Project Summary

Libros a Lobitos is a project with big dreams and realistic goals. It was founded by passionate educators who, after a year of teaching in the local school, realized that English education (while important) was blatantly a secondary concern when compared to more basic educational needs.

A community-wide survey that revealed whisperings of illiteracy in Lobitos’ older generations contributed to the inspiration to establish a program that would not only promote literacy but also ignite a love of literature and aid in fostering a generation of young readers.

We have a simple and straightforward goal: get books into kids’ hands. We aim to create a space that promotes and strengthens a love for reading in Lobitos’ youth and helps create positive memories associated with education, from a young age. Biblioteca Lobitos (the Lobitos Library) is a place where children of all ages can come to nurture their creativity, play, learn and explore.

As the project grows, we are eternally grateful for all of the wonderful people who have seen value in what we are doing and want to be a part of it. The children of Lobitos have left an undeniable mark on many who have been fortunate enough to pass through this special place. Thank you for joining us in our mission to do right by these kids and provide them access to all of the resources that they need and deserve.
Positive Impact:
“Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world”
- Nelson Mandela

2013 data collection by UNESCO Institute for Statistics identified Peru as having one of the lowest literacy rates in Latin America with over 12% of the adult population unable to read or write.  Despite economic growth in recent years, there has been little investment in the social services sector.  It is estimated that 40% of Peruvians live below the poverty threshold with 14% living on less than one US dollar a day.

In Lobitos, the disparity is particularly visible. In recent years, there has been tremendous growth and as a result of the surf and oil industries.  Unfortunately, economic barriers have largely hindered local people's ability to invest in establishing businesses that allow them to reap the benefits of this development.  As Lobitos changes, the wealth gap in this small community continues to widen.  Libros A Lobitos is one of few educational initiatives working to close that gap by making educational opportunities and resources accessible to all.
Library funding needs and our recognition to you

There are many things that we need for this project, but we are firstly focusing on establishing a community library and providing educational classes for the children of Lobitos: they are our number one priority.

The project is currently operating ´hand to mouth´, this is neither sustainable nor fair to the children of Lobitos using our facilities. Our project goal is to raise 9850 USD to setup a fully functioning community library and operate it for the entire year of 2015. This amount of money is absolutely necessary  to provide a huge positive impact for hundreds of children in Lobitos. Without your help we cannot guarantee that the library will be open all year.
The following is a complete itemised breakdown by priority of what we will do with your funds:
1. Community library initial outlay:
Item:
Cost (USD):
1. Repairs and
renovations for our leaky roof
2. First aid box
3. Fire extinguisher
4. Local flyers of the project
5. Community inauguration party
6. Electrical fittings brought to code
7. Educational materials (pencils, pens etc.)
8. Printer
9. Library furniture (tables, desks, shelving etc.)
10. Purchasing of new childrens books
Total cost of initial outlay:
2. Community library operational overheads:
Item:
Monthly cost (USD):
Annual cost (USD):
1. Program materials
2. Location rental and children´s transport to/ from the library
3. Admin stipend
Total cost of operational overhead:

Please note: We will also create a sub page on the librosalobitos.com website that will give funders access to this project´s expense spread sheet: we believe in 100% transparency in where and how your money is spent. This campaign is fiscally sponsored by the not for profit 501-(c) Beyond the Surface International (EIN 27-1617474)
Limited funding: No problem, we will focus on firstly purchasing items needed in the initial outlay (the first table) and then fund overhead expenditure on a month by month basis (second table).

Excess funding: Wow, there will definitely be a lot of very happy children in Lobitos! If we exceed financing expectations, after funding everything outlined in the tables above, we will think of extra curricular projects that can be run sustainably from the community library. When we have discussed potential projects with local stakeholders, we will put these concepts on our facebook page and allow you to vote on the project that you would like to see implemented.

Donate Spanish language children's books and/or educational materials to the project.
If you are in Lobitos, spare a few hours and spend time helping children read.

Put us in touch with people you know who work in education and have the resources to help our project.If you wish to contribute outside this website, please email us at librosalobitos@gmail.com",3.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Hi there,
I'm Alicia D. Lurye, Organizer of RocCon.  And a life-long pop culture fan.

We want to thank all of you for coming to the 4th annual show in September!  It was the best attended yet with wonderful guests.   Thanks to anyone who's come to RocCon in any year since our 1st show in 2011.

column4: >   As of now, we can only afford to put on as good a show as we did for 2014 and we want to do better than that!  That's why we're here on Indigogo.

column1: As we go forward things have gotten crazy in ""convention land"".  Conventions from all over have us competing for the big ""name stars"" that we can afford on the weekend RocCon is held and the weeks just before and just after. This includes events held in other countries!   Conventions are announcing their guests earlier and earlier so the competition for guests is stronger.  Especially the icons of the comics, film, tv and anime industies.

column4: >   It's simple.  Bringing in the bigger stars for RocCon takes money.  More than we have.   We are also in competition with every convention on the same weekend and on the weekends before and after.  Even conventions not in the U.S.  Many of us want the same stars.

column1: So, we've decided to have a crowd-funding campaign to help us with the large expenses of bringing in the biggest names we can find.   Simply stated, the money will be used to bring in some of the guest stars that have higher price tags.  No, it won't end up being enough to get us a ""Big Bang Theory"" star,  Shatner or Stan Lee, but hopefully get us into that 20K price range that many of the people you want to see command.  And that 20K does not include their first class airfare, hotel, food and some need all that for a companion as well.   You can see, getting stars anywhere is not cheap.
We hope that you will truly continue to make RocCon ""YOUR"" convention by helping us grow!  Please donate now.  All monies will go to special guest expenses.
In the meantime, here's a stroll down memory lane.....RocCon from the beginning.

column4: >   In 2010, after coming back from San Diego Comic Con, I realized that there was not, as of yet, a large, multi-genre
column7: >Comic Con /Pop Culture Show in Western, NY.  There was a all out anime event, a sci fi event, some comic book only shows and a few gaming events, but nothing that melded the genres and brought us all together for a big party like in other cities.

column4: >    On the 3rd Saturday in September, 2011, RocCon was born!  The picture below was taken early on Day 1.  When our crew saw that people actually were waiting to get in many of us had tears in our eyes watching our hard work pay off.

column1: We're forever in debt to JG Hertzler who drove from his home in the Southern Tier in the fog and rain on the day of the first RocCon in 2011 to make TV and radio appearances..   The talented Eileen Stevens from Pokemon who came by train from New York and Lois Gresh, our wonderful Local New York Times Best Selling Author.   1349 fans came to that first one-day RocCon!  We were off!
The next year, JG brought his good
Klingon Friend Robert O'Reilly to the show!  We also were introduced
to the wonderful Tim McCormack from Star Trek The next Generation.
Tim lives locally and was wonderful enough to hang out and meet you all weekend, do a
panel and even host an art auction!  It was also our first introduction to some anime guy named
Vic Mignogna. (how do you pronounce that?? lol. He's the best)  Our good friend, New
York times best selling author Lois Gresh was back with us too!

Remember Eric Smith, the voice of Team Rocket's James? He was also there for the fun!! 1800 of you came to have fandom fun over our first 3-day event! We can't forget our wonderful comic book guests as well!
2013 brought us Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Chris Doohan, Vic Mignogna, Erica Schroeder and of course, JG along with a wonderful slew of comic creators and about 2300 Fun Fandom people!

2014 RocCon was just beyond incredible!  We stepped up our game and moved the show to  a location with more parking, wonderful event rooms and theatres, great dealer's space, elevators and escalators!     YOU responded by showing up in droves from up to 6 hours away!    And once again, you rose the attendance numbers significantly as more and more of you discovered the little con that could.

column4: >  Vic Mignogna was back for an unprecedented 3rd RocCon appearance,  Star Trek's Brent Spiner, the incredible voice actor Billy West, the lovely Alaina Huffman, Next Gen's Tim McCormack and Star Wars Bonnie Piesse rounded out our guest list to roars of happiness from our conventioneers!  The first-ever RocCon Food Truck rodeo kept hunger pangs at bay all weekend!
>          We've already started booking our guests for 2015 including Simon Fisher-Becker from Dr. Who &amp
column5: Harry Potter, along with the wonderful Voice Actor Todd Haberkorn whome many of you have been asking for.  We have more great announcements to come, but they will be even better if you take a look at the Perks and get some cool stuff while helping RocCon to meet it's goal of even more iconic guests!

column4: >       How does getting a star work?  Well, finding the agents come first.   Then when you find an agent who has a person you want at your con, you agree on a number of things.  They are:  A guaranteed fee amount,  M
column7: >ost stars require first class airfare, 4 to 5 star hotel for at least 3 nights and  what is known as per diem   That is a set amount of money they get per day to use for their expenses while they are here. So you can see, the expenses are numerous.

column1: We've had quite a few requests for talent from the UK.  That is an especially expensive proposition.
If we go over our goal, we will put all the money into bringing in guests from all the genres (comics, sci fi, anime &
column2: gaming) so you have the most fun and variety at RocCon!.

column1: With your help, we can run the same great show from 2014 and bring in some othre very well known stars that will make your fan-meter go wild!   Thank you.  Now, GO!  Check out YOUR PERKS!!!  Then go get em!
The biggest challenge we have are the competing conventions.  We have to show agents that we can compete for their clients.
After our project is successfully funded, the only real obstacles we run into are
1. Availability of the stars we want for our Convention Weekend.  We are in competition with every major convention in the Country and even some outside of the USA.
2. Cancellation of guests.  If someone has to cancel, we will quickly attempt to find a replacement.   Most of their contracts do have cancellation clauses for various reasons.
3. While we are always looking for suggestions for guests, donating to this Kickstarter does not mean we have to bring in a particular guest suggested by any one person who donates.

Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help but want to, please, share our campaign, share or fb page or follow us on Twitter!   Thanks so much!
","Hi there,
I'm Alicia D. Lurye, Organizer of RocCon.  And a life-long pop culture fan.

We want to thank all of you for coming to the 4th annual show in September!  It was the best attended yet with wonderful guests.   Thanks to anyone who's come to RocCon in any year since our 1st show in 2011.
As of now, we can only afford to put on as good a show as we did for 2014 and we want to do better than that!  That's why we're here on Indigogo.

As we go forward things have gotten crazy in ""convention land"".  Conventions from all over have us competing for the big ""name stars"" that we can afford on the weekend RocCon is held and the weeks just before and just after. This includes events held in other countries!   Conventions are announcing their guests earlier and earlier so the competition for guests is stronger.  Especially the icons of the comics, film, tv and anime industies.

It's simple.  Bringing in the bigger stars for RocCon takes money.  More than we have.   We are also in competition with every convention on the same weekend and on the weekends before and after.  Even conventions not in the U.S.  Many of us want the same stars.

So, we've decided to have a crowd-funding campaign to help us with the large expenses of bringing in the biggest names we can find.   Simply stated, the money will be used to bring in some of the guest stars that have higher price tags.  No, it won't end up being enough to get us a ""Big Bang Theory"" star,  Shatner or Stan Lee, but hopefully get us into that 20K price range that many of the people you want to see command.  And that 20K does not include their first class airfare, hotel, food and some need all that for a companion as well.   You can see, getting stars anywhere is not cheap.
We hope that you will truly continue to make RocCon ""YOUR"" convention by helping us grow!  Please donate now.  All monies will go to special guest expenses.
In the meantime, here's a stroll down memory lane.....RocCon from the beginning.

In 2010, after coming back from San Diego Comic Con, I realized that there was not, as of yet, a large, multi-genre Comic Con /Pop Culture Show in Western, NY.  There was a all out anime event, a sci fi event, some comic book only shows and a few gaming events, but nothing that melded the genres and brought us all together for a big party like in other cities.

On the 3rd Saturday in September, 2011, RocCon was born!  The picture below was taken early on Day 1.  When our crew saw that people actually were waiting to get in many of us had tears in our eyes watching our hard work pay off.

We're forever in debt to JG Hertzler who drove from his home in the Southern Tier in the fog and rain on the day of the first RocCon in 2011 to make TV and radio appearances..   The talented Eileen Stevens from Pokemon who came by train from New York and Lois Gresh, our wonderful Local New York Times Best Selling Author.   1349 fans came to that first one-day RocCon!  We were off!
The next year, JG brought his good
Klingon Friend Robert O'Reilly to the show!  We also were introduced
to the wonderful Tim McCormack from Star Trek The next Generation.
Tim lives locally and was wonderful enough to hang out and meet you all weekend, do a
panel and even host an art auction!  It was also our first introduction to some anime guy named
Vic Mignogna. (how do you pronounce that?? lol. He's the best)  Our good friend, New
York times best selling author Lois Gresh was back with us too!

Remember Eric Smith, the voice of  Team Rocket's James?  He was also there for the fun!! 1800 of you came to have fandom fun over our first 3-day event! We can't forget our wonderful comic book guests as well!
2013 brought us Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Chris Doohan, Vic Mignogna, Erica Schroeder and of course, JG along with a wonderful slew of comic creators and about 2300 Fun Fandom people!

2014 RocCon was just beyond incredible!  We stepped up our game and moved the show to  a location with more parking, wonderful event rooms and theatres, great dealer's space, elevators and escalators!     YOU responded by showing up in droves from up to 6 hours away!    And once again, you rose the attendance numbers significantly as more and more of you discovered the little con that could.

Vic Mignogna was back for an unprecedented 3rd RocCon appearance,  Star Trek's Brent Spiner, the incredible voice actor Billy West, the lovely Alaina Huffman, Next Gen's Tim McCormack and Star Wars Bonnie Piesse rounded out our guest list to roars of happiness from our conventioneers!  The first-ever RocCon Food Truck rodeo kept hunger pangs at bay all weekend!

We've already started booking our guests for 2015 including Simon Fisher-Becker from Dr. Who & Harry Potter, along with the wonderful Voice Actor Todd Haberkorn whome many of you have been asking for.  We have more great announcements to come, but they will be even better if you take a look at the Perks and get some cool stuff while helping RocCon to meet it's goal of even more iconic guests!

How does getting a star work?  Well, finding the agents come first.   Then when you find an agent who has a person you want at your con, you agree on a number of things.  They are:  A guaranteed fee amount,  Most stars require first class airfare, 4 to 5 star hotel for at least 3 nights and  what is known as per diem   That is a set amount of money they get per day to use for their expenses while they are here. So you can see, the expenses are numerous.
We've had quite a few requests for talent from the UK.  That is an especially expensive proposition.
If we go over our goal, we will put all the money into bringing in guests from all the genres (comics, sci fi, anime & gaming) so you have the most fun and variety at RocCon!.

With your help, we can run the same great show from 2014 and bring in some othre very well known stars that will make your fan-meter go wild!   Thank you.  Now, GO!  Check out YOUR PERKS!!!  Then go get em!
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge we have are the competing conventions.  We have to show agents that we can compete for their clients.
After our project is successfully funded, the only real obstacles we run into are
1. Availability of the stars we want for our Convention Weekend.  We are in competition with every major convention in the Country and even some outside of the USA.
2. Cancellation of guests.  If someone has to cancel, we will quickly attempt to find a replacement.   Most of their contracts do have cancellation clauses for various reasons.
3. While we are always looking for suggestions for guests, donating to this Kickstarter does not mean we have to bring in a particular guest suggested by any one person who donates.
Other Ways You Can Help     If you can't help but want to, please, share our campaign, share or fb page or follow us on Twitter!   Thanks so much!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Rochester, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/roccon-rocks-the-special-guests/pica

column6:
>The EquilibriOhm lounge
A vision to bring all walks of people into a space to experience art, music, food, education, life tools and self awareness, but primarliy to create a social hub for the ""people"" and not for social elites and trend monkeys. 

With many years experience, the project would gather up the knowledge from around the world and place it in an unique space for people to relax, socialise, explore visions and actually be part of something, while expanding the ever needed value of self in all of our society.

column1: What will be @ The EquilibriOhm Lounge:
<div>
<div>
<ul>
• A gallery hosting innovating and dynamic visual arts and sculptures with installations
• An environment which play innovating ambient, chill, IDM, psybient and live music
• An opening to raw food, exilirs, drinks and ayurvedic awareness (priced at a REAL prices for the people)
• A relaxing lounge area with feng shui, interior innovation and design
• An environment for plants, crystals and nature elements
• An environment which helps to express self awareness and life tools to expand confidence and ideas.
• An environment which brings all walks of people together to share and explore
• A all year round international meeting hub
• A place for international bridges and connections

After visiting Romania Bucharest, we feel this would be the next expansion ride for young social international artists, free thinkers and people exploring their reality.

In this we ask the people who are looking for places like this, while to be part of an artistic space to donate a small amount to help locate and develop the space in the City of Bucharest.
These donations are primarily for the rent for a few months up front and the maintainance to make it legal for public use.

By bringing the community together here, we will have people wanting to participate, in so we do not need huge investments but some dedication and love from those who believe in social hubs and community spaces.

The EquilibriOhm Lounge will be not your average social bar, eating space, gallery, but a new innovation towards the international community bringing together the talent already in a world harder than ever before to be unique in. 

In hope, this project would be ready for 2015 and with an opening of international and Romanian artists, with music and food to compliment the lounge which will become a hub for the Bucharest's people and travellers far and wide.

We Invite people locally too, come and participate and contribute ideas and feelings as we create an equal value to all and one another.
The more people contributing to the idea will help only to create the space for everyone.
<div>
Risks &
<div>
The risks are very small, as we have the experience to build such a space, the contacts to expand out business horizons and the art to support.
We will be providing a service which consists of other elements to run the business.
The project will be ever expanding and the renting of the space is the only risk in this present moment.
So, take a chance, help the ride and support Art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share and connect artists.

Think local act global. }*{

INDIANA TEAM LAUNCHES CAMPAIGN TO GROW MORE ORGANIC FOOD

Red Giant Union on a Mission to build Greenhouse. 

Your donations will fund the construction of a state-of-the-art Vertical Aeroponic Greenhouse capable of supplying the public as well as local businesses all-year round with inexpensive, locally grown, organic produce. It will also pave the way for educational programs in sustainable agriculture for local schools and provide living-wage jobs. This local greenhouse will provide a means to fund similar projects across the United States and the World. For more information, visit www.RedGiantUnion.org

Tower Garden’s key advantages to traditional gardening
• Comes with everything you need to start growing
• Compact design fits almost anywhere, including patios, decks, porches, balconies, terraces, or rooftop gardens
• Soil-free system means there is no weeding, tilling, kneeling, or getting dirty
• No gardening experience is necessary
• Grows many fruits and almost any vegetable, herb, or flower—faster than in soil
• Uses less than 10% of the water and land involved in traditional gardening
• Reduces the need for pesticides, insecticides, or herbicides
• Fewer issues with climate, such as heat, cold, drought
Organic food sales have
column5:
>grown nearly 10.2% in the last year making the total organic food 

revenue of the US a whopping $31.3 million dollars. Yet consumers 

who would prefer to buy organic often are forced into choices based 

on dollar bottom lines and budgets due to the higher costs of foods 

produced and grown organically. One Indiana team of college students
column9:
>from Purdue University, Red Giant Union, is hoping to change that 

for the better by investing in developing one or more efficient, low 

cost, aeroponic and hydroponic greenhouses for sustainable production 

of 100% organic food at cheaper prices in West Lafayette, IN to serve the 

Purdue community.

First Lady Michelle Obama has made it her cause to get school 

children to eat better changing school lunches into a healthier 

plate. Parents work with their children at home to instill healthier 

eating habits and food choices so they grow up to be healthier young 

men and women. Unfortunately, with the high cost of campus living 

and college tuition, university students are forced into making 

cheap, unhealthful food choices out of budgetary concerns. This 

is not fair and goes against all the hard work of their parents and 

the First Lady. Red Giant Union has a mission to invest in Organic 

Agriculture and Engineering Methods in order to reduce the cost 

of organic food production over all easing purse strings for both 

students and organic food producers and farmers.

Angel investors helping fund the Red Giant Union campaign to the 

next level will be eligible for perks such as thank yous, custom pens, and a T-shirt. 

The team also understands not everyone may be able to give money 

to help the Red Giant Union project, so they ask that those who 

cannot give monetarily help by spreading the word about the Red Giant 

Union Organic produce online through social media such as Facebook, 

Twitter and Tumblr or record a video challenge for Vine, Facebook 

or Instagram to invite friends to give to or share this Indiegogo 

fundraiser. Include #RedGiantUnion in all posts.

For more information, visit Red Giant Union.


Our Local Sponsors:

Red Mango: 

Mention ""Red Giant"" at checkout and we receive %20 of your sale.

102 N. Chauncey Ave., Ste. B

West Lafayette  IN,  47906

P: 765.743.3300


#BoilerMakeItHappen
#AllOrganic

column1: We plan to use revenue from the greenhouse(s) to re-invest in the local community to help other like-minded entrepreneurs. We would offer services and various resources to help others become self-sufficient with the most up to date methods available.
Further details, visit our website at www.RedGiantUnion.org

Hi everyone! My name is Nicole and I'm the owner of SurpriseYouStore.com. This is a fun website where you can order a surprise gift at random for just $10 plus shipping. The gift can be anything from a video game to a pair of shoes. Each surprise gift that we send out is brand new and different every time.

I've had this business for almost 2 years and would like to market it better. I get orders every month but I would like an increase in sales. I would also like to renovate the website and possibly do better branding. So funding for this campaign would go to promotion costs and website improvement.

I strongly believe that this business can be very successful with the right amount of marketing funds because the concept of the website is fun and unique.

Any advice on how to make this business more successful would be greatly appreciated.

Families of Color Seattle (FOCS), a community-based non-profit, invites you to fuel the building of CORNERSTONE CAFÉ.

 HOW DO WE HELP CHILDREN FEEL POWERFUL AND LOVED?


The FOCS vision is to provide a cultural cornerstone and a creative blend of family programming, child-centered play and an intergenerational space for families to gather in SOUTH SEATTLE!  To achieve our vision, we are launching:

Cornerstone Café, an international gathering space for all families and the South Seattle
community.  In the spirit of Bob Marley, FOCS Cornerstone Café will be a community cultural base for

children and parents, which will provide entrepreneurial avenues for parents to integrate conscious parenting to perpetuate a global culture of inclusivity, community building and play-centered learning.
column4:
workspace for children and parents to enjoy together

Community Cafe, provided by Ariella Bangs, Taste International &
column5:
Community Arts Create

Drop-in affordable childcare w/play-centered curriculum

Multi-lingual story-time with international arts, music &
column7:
workshops with professionals

4,000 sqft community garden.

Slated to open its doors in October, FOCS

column1: Cornerstone Café is honored to launch at the Hillman City Collaboratory, a co-share work and community
space, and will offer a variety of resources to support and empower all of Seattle’s
multi-cultural families.  Cornerstone Café integrates conscious parenting and perpetuates a global

culture of inclusivity, community building, and play-centered learning. 


WHY Cornerstone Café? 

1.  Seattle rainy days = lack of children play spaces &
column2:
lots of cabin fever!

2.  Southend LOVE = fueling community- based projects and keeping the Southend LOCAL and reflective of our beloved 98118 history of diversity.  

3. JOBS!  We're sharing our community's rich international culture and arts.  We provide entrepreneurial avenues for parents to teach global cultures, expression, arts and international languages to all children in our community.   

4.  Healthy HAPPY children!  Our shared pursuit of happiness is reflected in our family and the community we build.  Little global citizens mark an engaged community and make the world a little cozier, culturally enriched and informed.  BELEZA!

 


CORNERSTONE CAFÉ's VALUES:

global community

inclusivity

entrepreneurship

women of color &
column4:
conscious parenting



FUEL OUR CROWD-FUNDING GOAL:  $25,000.  

1.  covers costs of the childcare &
column5:

column7:
Media and numerous professional consultations to help us make informed decisions, build organizational capacity and provide high-quality services.  

Perks gifts are fun ways to represent FOCS in your part of town.  Come enjoy our play space and classes, while you're helping to finance our launch of Cornerstone Cafe!  All contributions are tax-deductible and you'll receive a letter in the mail with our 501c3 tax id.  Even better, have your employer match your contribution to a wonderful cause!

column1: <li>FOCS is a community-powered collective of stay at home and working parents.  Since April 2013, FOCS as an informal organization has grown quickly in the first year of offering parenting support &amp
column2: professional workshops for mostly mothers and children and connecting new families.  In the past four months a collective of mothers, affectionately called ""Builders,"" with our little ones in tow, have researched weekly, telecommuted and worked during playdates to deliver many organizational developments.  We have since become a WA state registered 501c3 non-profit, with our current fiscal sponsor, Open Arms Perinatal Services to provide administrative support.  We have a wonderful and talented Board of Directors guiding our transition from being a one year old community organization, which mainly supported mothers and children.  Currently, our team of parents and consultants now are growing FOCS into a larger community cultural cornerstone with a brick and mortar to grow programming from Conerstone Café to serve greater numbers of families with more cultural resources.  We are learning together, many of us transitioning our careers to be inclusive of our children and integrating our new livelihoods to connect with other families in the community who are desiring communal intentional spaces of discovery, love and play.  This LABOR OF LOVE has been an incredible learning curve as stay at home working-organzing parents.   We are so-called BIRTHING an organic movement to create a loving community of families of color.  Much of this work happens after 10pm- wee hours between middle of the night time feedings and the quiet of night.  Teleconferences, babies in arms, screeching, food trails, escaping toddlers and multi-tasking patient/distracted mamas made this organizing journey so humorous and intentional.  Giggles, gratitude and TEARS of all emotions (mostly the babies).. all in a days work with little ones.  And now, we're at capacity and are at the point where we need to serve more families and children with your support! Our learning curve has been an adventure and we're drawing upon so many different talents and interests to become a non-profit and a community cultural cornerstone.

column1: • Our community response to create more progressive family spaces has been a completely organic and home-cooked process, made with love and lots of (baby) tears!  We are a highly educated, driven and professional team of ""BUILDERS"" who are proud to present our community space and programming to all.  YES, we are some mother FOCers!  Our motto: ""pack n play""- we pack in the work, babes play!  We need your support in getting the word out beyond just the parent and child community.  Share and engage your network and community to help fuel our innovative and political community based movement. GIVE BIG TO CORNERSTONE CAFE!

• This is a political platform we are creating for women of color and immigrant leadership.  We are also addressing the employment and parenting dichotomy, that often makes parenting and being a professional incompatible, especially with high costs of childcare in WA!  We aim to fill in the gaps of childcare and support entrepreneurial parents and families that are without intergenerational (grandparent) support near or far.    We are like you and have found a creative communal solution to support caring for our community's children, together.  Share our crowd-funding campaign and encourage your community to support our families in Seattle and Southend 98118 community, because happy children benefits everyone.  In light of the global and national religious and racist violence, perhaps racism and disparities will begin to lessen with more community-driven progressive organizations like FOCS &
column2: Cornerstone Cafe! We are creating a localized social change movement and making the world just a bit smaller and more loving as we raise our little global citizens with greater compassion and cultural connections.  Cornerstone Cafe can be a model for all communities across America for bringing communities together, loving our children and celebrating the gifts of diversity and global citizenship.  Bring Cornerstone Cafe and FOCS programming to your city and neighborhood!  We can help you get started!

column1:
About FOCS

FOCS | Families Of Color Seattle is a local resource that supports
new parents to build a loving community of families of color.  We connect new mothers and fathers in
meaningful learning spaces for friendship and sharing of resources and

experiences for our babies and children of color and multitude of cultures. 

Cornerstone Café is a crucial goal of FOCS. We challenge systems to provide avenues for entrepreneurial women of color, immigrants and new fathers. We teach children cultural resonance in a loving inclusive community of all families and integrate the local neighborhood of South Seattle’s rich and diverse cultural base, the 98118.
<div>
<div>
<div>

","Families of Color Seattle (FOCS), a community-based non-profit, invites you to fuel the building of CORNERSTONE CAFÉ.  HOW DO WE HELP CHILDREN FEEL POWERFUL AND LOVED?The FOCS vision is to provide a cultural cornerstone and a creative blend of family programming, child-centered play and an intergenerational space for families to gather in SOUTH SEATTLE!  To achieve our vision, we are launching:Cornerstone Café, an international gathering space for all families and the South Seattle
community.  In the spirit of Bob Marley, FOCS Cornerstone Café will be a community cultural base for

children and parents, which will provide entrepreneurial avenues for parents to integrate conscious parenting to perpetuate a global culture of inclusivity, community building and play-centered learning. WE OFFER:  FREE PLAY & workspace for children and parents to enjoy togetherCommunity Cafe, provided by Ariella Bangs, Taste International & Community Arts CreateDrop-in affordable childcare w/play-centered curriculumMulti-lingual story-time with international arts, music & dance programmingCommunity evening forums & workshops with professionals4,000 sqft community garden. Slated to open its doors in October, FOCS
Cornerstone Café is honored to launch at the Hillman City Collaboratory, a co-share work and community
space, and will offer a variety of resources to support and empower all of Seattle’s
multi-cultural families.  Cornerstone Café integrates conscious parenting and perpetuates a global

culture of inclusivity, community building, and play-centered learning. WHY Cornerstone Café? 1.  Seattle rainy days = lack of children play spaces & lots of cabin fever!2.  Southend LOVE = fueling community- based projects and keeping the Southend LOCAL and reflective of our beloved 98118 history of diversity.  3. JOBS!  We're sharing our community's rich international culture and arts.  We provide entrepreneurial avenues for parents to teach global cultures, expression, arts and international languages to all children in our community.   4.  Healthy HAPPY children!  Our shared pursuit of happiness is reflected in our family and the community we build.  Little global citizens mark an engaged community and make the world a little cozier, culturally enriched and informed.  BELEZA! CORNERSTONE CAFÉ's VALUES:global communityinclusivityentrepreneurshipwomen of color & mother leadershipengaged fathers & conscious parentingFUEL OUR CROWD-FUNDING GOAL:  $25,000.  1.  covers costs of the childcare & playspace build-out at the Collaboratory and building a covered outdoors play area in the community garden.2.  supports non-profit development, one year lease at the beautiful Collaboratory and programming staff.  programming revenue and grants & foundations will help underwrite Cornerstone Cafe's programming, scholarships and development.  3.  enables Cornerstone Cafe's start-up costs for technical support, data base and business management systems, technology and training.  We have already received hundreds of hours of pro-bono IT, PR, Branding & Media and numerous professional consultations to help us make informed decisions, build organizational capacity and provide high-quality services.  Perks gifts are fun ways to represent FOCS in your part of town.  Come enjoy our play space and classes, while you're helping to finance our launch of Cornerstone Cafe!  All contributions are tax-deductible and you'll receive a letter in the mail with our 501c3 tax id.  Even better, have your employer match your contribution to a wonderful cause! Challenges:

FOCS is a community-powered collective of stay at home and working parents.  Since April 2013, FOCS as an informal organization has grown quickly in the first year of offering parenting support & professional workshops for mostly mothers and children and connecting new families.  In the past four months a collective of mothers, affectionately called ""Builders,"" with our little ones in tow, have researched weekly, telecommuted and worked during playdates to deliver many organizational developments.  We have since become a WA state registered 501c3 non-profit, with our current fiscal sponsor, Open Arms Perinatal Services to provide administrative support.  We have a wonderful and talented Board of Directors guiding our transition from being a one year old community organization, which mainly supported mothers and children.  Currently, our team of parents and consultants now are growing FOCS into a larger community cultural cornerstone with a brick and mortar to grow programming from Conerstone Café to serve greater numbers of families with more cultural resources.  We are learning together, many of us transitioning our careers to be inclusive of our children and integrating our new livelihoods to connect with other families in the community who are desiring communal intentional spaces of discovery, love and play.  This LABOR OF LOVE has been an incredible learning curve as stay at home working-organzing parents.   We are so-called BIRTHING an organic movement to create a loving community of families of color.  Much of this work happens after 10pm- wee hours between middle of the night time feedings and the quiet of night.  Teleconferences, babies in arms, screeching, food trails, escaping toddlers and multi-tasking patient/distracted mamas made this organizing journey so humorous and intentional.  Giggles, gratitude and TEARS of all emotions (mostly the babies).. all in a days work with little ones.  And now, we're at capacity and are at the point where we need to serve more families and children with your support! Our learning curve has been an adventure and we're drawing upon so many different talents and interests to become a non-profit and a community cultural cornerstone.

Our community response to create more progressive family spaces has been a completely organic and home-cooked process, made with love and lots of (baby) tears!  We are a highly educated, driven and professional team of ""BUILDERS"" who are proud to present our community space and programming to all.  YES, we are some mother FOCers!  Our motto: ""pack n play""- we pack in the work, babes play!  We need your support in getting the word out beyond just the parent and child community.  Share and engage your network and community to help fuel our innovative and political community based movement. GIVE BIG TO CORNERSTONE CAFE!

This is a political platform we are creating for women of color and immigrant leadership.  We are also addressing the employment and parenting dichotomy, that often makes parenting and being a professional incompatible, especially with high costs of childcare in WA!  We aim to fill in the gaps of childcare and support entrepreneurial parents and families that are without intergenerational (grandparent) support near or far.    We are like you and have found a creative communal solution to support caring for our community's children, together.  Share our crowd-funding campaign and encourage your community to support our families in Seattle and Southend 98118 community, because happy children benefits everyone.  In light of the global and national religious and racist violence, perhaps racism and disparities will begin to lessen with more community-driven progressive organizations like FOCS & Cornerstone Cafe! We are creating a localized social change movement and making the world just a bit smaller and more loving as we raise our little global citizens with greater compassion and cultural connections.  Cornerstone Cafe can be a model for all communities across America for bringing communities together, loving our children and celebrating the gifts of diversity and global citizenship.  Bring Cornerstone Cafe and FOCS programming to your city and neighborhood!  We can help you get started!

We Want to a Bring Lil' Orbits Hot Fresh Mini Donut Store to Rockland County!

• Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Hi Everyone!  Me and my wife Geraldine, want to start a Lil' Orbits hot and fresh Mini Donuts Store right here in Rockland County!  We've both lived here in Rockland County our entire life and remember great fresh made donuts growing up at Aunt Molly's in Pearl River and Van Riper's Farm over the border in Woodcliff Lake, NJ.  Even Dunkin' Donuts USED TO make their donuts fresh several times a day before switching to their ""freeze and thaw"" program several years back.

We believe that HOT and FRESH donuts right off the conveyer is the BEST!  Lil' Orbits has been proving this since the mid 1970's in 80+ countries around the world!  The supplies and the machines are MADE IN THE USA!  They've even won AN EXPORT AWARD for it!  Upon trying these donuts for the first time, we knew they were a winner.  You will never want to do to a DD, or a supermarket for laughable at best quality donuts again, after you try and see just how good these are!
We also want to bring full size donuts and quality coffee to our operation as well!

Our ultimate goal is to raise the full funding and open up a store at the Shoppes at Nanuet, or a good size Kiosk at the Palisades Mall.  We are looking into other good, high traffic locations around the county as well, as the Lil' Orbits brand is a PROVEN WINNER in good locations.  (Once you Try it, you will know why, Trust me!)
Funds will be used for:

* 'Lil Orbits high capacity machines and necessary sink and hood systems.
* Startup donut making and other supplies and other equipment needed (registers, shirts, headwear, etc)
* Lease and Build-out cost in mall or shopping center.
* Promotional advertising and website startup costs.
Why You Should Invest in Donut Awesomeness:

* DD and the Supermarket just isn't offering the kind of quality that FRESH COOKED BEFORE YOUR EYES can.  The aroma and taste of these babies will make a supporter for life!!
* Machines and mixes made here in The USA.  'Lil Orbits has also won an Export Award!  Export from the USA that is! 
* Your money is going into a real local startup, NOT a franchise FEES or royalties.  We just use the 'Lil Orbits machinery and supplies, because they are a time tested proven model, offer an excellent quality product, and NOT a franchise.
Thanks, and please hit the share button to share with your friends.  We really appreciate the opportunity to bring you closer to Donut Heaven!

column7:
>Johnny regenerative seed.

Isabel is the first vertical farm to travel to Burning Man. We aim to show humanity that vertical/indoor farming uses 95% less water, grows twice as fast, and no use of pesticides. The Internet of Food is here, are you ready?

  • Ryan Hooks has been a director in NYC for the past 8 years, he then wanted to help make a dent in California's water problem. Upon arriving to San Francisco he met Ruben Santa in Palo Alto, and they shared  very similar taste in programming the world for the better. They then found Eric Hager amongst fields of orchids in the East Bay, and the glorious trio was born. 
  • As population grows, and the resources dwindle, we need to radically do more with less. This era of innovation in the sector of ecological regeneration could be the Garden of Eden many have dreamed of for sometime. There are many factors like soil loss, climate change, petro fertilizers, transportation, clean water, health, and the the loss of animal/bio diversity. By going vertical humanity can truly solve many things at once.
  • We have Isabel running at our farm in the East Bay. She needs to acquire a healthy VW and a Airstream skeleton that we will cover with plexiglass. Then there will be towers of Kale, Tomato, and Cucumber ready to make delicious salads for the passerby's. After Burning Man Isabel will be available to travel to the greatest universities and organizations around the world.

column1: <div>

What's in it for you?

Rainbows of joy, and practicality:

  • $45,000 allows for us to purchase the VW, Airstream, and fill it with all of the right components. Transportation, and some dressing is all we need.  
  • We are going to be handing out highly efficient salads inspiring people to go vertical. Satori is in the mix to DJ, and special guests will be lighting up the garden at night with Isabel's special light setup.

• Oh, we're building it... just that it needs some dough. If we are short of the 45k, the team will start donating kidneys... We wouldn't want to have do that right before the Burn. It's up to you! :D

    • The Impact

    Infinite agriculture, feeding the future of humanity.

    • The technology we utilize is the most affordable on the market, we aim to help shine light on the industry helping make efficiency a reality.
    • We collectively have 24 years growing food, directing, and making rad products.
    • We all know that the future is what you make of it, help us spread the good word. 

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

If you've ever been to Burning Man you know that the weather is quite radical, temperatures can range from 40° to 90° with up to 70mph wind gusts. That's why we making Isabel highly resilient to show the world that if you can grow food in the desert, you can grow it anywhere.

column1: Burning Man doesn't allow for rooted plants so we will be showcasing Isabel at Gerlach, and replacing the interior with replicas, and then we'll have plenty vertical salad chilled for our camp.

Share our video, let's efficiently green exponentially.

  • #Isabel with pictures of places you think should go vertical. 

See you on the playa!

<h3><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column4: >Donate now to help four young children with Autism find freedom, peace of mind, safety, acceptance, hope and normalcy through service dogs.

column1: <div><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column11:
>Children with Autism are often drawn to water and other dangerous situations. Accidental drowning accounts for 90% of the deaths of children with Autism (AWAARE). 
This campaign is raising money to get service dogs for four young children with Autism who are often drawn to water and other dangerous situations.
column17: >The simple presence of a service dog has been shown to keep children out of harm's way while also lowering blood pressure, calming the child, and providing outlets for interaction for a child who can't seem to 'fit in' anywhere else.

column5: >Families of children with Autism often struggle on a daily basis to keep their children out of harms way while also leading a normal life. Sometimes it is impossible for these parents and children to find peace of mind in the most simplest of situations.

column1: <div><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
Please help protect these children by donating now.
A successful campaign will mean peace of mind, hope, security, freedom and safety for these four children with Autism, and many more children with Autism if we are able to exceed our goal of $50,000.
<div><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column6: >Words from the parents of these four children:

column1: ""Everything we do and everywhere we go has potential dangers for DJ. Having a trained service dog will give us security knowing he is safe.""

""Most people don't know that our kids are prone to wandering and that they are attracted to water. They run into traffic, they don't respond to their name when called, and they don't understand danger.""
""There are days that hope is all I have to get me through. When Kip is having a really off day and I have no idea how to make it better, I just hope.""
""Autism affects every facet of our lives. It is always a beautiful thing when we join forces to help one another.""
""I chose the word comfort for this campaign because I believe in and have the experienced in my own life of the healing power of animals.""
""It's a lonely, daunting task any time you are trying to get the funds together to get something your child with Autism needs.""
","Donate now to help four young children with Autism find freedom, peace of mind, safety, acceptance, hope and normalcy through service dogs.

Children with Autism are often drawn to water and other dangerous situations. Accidental drowning accounts for 90% of the deaths of children with Autism (AWAARE). This campaign is raising money to get service dogs for four young children with Autism who are often drawn to water and other dangerous situations.The simple presence of a service dog has been shown to keep children out of harm's way while also lowering blood pressure, calming the child, and providing outlets for interaction for a child who can't seem to 'fit in' anywhere else.

Families of children with Autism often struggle on a daily basis to keep their children out of harms way while also leading a normal life. Sometimes it is impossible for these parents and children to find peace of mind in the most simplest of situations.
Please help protect these children by donating now.
A successful campaign will mean peace of mind, hope, security, freedom and safety for these four children with Autism, and many more children with Autism if we are able to exceed our goal of $50,000.
Words from the parents of these four children:
Everything we do and everywhere we go has potential dangers for DJ. Having a trained service dog will give us security knowing he is safe.""

Most people don't know that our kids are prone to wandering and that they are attracted to water. They run into traffic, they don't respond to their name when called, and they don't understand danger.""
There are days that hope is all I have to get me through. When Kip is having a really off day and I have no idea how to make it better, I just hope.""
Autism affects every facet of our lives. It is always a beautiful thing when we join forces to help one another.""
I chose the word comfort for this campaign because I believe in and have the experienced in my own life of the healing power of animals.""
It's a lonely, daunting task any time you are trying to get the funds together to get something your child with Autism needs.""",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Sandy, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/woofs-for-autism/pica

When the economy tanked 2008-2009, my lower middle-class (working) family was hit exceptionally hard. In the past six years, my dad got laid off from his career, never found a job in his field again, I had to leave college to work, we lost our home to foreclosure, and the list goes on and on.

We've preservered. We're still alive. I finished my degree. Dad has a job again. But he makes half of what he used to. I'm a year out of college, and still don't have fulltime work in my field. I'm working 4 part time jobs to make ends meet. But I can't even pay off my school debt in an ideal way.

Then yesterday we found out our van, the only vehicle we have, is going to take about 2 grand in repairs. Unfortunately, the mechanic didn't stick to the budget we had arranged. And we don't have the credit to get another vehicle. The good side of this is that the van is now in great working condition.

This vehicle is our only way to get to work and for me finding full time work. Will you help us get it back? I'm pretty desperate and need your help.

I am holding a vintage tea party at Llan Hall on Saturday March 7th at 2.00pm until 4.00pm to help raise money for an unbelievable worthy cause. Most of you might have already read Jamie Macdonald's blog and heard his news in the Gazette. Like myself he has probably touched your hearts and as a community I feel we must all get together and help Jamie and his family get through this tough time. If you would like to attend on the day tickets will be available from Monday at £3 each and are limited to 50 due to the size of the hall. Please please support , as a community we need to do this!!! Thank you so much Xxx  


You can follow Jamie on his blog here http://www.thelastthingiexpected.com/
