Welcome Back

LeRoy has been serving authentically luscious soul food to Ottawa since 2008. He needs your help to bring it back in a new restaurant.

If you already know LeRoy, you know how happy it makes him to feed good food to people. If you don't know LeRoy, you should know that his cooking from his grandma's recipes were the reason for Jean Albert's (in Hallville and on Somerset in downtown Ottawa) and Detroit Soul Food (on Gladstone).

What you may not know: LeRoy was the pioneer in Ottawa soul food—before he turned up, no Ottawa restaurants offered chicken and waffles, and a request that the kitchen dish up mac 'n' cheese on the side just made your server look at you kinda funny.
LeRoy is going to open a new place and satisfy your cravings. But he needs his Ottawa FAM to help him get set up.
<div> <h3>What We Need &amp
column2:
What You Get

To open a new place, LeRoy needs $33,000 start-up money to rent, equip, and supply the space, including:

column1: <ul>
• deep fryers
• stovetop/griddle/oven
• refrigerators
• waffle makers
• hot and cold holding units
• heat lamps
• shelving and lighting
• prep tables
• cleaning supplies
• signs
• printing (like business cards 'n' such)
Plus LeRoy needs to train up and pay a staff. You read that right—this time, LeRoy won't be on his own. Also, he's keen to teach someone on the staff what he knows about cooking soul food.

He'll need money to pay the landlord first and last month's rent, of course, but also the building contractor, the lawyer, the accountant, and this-here fundraising website: Indiegogo. (Everyone else involved in the fundraising—it's just me, Doug!—is doing it all for free.) Plus, LeRoy has to pay income tax on everything you give. That's a big part of the reason he's asking as much as he is.

There have been a lot of voices raised on Facebook and on Twitter telling LeRoy they're behind him. This is Ottawa's chance to turn the talk into action and show LeRoy how stand-up a city we are, particularly when the reward is authentic soul food for ourselves, our families, and our visitors.
Speaking of rewards, here are some of things you can get if you support this campaign:
<ul>

• Fried chicken (with or without waffles--but trust me, get the waffles)! People rave about how good LeRoy's real fried chicken is. It's what fried chicken is supposed to taste like. My mother is an amazing cook, and LeRoy's fried chicken is way better. (Sorry, Mom!)

• Fame! Being a local hero might not be as good as fried chicken (because what is?) but you can see your name on LeRoy's new menu. That's right, LeRoy will choose a dish and you will decide what it's called. You don't have to name it after yourself (because this would be worth serious points with your spouse!) but no one will blame you if you do.
<li>A food-for-life subscription! Imagine being able to walk into LeRoy's new place every week, knowing that the bill is already paid.
What is Soul Food, Anyway?
It's comfort food, southern-style.
<ul>
• Main dishes like fried chicken (with waffles!), ham hocks, and pork ribs
• Side dishes like mac 'n' cheese, black-eyed peas, collard greens, cornbread
• Desserts like sweet potato pie

And if you don't get the whole thing with the waffles, then don't worry. Lots of people don't until they try it for the first time. Your chance to try it is coming soon!

LeRoy's soul food comes from the family recipes he learned from his grandma Theria Jones.
<div> <h3>Fewer Risks
column2:
Lesser Challenges

LeRoy has been running restaurants since 2008. He doesn't just know how to cook, he knows his way around a business, and he knows the players.

column1: Here's where you can watch LeRoy on CTV Ottawa Morning Live: for Jean Albert's, introducing to the world his invention of chicken and waffles on a stick, all the way back in 2012 :
Here's where you can watch LeRoy on CTV Ottawa Morning Live for Detroit Soul Food:
http://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/video?playlistId=1.1861319
Here where you can watch Lamont Ferguson giving Detroit Soul Food a shout-out:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LcVERsNPn_Y
Here's where you can read the Ottawa Citizen coverage of Jean Albert's:

http://www.ottawacitizen.com/life/Jean+Albert+American+Style+Soul+Food+Southern+food+with+lots+soul/4071429/story.html 

And here's where you can read Ottawa Magazine's coverage of LeRoy's food truck:
http://www.ottawamagazine.com/restaurants/city-bites/2013/05/01/food-truck-fever-theres-only-one-leroy-hes-back-with-his-grandmas-soul-food-recipes-and-a-14-foot-purolator-truck/
<div>

Ever since an unfortunate ""life event"" (as my employer's human-resources department euphemistically calls it), LeRoy has been trying to feed Ottawa all on his own. That hasn't been easy... and even LeRoy admits that it hasn't worked.
So what'll be new in the new restaurant?
LeRoy says:
<ul>
• Behind the scenes, I'll be starting from scratch with my own equipment in an empty facility rather than trying to use someone else's design for a restaurant. That allows me to give you...
• The same quality, slow-cooked food but with 3-minute service, much faster than I've ever offered before.
• I'll be training up a full staff. That should allow me to give you...
• A full menu--not just a breakfast menu, a lunch menu, and a dinner menu. I'm talking about every item shown always being available to order.
• I'm also looking for a central location which means a wider delivery area. In other words, more of you will be able to order my food delivered right to your doors.
Frequently Asked Questions
If you have a question, we encourage you to ask us! If a lot of people ask the same question, we'll answer it here.
What is a soft opening?

A soft opening is a practice run for a new restaurant. It's the dress rehearsal of the restaurant world. Everyone attending is encouraged to be a little charitable should something go a little bit wrong technically. A soft opening helps get the restaurant ready for the public. You'll notice that one of the campaign perks is attending LeRoy's soft opening!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you're strapped for cash right now, we get it. But you can still help by getting the word out! It's just one click to share with Facebook and Twitter and Google+.
Please, tell your friends, your co-workers, your family, and your in-laws. Text 'em, phone 'em, email 'em, maybe even talk to them face-to-face. Help us make some noise.

I know many of you do not fully comprehend what's going on in Syria. To be honest, I don’t either. It is a complex crisis with many moving parts, and there are many sides to take and viewpoints to share. But a simple fact is this, a religious minority in Syria - the Druze - are soon to be attacked by ISIS. The Druze are a neutral, peaceful, and defenseless minority
column2: not aggressive or trouble-seeking. All they want to do is to protect their land and to survive.

column1: This campaign is not asking you to fund a war. This is just asking you to help give the Syrian Druze a fighting chance at surviving the impending and imminent ISIS attacks. The money from this campaign will be going toward helping the Druze in two ways:
<ul>
• To help with the purchase of food
• To help with the purchase of defense equipment
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

The total human toll since the start of the Syrian civil war 4 years ago has been heavy. With 9 million in need of aid and protection, and 2.5 million displaced, the UN has declared it the worst humanitarian crisis of the 21st century.

Right now there are about 600,000+ Druze living in the southern part of Syria called Jabal al-Druze. ISIS and al-Nusra (sister terrorist group) have almost surrounded the whole Druze community and they are not backing down. Amongst the Druze, there are only about 160,000 able-bodied men who are willing to defend their families and homes with their lives, but their willingness is not enough to put up a good fight.

This campaign is a collaboration with the fundraising efforts of the Druze community in Israel, who are spearheading an effort to raise funds within local villages for their brethren in Syria. A similar endeavour by the Israeli Druze was made in the past during the Lebanese civil war to get money to Lebanese Druze, and because of that, the Druze survived the war. The current situation in Syria is already much more serious than what happened in Lebanon 25 years ago, and they need our help today more than ever.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
TO HELP WITH PURCHASE OF FOOD
• Unstable food prices

A few months ago, flour cost USD1.29/kg. Today it is USD12.95/kg - a 1000% increase! There is great price fluctuation for food, and it is not clear how much prices will change in the days leading up to ISIS’ attack. The Druze need the funds so that they are financially able to overcome potential price shocks.

  • Purchasing food after the attack is dangerous

When ISIS attacks, the siege does not end till whole cities are captured. When this happens, the Druze need to have a ready and lasting stockpile of food as entering and leaving the community safely may not be possible. Helping the Druze build this stockpile will decrease unnecessary risks they may have to take while under attack.
TO HELP WITH PURCHASE OF DEFENSE EQUIPMENT
• No official protection from ISIS threat

The Syrian Druze are no match to ISIS’ arsenal of battle equipment, weaponry, and seemingly endless funding. Neither are they being protected by any official armed forces. Some of the money will go to arming Druze men with weapons to defend the community.

Last summer there was a video circulating on the Internet showing a helicopter rescue of desperate Iraqi Yazidis escaping ISIS. The Syrian Druze will soon find themselves in a similar circumstance if they are unable to defend themselves. Their situation is desperate. 

Do not sit by and do nothing. Edmund Burke said all that is necessary for evil to triumph is that good men do nothing. There is an overwhelming kind of helplessness that we experience when faced with conflicts like this. It often cripples us from taking action. But let's try to leave this helplessness behind and give just as we can. In these tough times, even the smallest donation can make a real difference. 

$2,500 is a huge amount for me personally, yet I have faith that we can exceed even this goal. The Druze in Syria need all the money they can get. And if you are unable to donate, that's okay too. It would mean so much to me if you could just spread the word on your social media platforms :)

Save the SE Mobile Food Bank

The Great Day Fellowship Food Truck needs your help! Our truck, with over 200,000 miles is broken. We need the community to pitch in and raise $10,000 to get another truck on the road! We invite you to support this big ministry that’s run by a small SE church of just around 25 members.

For 12 years, the “Food Truck” has met a critical need for low income families in SE Portland, delivering thousands of pounds of food directly to homes every month.  Through a partnership with the Oregon Food Bank, the Food Truck redistributes over 11,500 lbs of  high quality perishable food per month to low income families. The Food Truck plays the critical role of picking up and transporting weekly donations from Albertsons, Target, Whole Foods, Fred Meyers, Pete’s Coffee, and others to take directly to ROSE CDC housing, the Clackamas Service Center, and emergency food boxes. This ministry helps provide over 79,000 meals each year!
Your donation, however large or small, will help buy a replacement truck to transport thousands of pounds of food directly to families in need for years to come!
<h3>What We Need &amp

The Great Day Fellowship Church needs $10,000 to buy a gently used U-Haul to replace their broken down truck. All $10,000 will pay for the truck, any extra funds raised will help pay for gas and to maintain the truck. Besides knowing that you helped support this amazing effort to ensure food security in the Outer SE Portland area, you also get:
<ul>
• $10 or more- Shout out on ROSE’s Social Media (optional)
• $25 or more- Invitation to a ice cream social+perks below
• $100 or more- Tickets to a special appreciation banquet+perks below
• $500 or more- Have your name listed as a “Supporter” on the outside of the Food Truck (optional)+perks below
• $1,000 or more- Have your company logo (if applicable) listed as a “Supporter” on the outside of the Food Truck (optional)+perks below
<ul>

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will still be used to pay for the truck.
Please contact us if you have a custom perk in mind, we are flexible!
Some areas of Southeast Portland are considered  food deserts, which makes getting healthy food a great challenge.
According to the Oregon Food Bank, "" In Oregon, 270,000 people per month eat meals from emergency food boxes. That's half of Portland's population. Of those, 92,000 are children

column2:
>The Great Day Fellowship Church is a very small church with only 25 members doing big work to end food insecurity in SE. By taking the food to the people who need it most they are making perishable, healthy foods more accessible and preventing thousands of pounds of food from ending up in the trash. There is no risk associated with your contributions because The Great Day Fellowship is a registered 501c(3) and your donation is 100% tax deductible. We feel confident with community help we can spread the word and meet the $10,000 goal, keeping the food truck on the road. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a monetary donation, or if you would like to help in more ways than donating money:

column1: <ul>
• Ask local businesses, or your work to contribute/match donations

• Share this campaign on any and all forms of  social media!
  • Indiegogo makes spreading the word easy with their share tools, so use them!

    • Contact Info.

    The Great Day Fellowship Church is located at 7447 SE Holgate, Portland OR 97206, and is pastored by Don Sieckman. For more information on the Food Truck, contact Don at 503-913-9273.

column9: >Justice 4 Domestic Workers is a self-help grass-roots organisation made up of migrant Domestic Workers from around the world established on March 15, 2009. We empower migrant domestic workers in the UK to stand up and voice their opposition to any discrimination, inequality, slavery and all forms of abuse. We show that we are stronger together. J4DW is affiliated with Unite the Union and thanks them and many others for their continued

column1: What We Need Your Support For

We are looking to raise £5000 in order to carry on our vital work for a further year.

Our Activities include:
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Classes for Migrant Domestic Workers in ICT, English language, Arts and Trade Union

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Advice and support services for Migrant Domestic Workers, with sign-posting to professional advice where needed

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Practical support for Migrant Domestic Workers who have run away from employers or who are in other acute situations

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Organising Migrant Domestic Workers to speak out about the value of their work and their entitlement to rights

column1:
We wish to raise awareness of our campaign and build greater respect for the domestic work we undertake to improve the living and work conditions throughout private households here in the UK. Community organising is central to J4DW and what we do. We believe that in order to secure our rights we must educate and mobilise ourselves and build links with those who can support us. As well as speaking out for our rights we also solve each other’s practical problems. We find each other emergency accommodation and pool our resources to provide food and clothing....

 .....and we do all this on top of our jobs as full time domestic workers! We urgently need your help to continue, to support the increasing number of domestic workers who need us!

column1:
Your support will make a huge and vital impact to the lives of many vulnerable women experiencing daily abuse. The abuses include confiscation of passports, confining workers to their employer’s home, subjecting workers to verbal and psychological abuse, paying them very little or not at all for extremely long hours of work without breaks, and not giving them adequate food.

Please give as little or as much as you can afford.
The Impact

Tens of millions of women and girls around the world are employed as domestic workers in private households. They clean, cook, care for children, look after elderly family members, and perform other essential tasks for their employers. Despite their important role, they are among the most exploited and abused workers in the world. They often work 14 to 18 hours a day, seven days a week, for wages far below the minimum wage. They may be locked within their workplace and subject to physical and sexual violence. Children and migrant domestic workers are often the most vulnerable.

Migrant domestic workers, predominantly women from poor backgrounds who have had to migrate to support their families, have been widely recognised as being particularly vulnerable to abuse. However in 2012, the UK removed the most basic rights from migrant domestic workers, tying them to their employers and dramatically increasing their vulnerability to exploitation including trafficking for domestic servitude. Since 6 April 2012 migrant domestic workers have entered the UK on a 6 month long non-renewable visa and are prohibited from changing their employer. This leaves them unable to challenge any mistreatment or in practice to access their rights in UK employment law. Migrant domestic workers who enter the UK accompanying diplomats are also prevented from changing employers although they can remain in the UK with the same employer for up to 5 years. For these workers their inability to challenge mistreatment by their employers is compounded by their employers’ claims to diplomatic immunity

Your donation will support these women to come out of the shadows, to become stronger, more confident, to learn their rights and stand up to abuse. Together we can provide ways to overcome isolation and vulnerability and demand respect as workers, as contributors to the British economy and society, and as human beings.
Contribute to our Indiegogo campaign today!
Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word

- Write to you local MP - more MPs need to become aware of the issues facing Migrant Domestic Workers in order to highlight these to the Government, write to you local MP an urge them to support the rights of Migrant Domestic Workers.

- If you are able to donate a service in kind, that is also greatly appreciated. Perhaps you are a lawyer, employment advisor, graphic designer or printing company? We are always looking for people to collaborate with, who share our vision and goals
column2: >- Spread the word about the #Justice4DomesticWorkers

","Short SummaryJustice 4 Domestic Workers is a self-help grass-roots organisation made up of migrant Domestic Workers from around the world established on March 15, 2009. We empower migrant domestic workers in the UK to stand up and voice their opposition to any discrimination, inequality, slavery and all forms of abuse. We show that we are stronger together. J4DW is affiliated with Unite the Union and thanks them and many others for their continued support.
What We Need Your Support For
We are looking to raise £5000 in order to carry on our vital work for a further year.Our Activities include:
Classes for Migrant Domestic Workers in ICT, English language, Arts and Trade Union
Advice and support services for Migrant Domestic Workers, with sign-posting to professional advice where needed
Practical support for Migrant Domestic Workers who have run away from employers or who are in other acute situations
Organising Migrant Domestic Workers to speak out about the value of their work and their entitlement to rights

We wish to raise awareness of our campaign and build greater respect for the domestic work we undertake to improve the living and work conditions throughout private households here in the UK. Community organising is central to J4DW and what we do. We believe that in order to secure our rights we must educate and mobilise ourselves and build links with those who can support us. As well as speaking out for our rights we also solve each other’s practical problems. We find each other emergency accommodation and pool our resources to provide food and clothing.... .....and we do all this on top of our jobs as full time domestic workers! We urgently need your help to continue, to support the increasing number of domestic workers who need us!
£5 will pay for the first meal a runaway worker will eat as a free person
£10 will pay for transport to carry campaign materials to The Houses of Parliament to campaign to end the slavery and abuse Migrant Domestic Workers currently face and endure daily

£12 will buy a London Travelcard for a member to travel to the weekly J4DW meeting, providing possibly the only opportunity for that worker to get out of their workplace, and access support, education and rest for one day
£20 will pay for a taxi to pick up a runaway domestic worker who has escaped an abusive workplace, this taxi will carry this vulnerable and distressed runaway to a secure and safe temporary residence
£35 to fund refreshments and drinks for a Sunday meeting of 40 domestic workers
£40 will fund one class for 30 domestic workers, this class will teach English skills, build confidence, empowering migrant domestic workers to know their rights and speak out against abuse
£50 to pay for one domestic worker to take a Life in the UK test to help their application for British citizenship or settlement in the UK
£120 will fund three classes for 30 domestic workers, this class will teach English skills, build confidence, empowering migrant domestic workers to know their rights and speak out against abuse
£200 will fund five classes for 30 domestic workers, this class will teach English skills, build confidence, empowering migrant domestic workers to know their rights and speak out against abuse

This leaves them unable to challenge any mistreatment or in practice to access their rights in UK employment law. column26:
>Fifth Annual Ahmad Rashad Golf Classic

When you mix together generous sponsors and fantastic celebrities, and play lots of golf for charity, you will surely find yourself having nothing short of a magical time. The Ahmad Rashad Golf Classic takes place on Sunday, June 22nd and Monday, June 23rd and will benefit the work of White Plains Hospital. 

Founded in 2010 by Ahmad Rashad, this benefit opens with a star-studded affair at 42 Restaurant located in the Ritz Carlton in White Plains, NY. The Opening Celebration features unparalleled views of the Manhattan skyline and beyond, gourmet cuisine, specialty cocktails, live entertainment, terrific raffles prizes, lavish dinner and a silent auction.

The Golf Classic is at the exclusive Quaker Ridge Golf Course, one of the more prestigious golf courses in the country. The day begins with brunch and ends with an exciting awards party with dinner and drinks, and a celebration of the golf winners. Golfers are paired with a celebrity and are treated to many on-course refreshments, food and fun activities.

For more information on the 5th Annual Ahmad Rashad Golf Classic, please visit: http://www.ahmadrashadgolfclassic.org


White Plains Hospital

White Plains Hospital is a voluntary health care organization with the primary mission of offering high quality, acute health care and preventative medical care to all people who live in, work in, or visit Westchester County and its surrounding areas. For more than 120 years, White Plains Hospital has provided exceptional care to the community every day, blending today's most sophisticated technologies with compassion, dedication, and excellence.

With nearly 750 doctors treating over 200,000 patients a year, the Hospital is an important resource in the region and is home to a number of specialized programs — offering the type of world-class medical care traditionally found in academic medical centers, but closer to patients’ homes. With an exceptional staff of committed healthcare professionals and incorporation of the latest medical advances into daily patient care, White Plains Hospital has remained strong in a changing healthcare environment.

Centers of Excellence include the Dickstein Cancer Treatment Center, The William &
column28:
Maternity Center and The Ruth and Jerome A. Siegel Stroke Center.  The Hospital has the busiest Emergency Department in Westchester County, seeing over 55,000 visits a year.  The Hospital is fully accredited by the Joint Commission and earned its recognition as a Top Performer for Key Quality Measures® in 2013.  The hospital is also an eleven-time winner of the Consumer Choice Award, an honor given to the nation’s top hospitals by the National Research Corporation, and received Magnet® designation in 2012 from the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC). For additional information, visit http://www.wphospital.org. 


How You Can Help

As a non-profit organization, White Plains Hospital depends largely on donations to maintain its exceptional facility and services. Charitable giving does not require great wealth, any size gift to White Plains Hospital will be deeply appreciated. If you are not in a position to give financially, please help us gain momentum with our campaign by spreading the word to your family and friends.

Contact Information

For more information regarding the 5th Annual Ahmad Rashad Golf Classic please contact Susie Lee at 561.469.7112 ext 205 or susie.lee@jpse.net

I am a wife, mother of 5, soon to be grandmother, and a store owner. I also have Psoriatic Arthritis (doublewhammy.com). I opened Leslie's Loops after my husband was unceremoniously ""let go"" from his position that moved us from Philadelphia to Charlotte six years ago. We needed something that we could build on, a place where I could be comfortable at work, a place I can teach others, and a place where I can continue to work on my craft - crocheting. 
Of course with most businesses, you need a few years.. I know I'm not going to get paid, but I need to make sure the store can stay open. I would go back to work, but that means hiring someone to run the store. Hiring someone to run the store means paying them. Paying them means no money being pumped into the store. No money being pumped into the store means closing the store. I don't want that. 
This is where you all come in. I need help with purchasing more - and better - yarn. I need a new register system that can help me keep up with my inventory. Right now, I'm counting and changing the info in the computer myself. I need to basically keep the lights on. 
You can help me AND receive great incentives in the process! 
With a donation of $25 or more, you can receive:
With a donation of $40 or more, you can receive:
With a donation of $75 or more, you can receive:

What if you don't want any of these items? 
Then please donate anyway, and let me know you don't want anything in return. I will not be offended... 

What if you CAN'T donate? 
Then please share this with everyone you can. That will help me so much! 

Thanks!!

Our fundraising goal is $168,000 which, combined with anticipated historic preservation grants, will provide for full a rehabilitation of The Nelson Homestead.

column1: Just $50,000 raised will allow us to successfully complete Phase 1 of the project - stabilizing the house and preventing the rapid deterioration that is happening right now.  With Phase 1 funding we will:
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(000, 000, 000)
• repair / improve driveway access
• install electrical wiring
• repair a rotted section of foundation
• stabilize the chimneys
• repair / rebuild the roof

The balance of our goal will be put toward completing the exterior wood repair and interior rehabilitation: consultations, repairing floors, windows, fireplaces, molding, plaster, finishing electric wiring, bath and plumbing.  
If we exceed our fundraising goal, we will use the additional $$s to continue grounds improvements and begin implementing projects with the Lower Shore community and beyond including concert events, music education, heritage and environmental conservation programming.

My name is Jennifer Smith. The Nelson Homestead has been in my family for half a century. It was constructed in the early 1800s by Somerset County ship builder Elisha Riggin.  It's one of very few remaining ""telescope""
houses on the Eastern Shore, and is considered
exceptional because of it's unaltered and highly unusual woodwork.
It sits in the middle of 9 secluded acres of meadow, woods, farmland
and wetlands, bordered on the East by Johnson's Creek which provides

access to the Pocomoke Sound.I'm a career musician. For over 20 years my husband, Scott and I have been writing, performing, recording and teaching music around the country.  When I inherited this property in 2012, we began working on how we might create a ""job"" for this house so that, through programming, grant funding and the occasional rental, it will be able to cover it's own upkeep costs.  That's how The Wood and Stone Retreat was born.
Now in it's second year, Scott and I
bring together the nation's top songwriters with musicians from around the country for a 5 day music workshop retreat at the

State Park, 3 miles from the Nelson Homestead.  Each session, we collaborate with the local high school and the community to provide learning opportunities and a free concert event. We love seeing our guests charmed by the
beautiful town of Crisfield and this magical
property. We're excited by the potential of The Nelson Homestead as an artist retreat and Heritage Site and as a contributor to the arts and economy in Somerset County.
Songwriting
class with Phil Madeira,                   Our free concert on the City Dock    Wyatt Easterling and Dan Navarro
For
the past 3 years I've been working with old house specialists,
county, state and federal agencies, contractors, business advisors and friends.  I've been overwhelmed by the ideas and enthusiasm I've
received from so many of you. If it wasn't for your huge outpouring
of encouragement, I probably wouldn't have gotten this far. We now have a well planned strategy and an excellent team  – It's time to get this job done!
OUR TEAMPreservation Consultant Michael Devonshire,
Specialist in Historic
Materials Conservation, History of Construction Technology,
Architectural Documentation and Condition Assessments.
historic preservation consultant since 1985
Jan Hird Pokorny Associates - Senior Architectural Conservator
Columbia
University Professor - Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation, Since
Commissioner, NYC
Landmarks Preservation Commission
New York University: Lecturer in Preservation Case Studies
UMASS Amherst, Graduate Program in Preservation, Architectural Conservation
I, II. Present
Craftsman and General Contractor, Bruce Wooster:

William R Wooster and Sons, Inc is a family run residential construction business in Crisfield, MD with 3 generations of craftsmen with half a century of experience in historic rehabilitation and new construction.
Bruce is also a luthier and member of the Blue Crab Crossing Bluegrass Band.
Preservation Specialist Elizabeth Beckley:
Eastern Shore field director, Preservation Maryland
Six years as principal of Bohemia Manor, LLC, an Eastern Shore firm specializing in historic preservation, restoration and the adaptive reuse of historic buildings
Chairwoman of the Kent County Historic Preservation Commission Board
President of the Friends of Mount Harmon Plantation
Chairwoman of the Millington Planning and Zoning Board of Appeals
She holds a Maryland Home Improvement Contracting license.
Old
houses tell a story. They provide a chronicle. They ground us with a
sense of place and time.They
give us comfort and perspective on where we fit in this huge,
sometimes impersonal world.
Please help us save this unique and important piece of Maryland
history. Together, we can turn it into a destination for musicians, artists and everyone
longing to retreat back to a simpler time and a one of a kind experience on Maryland's remote Lower Eastern Shore.
What We Need
Our fundraising goal is $168,000 which, combined with anticipated historic preservation grants, will provide for full a rehabilitation of The Nelson Homestead.

Just $50,000 raised will allow us to successfully complete Phase 1 of the project - stabilizing the house and preventing the rapid deterioration that is happening right now.  With Phase 1 funding we will:
secure needed preservation consultants & engineers
repair / improve driveway access
install electrical wiring
repair a rotted section of foundation
stabilize the chimneys
repair / rebuild the roof

The balance of our goal will be put toward completing the exterior wood repair and interior rehabilitation: consultations, repairing floors, windows, fireplaces, molding, plaster, finishing electric wiring, bath and plumbing.  If we exceed our fundraising goal, we will use the additional $$s to continue grounds improvements and begin implementing projects with the Lower Shore community and beyond including concert events, music education, heritage and environmental conservation programming.I hope you'll consider making a tax deductible donation of any amount to help preserve this place in
Maryland’s history. I hope you will come visit and experience this place with your
family and friends. If
you can't make a donation, I hope you will share our story and
campaign to spread the word so others can join in our efforts.
Thank You!
GREAT PERKS! In addition to a tax deduction, here are just a few of the Perks we're offering: (we are willing to get creative, so feel free to ask us about mix and match perks/perk combinations)
a replica of the original house key
a Smith Island Cake (you have to see the video!)
a Cruise on the Stephen Thomas to Tangier Island or the Betty Jo Tyler to Smith Island
a crab feast for 4
the 'Musician's Launchpad': Professional photo shoot, album artwork and marketing consultation for your next album release
VIP lawn party and tour of the house
A personal critique of your song by a multi-platinum hit songwriter
A free pass to our 5 day Songwriting Workshop Retreat
A concert in your home (or just about anywhere you want it)
Who's Else Believes in This Project?

The Crisfield Heritage Foundation: “We give our full support to Mrs. Smith's plans. We believe saving the Nelson Homestead is an important project and look forward to incorporating the property into our heritage programming. The City of Crisfield and the surrounding area benefit economically and culturally if Jennifer is able to realize her goal of preserving the Nelson Homestead to become a destination center for music, writing and culture.”

The Somerset County Arts Council: “Mrs. Smith is a native of this area and therefore has a unique perspective of the potential for enrichment of both visiting artists and the interaction of artists with the people. Her plans for an arts center in an authentic homeplace setting will foster both the creativity of the artists and serve as an inspiration and center to further the folk crafts of the region.”
THANK YOU SO MUCH for taking the time to look at our project and for sharing the link to this project page with your friends, family & cohorts!",4.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Paint Out Loud! A Community Art Project.

Edward Hopper said, ""What I wanted to do was paint sunlight on the side of a house."" Color reflects light, and color inspires life. Our mission at Buffalove is to breathe life into our communities, through hard work and LOVE. We believe that where you invest your love, you invest your life.
Today, we are launching a campaign to fund a community art project in Buffalo, NY.

Our goal is to bring fresh paint to 3 houses on our street - Massachusetts Avenue -  on the West Side of Buffalo. We have already committed our time and resources to restoring and painting our own properties [see colors here!], but we need your help to spread the Buffalove!

Our street has suffered many years of dwindling population, but it's also held together by a strong, tight-knit, upstanding community. What better way to express this strength than through bold, bright splashes of color? No construction paper hearts this time [Check out our heart bomb preservation project!].

When (no ""if""s allowed here, this is Buffalo after all, and we BELIEVE!) we meet our goal, we will distribute applications to every house on our street. We will look for homes with a bright future - with caring owners, dedicated to their property and our community - and we will help turn it up a few watts. We will work with homeowners to capture the spirit and vibrancy of our neighborhood - the bolder, the better - and promise not to be disappointed when not everyone chooses sherbet and magenta like we do!
Painting will begin in the spring 2014, or as soon as the weather allows.
$5,000 per house. 3 houses. $15,000.
The Impact

We hope you believe in Buffalo's future as much as we do. At Buffalove we are dedicated to our work. A drop in the proverbial [paint] bucket to you sends ripples through our community and adds energy to its revitalization. Help us bring color to these homes, help us paint the sunlight.
<h3>What We Need &amp
We need 5,000 dollars per house. That will cover the paint, materials and most of the labor. You get to brag to folks that you've helped contribute to the Buffalo renaissance!
<h3>The Nitty Gritty Details - Progress, Cash &amp
column2:
ImplementationAll donations will go directly to this art project - 100%. We will continue to report the progress of this project on our website. We will dedicate our time, energy and brain matter to ensure the houses are painted well and within budget. We will try our hardest to get volunteers to help paint to bring costs down. 

If there is extra cash left because we saved money or whatnot, we will do another house or paint something in the community (ex: a porch, benches... maybe a fence or wall). The goal is to stretch this as much as we can so we create a street filled with color!

column1: Note: The painters will practice lead safe practices and the workers and paint products be locally sourced.
Other Ways You Can Help
Check out www.buffalovedevelopment.com for details on the progress!
If you cannot contribute at this time but want to at a later date, contact buffalovedevelopment@gmail.com or berniceradle@gmail.com!

column2:
>At Saevus-Defense LLC, we specialize in the development of tactical foregrips and hard-parts designed to improve the survivability of our troops. Our applications are also designed for law enforcement, including civilian use.

Our initial product is called the G1 Urban Bayonet™.  Designed for the discerning operator, the G1 Urban Bayonet™ is an ergonomical foregrip that houses a rapid deployment combat blade. The first of its kind,  the G1 Urban Bayonet™ can be fitted to any MIL-STD-1913 picatinny rail system, and was specifically developed for military, law-enforcement, including civilian use. It is intended to offer the operator an additional security platform in the event of rifle malfunctions, forced close quarter combat scenarios, or other perilous situations in which the use of the firearm is not a viable option. 

Our product distinguishes itself by having a single-action, retractable dual-edge knife blade. With the simple twist and push of a safety release button to actuate the spring-assisted blade, the operator immediately benefits from the rapid deployment of the sharpened and lethal knife blade, ready to use at a moments notice.

Conceptualized by a U.S. Serviceman, all Urban Bayonets™ are made to exacting tolerances, and are equipped with the highest level quality materials and components. Saevus-Defense LLC focused on designing and developing a superior product from start to finish.
column3:

column1: If She Can I Can

We aim to be a high functioning, profitable and sustainable enterprise, which can create rapid systemic change. We have published a book featuring some of Australia's 50 most influential women entrepreneurs. We believe that every journey starts with
column5: >inspiration and that inspiration can ignite the belief that 'If She Can I Can'.
column9: >Rare Birds ‘Australia’s 50 Influential Women Entrepreneurs’ shares honest and jaw dropping accounts of some of Australia’s most resilient women. With the likes of Carol Schwartz, Megan Quinn, Naomi Simson, Jodie Fox and Emma Isaacs gracing its pages.

column5: >We believe this book will break moulds and disrupt conventional thoughts of women in entrepreneurship as we know it. Join these women on their real journeys and enjoy a rare look into their motivations, mindsets, sacrifices and what they still dream of achieving.

column1: From the Founder
<div>
<div>

It’s been only 12 months since I dreamt of how I was going to change the landscape for current and future women entrepreneurs globally including the next generation of little girls and boys. It’s so important that they see and believe that being an entrepreneur is a choice, and that the choice can be made while still in school. It’s been merely 27 weeks since we started building the juggernaught and the story of Rare Birds – the true essence of a entrepreneur’s bootstrapped lean start-up.

I wanted to make sure I walked the talk with this build. That we found the best players in the world, that we worked lean, that we scoured the planet for the best tools and resources so we could be be smarter, faster, more efficient and create greater impact.

I have literally had thousands of conversations about Rare Birds with industry potential investors, partners and sponsors, entrepreneurs, government, educators and academics, emerging entrepreneurs, thought leaders, corporate champions, and family and friends.
I wanted to have thousands of conversations. I wanted to know what people really thought about entrepreneurship in Australia, and globally, what we are doing well and what we are stuffing up.

Also what government, industry, councils, leaders, investors, and money people are missing, what they have hit the nail on the head with. I wanted to know why women are starting businesses in droves, why school girls don’t know what an entrepreneur is, and why primary and high school principals can’t name an Australian entrepreneur, male or women. I wanted to know why women who lead entrepreneurial ventures are getting “growth stuck,” and why so few are scaling globally.

Rare Birds is your tribe. A place where you can be part of the conversation, where there is no superiority or inferiority complexes. Where you can learn, grow, mentor, be mentored, find funding, be an investor, attend events, buy a fantastic book and gift that to a school girl and to a school, and see absolutely no barriers to entry to becoming the entrepreneur you want to be.
Why we need your help

At Rare Birds, we have big dreams to positively change the world both socially and economically. But first, we need to start by changing hearts and minds and as a bootstrapped startup we need the funds to achieve the following:

  • We want to see a copy of Rare Birds: 'Australia's 50 Influential Women Entrepreneurs' in the library of every one of the 5500+ schools across Australia.
  • We are offering exclusive opportunities to those that want to support us via Indiegogo: signed books, 'Spend a Day with a Rare Bird', hosted Rare Birds dinners with luminaries, VIP tickets to our book launch, Jo Burston to talk at your school/uni/institution, a business editorial on inspiringrarebirds.com

• Every little bit helps: the funds collected from your support will go towards all production costs of the book: editorial, design, print, photography, management etc as well as achieving the following objectives as future goals:

    • We can achieve great things with your help

By contributing to the Rare Birds mission and vision, you can be a part of helping us:

  • A platform to CELEBRATE and share the good news of women entrepreneurs. Where you can read the real stuff about how, not just the why
<ul> <li>
Create change in 3 countries within 3 years, grow to 500,000 community members of entrepreneurs and supporters, attract 50,000 book sales globally and publish 500 stories of incredible entrepreneurs.
• Rare Birds books in 5500+ school libraries and general educational institutions across Australia.
• Inspire young girls and boys to see and believe that #ifshecanican
• Expose the stories, journeys and ""know how"" of those that have succeeded, learned and continued to never give up as an entrepreneur.
• Build a digital site that has zero barriers to entry for women and girls wanting to find a tribe of like minded entrepreneurs, luminaries and educators.
• Educating 20,000 regional and rural entrepreneurs online, to have entrepreneurship and innovation curriculum for off mainstream education for 8-18 year-olds.

• Become the new business type of the 21st century - ""PROFITABLE SMART HEART"" Where we can make sustainable profits, make social and economic change while at the same time influence and foster the next generation of aspiring entrepreneurs.
Others ways to contribute
<div>
Join us on social media: Facebook  l  Twitter  l  Instagram

column1: ","We are Inspiring Rare Birds
inspiringrarebirds.com
Facebook   l   Twitter  l  Instagram

When one woman travelled around to schools in Australia in 2013 and asked young girls what they thought an entrepreneur was, the majority of them had no idea. The very few that did answered, “a man”. Walking away from that determined to create change and opportunity for women in entrepreneurship
column2: Jo Burston was that one woman, and now the Founder of Rare Birds.

column1: “I want to see 1 million more women entrepreneurs within the next 10 years, globally. That is our mission at Rare Birds. We want to inspire women. We want to give current entrepreneurs a voice. We want to allow them to tell their story and share it with our global community, so that a few years from now, when you ask a young girl what she wants to be when she grows up, it’s not so surprising when she says she wants to own her own company or maybe even change the world,"" says Jo.
If She Can I Can

We aim to be a high functioning, profitable and sustainable enterprise, which can create rapid systemic change. We have published a book featuring some of Australia's 50 most influential women entrepreneurs. We believe that every journey starts with inspiration and that inspiration can ignite the belief that 'If She Can I Can'. Rare Birds ‘Australia’s 50 Influential Women Entrepreneurs’ shares honest and jaw dropping accounts of some of Australia’s most resilient women. With the likes of Carol Schwartz, Megan Quinn, Naomi Simson, Jodie Fox and Emma Isaacs gracing its pages.

We believe this book will break moulds and disrupt conventional thoughts of women in entrepreneurship as we know it. Join these women on their real journeys and enjoy a rare look into their motivations, mindsets, sacrifices and what they still dream of achieving.
From the Founder

It’s been only 12 months since I dreamt of how I was going to change the landscape for current and future women entrepreneurs globally including the next generation of little girls and boys. It’s so important that they see and believe that being an entrepreneur is a choice, and that the choice can be made while still in school. It’s been merely 27 weeks since we started building the juggernaught and the story of Rare Birds – the true essence of a entrepreneur’s bootstrapped lean start-up.

I wanted to make sure I walked the talk with this build. That we found the best players in the world, that we worked lean, that we scoured the planet for the best tools and resources so we could be be smarter, faster, more efficient and create greater impact.

I have literally had thousands of conversations about Rare Birds with industry potential investors, partners and sponsors, entrepreneurs, government, educators and academics, emerging entrepreneurs, thought leaders, corporate champions, and family and friends.
I wanted to have thousands of conversations. I wanted to know what people really thought about entrepreneurship in Australia, and globally, what we are doing well and what we are stuffing up.

Also what government, industry, councils, leaders, investors, and money people are missing, what they have hit the nail on the head with. I wanted to know why women are starting businesses in droves, why school girls don’t know what an entrepreneur is, and why primary and high school principals can’t name an Australian entrepreneur, male or women. I wanted to know why women who lead entrepreneurial ventures are getting “growth stuck,” and why so few are scaling globally.

Rare Birds is your tribe. A place where you can be part of the conversation, where there is no superiority or inferiority complexes. Where you can learn, grow, mentor, be mentored, find funding, be an investor, attend events, buy a fantastic book and gift that to a school girl and to a school, and see absolutely no barriers to entry to becoming the entrepreneur you want to be.
Why we need your help

At Rare Birds, we have big dreams to positively change the world both socially and economically. But first, we need to start by changing hearts and minds and as a bootstrapped startup we need the funds to achieve the following:  We want to see a copy of Rare Birds: 'Australia's 50 Influential Women Entrepreneurs' in the library of every one of the 5500+ schools across Australia. We are offering exclusive opportunities to those that want to support us via Indiegogo: signed books, 'Spend a Day with a Rare Bird', hosted Rare Birds dinners with luminaries, VIP tickets to our book launch, Jo Burston to talk at your school/uni/institution, a business editorial on inspiringrarebirds.com

Every little bit helps: the funds collected from your support will go towards all production costs of the book: editorial, design, print, photography, management etc as well as achieving the following objectives as future goals:    We can achieve great things with your help

By contributing to the Rare Birds mission and vision, you can be a part of helping us: A platform to CELEBRATE and share the good news of women entrepreneurs. Where you can read the real stuff about how, not just the why
Create change in 3 countries within 3 years, grow to 500,000 community members of entrepreneurs and supporters, attract 50,000 book sales globally and publish 500 stories of incredible entrepreneurs.
Rare Birds books in 5500+ school libraries and general educational institutions across Australia.
Inspire young girls and boys to see and believe that #ifshecanican
Expose the stories, journeys and ""know how"" of those that have succeeded, learned and continued to never give up as an entrepreneur.
Build a digital site that has zero barriers to entry for women and girls wanting to find a tribe of like minded entrepreneurs, luminaries and educators.
Educating 20,000 regional and rural entrepreneurs online, to have entrepreneurship and innovation curriculum for off mainstream education for 8-18 year-olds.

Become the new business type of the 21st century - ""PROFITABLE SMART HEART"" Where we can make sustainable profits, make social and economic change while at the same time influence and foster the next generation of aspiring entrepreneurs.
Others ways to contribute
Join us on social media: Facebook  l  Twitter  l  Instagram
Join the Rare Birds community here

Share with us, provide your authentic, real experiences. Your unique experiences. Celebrate. Tell us what is going on in your world so we can illuminate you and your successes. We want the world’s eyes on you!
Men are part of the tribe. We welcome them to the conversation and we most especially welcome the male luminaries to Rare Birds.
We love great conversation, we cherish all opinions and thoughts, but we don’t agree with personal attack.
Most importantly – this is your voice, and your voice strengthens our voice. Use all of our handles and hashtags to RSS feed: #ifshecanican #inspiringrarebirds",6.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Sydney, Australia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/if-she-can-i-can/pica

Dear Friends

Less than a month ago I was traveling in Kashmir. Just weeks after, Kashmir was hit by the most devastatingly cruel flood of all time.
Over 250 people are declared dead, and hundreds of thousands have lost everything they owned.
We cannot help all of them. But lets try to help a few?

The goal of this fund is to help some families that have lost their homes and businesses. The homes of some people that i met personally were submerged under water for days and have been completely destroyed. As for families that own houseboats (which in most cases is also their home) on Dal and Nigeen Lake, their houseboats have been badly damaged and need major repairs. Since tourism is out of the question for a while, they have no other means of livelihood to support themselves until they rebuild their house boats and tourists start coming in.

Since I personally met many of these families, stayed with them, ate with them and became good friends with them, I promise you that EVERY PENNY YOU DONATE WILL GO TO THEIR AID.
I know that a lot of people are concerned that when they donate their money does not reach the victims, and i understand that.
I WILL BE MAKING SURE THAT THE MONEY GOES DIRECTLY TO THESE FAMILIES' BANK ACCOUNTS, AND THAT NO MIDDLEMEN OR THIRD PARTY IS INVOLVED.

If you have taken the time to read this, it shows that you care! So please, donate generously. We are grateful for every Dollar/Rupee we receive.

The Short Pitch:

If you believe the continued existence of independent small press publishing is important, or simply enjoy quality speculative fiction that prioritizes new voices from women and other historically marginalized points of view, please support Hadley Rille Books with your money and your time. Your support will allow us to keep producing fabulous fiction for your reading pleasure. We also offer a variety of perks as an expression of our appreciation.


The Long Pitch, With Explanations Of Who We Are, What We Do and Why We Need Your Support:

Founded in 2005, Hadley Rille Books is a quality small press that publishes exceptional titles in fantasy, science fiction, and historical fiction. Our critically acclaimed authors craft a variety of worlds with diverse, complex characters, including everyday people who face extraordinary challenges.

We believe that the literary world needs more diverse voices, so we make a special effort to publish more women authors and to offer stories that feature women in prominent roles. Our stories portray both women and men as active, complex, interesting characters. Our novels, novellas, and short stories feature women of all ages and from all walks of life who play key roles in the histories of their people. In addition, Hadley Rille has made a professional commitment to help encourage and promote women’s involvement in the SFF community through projects like the Heroines of Fantasy blog and author appearances on panels and at conventions that engage with women’s changing roles as both authors and characters.

Our authors and their work have earned many prestigious honors and awards, including Nebula and Hugo nominations. Many of our titles have garnered praise and positive reviews in industry review publications such as Publisher’s Weekly, Booklist, Locus and Library Journal. Our books have made their way into libraries across the globe. Some of our novels are already in translation for distribution in languages other than English
column2:
by the end of the decade, Hadley Rille books intends to branch more fully into the international market and reach the hands, minds and hearts of even more readers.

Hadley Rille Books prides itself on being an independent small press, and we are committed to establishing strong, lasting working relationships with our authors. Small press publishing provides a vital “middle way” between the faceless corporate machine of the big publishing houses and the gutsy if lonely jack-of-all-trades DIY attitude of self-publishing. We like to think that small press publishing is the way publishing really should be: collaborative with and respectful of authors, and focused on the goal of sharing quality stories in attractive packages that delight a diverse audience. We believe that authors can and do come to us in a variety of different ways
column3:
that there are so many good stories to tell and wonderful ways to tell them. For this reason, we continue to accept open submissions from both agented and unagented sources, and give a thorough review of every submission received. Indeed, the majority of our published novels and stories were pulled from the “slush pile,” and, while labor-intensive, we have every intention of continuing this submission process.

But here’s the truth: small press is more often a labor of love than a money-making machine. We are in it for the love of stories, for the joy in sharing good art with an audience who appreciates it. Running a story-centric, collaborative press takes a huge amount of time and energy, both from the creative side and the business side. Up until now, Hadley Rille has been successfully run as a one-man operation by our fearless founder, Eric T. Reynolds, with the capable assistance of a handful of other largely volunteer staff who help with submissions, editing, production and marketing.

But things are changing: as a press, Hadley Rille has grown. Now we need help getting to the next level, where we can create even better products and get them in front of even more appreciative eyeballs. We have now produced nearly 50 terrific, top-quality titles that we want to continue to share with the world—but our ability to market and sell them with the finite resources we currently have is shrinking. Eric and his assistants can’t do it alone any longer. In order to get to the point where this renewable process of “make books to sell books to make books to sell books” becomes sustainable, we need to make a concerted push to market and sell more titles.

Here’s where you come in.

How You Can Support Hadley Rille Books

Here are our goals:

column1: <li>Increase marketing and promotion to let the world know that we have
something special to offer the publishing world, that our stories are as
diverse, unique and engaging as the authors who write them.
• Get more books on the shelves of local brick-and-mortar stores and into readers’ hands.
• Create a stronger presence at professional conventions such as Worldcon, World Fantasy, ALA and SCBWI.
• Sign more authors into the Hadley Rille family.
• Maintain a strong list of print, ebook and audio titles with a permanently in-print backlist.

How You Can Help In The Short Term:

First and foremost, we need your financial support to hire additional help on the marketing and sales front. If more people know about our books, we’ll sell more books, and if we sell more books, we’ll have more money to plow back into producing more top-quality products that readers enjoy. 

Your support will help us employ professional publicists, create compelling marketing materials and opportunities (print and electronic catalogs, website upgrades, online advertising, postcards, bookmarks, flyers, advanced reader copies, presence at professional conferences), and run targeted marketing campaigns in order to boost awareness of and create buzz around our terrific books. We have set our goal at $12,500 because after paying for this campaign and its fees and perks, we think the amount left over will be the minimum amount we will need to reach our initial marketing goals. Of course, if we exceed our initial funding goal, we can do more--so keep an eye out for stretch goals!

We also need help publicizing this campaign! Let your friends, family, and social networks know about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools. The wider we can spread the word, the more support we can grow.


How You Can Help In The Long Term:

Buy our books. Read them. Review them. Be a fan. Be an evangelist. Tell your friends about them. Tell your book groups, your librarians and bookstores about them. Nominate them for awards. Check back often to see what’s new. Suggest or submit compatible stories to us that you’d like to see published. Stay engaged.


What You Get In Return For Supporting Hadley Rille Books (aka The List Of Fabulous Perks):

$5 - Appreciation and a Bookmark
Your name will appear on a list of beloved campaign supporters on Hadley Rille's website and Facebook page, and we will send you an awesome ""I <
column2:

$150 - 50-Page Manuscript Critique
For $150, you will receive a critique by an HRB author or editor of the first 50 pages (up to 13,000 words) of your unpublished manuscript. Critique may include in-text commentary as well as a final write-up.


$200 - All the E-books!
For $200, you will receive the full catalog of all HRB e-books (approximately 40 books). Includes all anthologies, novels, and short stories in your choice of format (.mobi, .epub or .pdf).


$250 - Special Original Piece of Artwork from Comic Artist Art Thibert
For $250, you will receive a one-of-a-kind, collectible art piece, drawn and inked by long-time Marvel and DC Comics inker Art Thibert! In addition to providing the beautiful cover for Kim Vandervort's Northern Queen, Thibert has made a career of professionally inking comic fan favorites such as Wolverine, Batman, and so many other characters. Read more about Art at http://www.artbythibert.com/.

$300 - Kindle Paperwhite + All The E-books!
For $300, you will receive a Kindle Paperwhite e-book reader with the full catalog of all HRB e-books (approximately 40 titles including anthologies, novels and shorts) pre-loaded.


$400 - Kindle Fire HD + All The E-books!
For $400, you will receive a Kindle Fire HD e-book reader with the full catalog of all HRB e-books (approximately 40 titles including anthologies, novels and shorts) pre-loaded.


$500 - Kindle Fire HDX + All The E-books!
For $500, you will receive a Kindle Fire HD e-book reader with the full catalog of all HRB e-books (approximately 40 titles including anthologies, novels and shorts) pre-loaded.


$1000 - Book Cover Design
Hadley Rille’s lead cover designer, Heather McDougal, will work with you to design a front cover for your book or short fiction. The cover can be used for print or e-book, and includes the following:

“I give you three rough mockups.  You look at them and decide which one you like best, and tell me if there are any simple changes you want to make (color, font, texture, etc).  I take it away and polish it up, and give it back to you.  Then you get one more go, making 3-5 simple changes (usually worth about an hour or so of work).

After that, I usually charge at $50 an hour for any further work.  For this particular perk, I will include four hours of free work if needed.

I'm pretty picky and I want to make sure you get a good cover.  By the end of the first couple of passes you should have a really solid cover that you can take away with you.  The hourly rate are simply for those people who have a design eye and need it to be perfect, which takes more time.”

To see examples of Heather's work, click here.


$1500 - Full Manuscript Critique
For $1500, you will receive a full manuscript critique on your unpublished book (up to 125,000 words). An HRB author or editor will read your entire book and provide a detailed, 5-10 page critique focusing on what works and doesn’t work, along with suggestions for improvement.


$2500 - Heroines of Fantasy Writer’s Retreat
Join at least 3 other Hadley Rille authors (final number will depend on availability) for a long weekend at a private cabin in beautiful Stinson Beach, CA for a ""Heroines of Fantasy"" writer's retreat. Enjoy quiet, focused writing time, rejuvenating walks on the beach and evenings of convivial critique and camaraderie. You will have a private bedroom, but share bathroom and living area. All meals and snacks will be provided, but you must get yourself back and forth to the cabin. Specific dates will be arranged to suit everyone’s schedule, but the retreat will be for three days and two nights (Friday-Sunday).


$4000 - Full Manuscript Edit
For $4000, one of our HRB editors will read your entire novel (up to 125,000 words) and provide a full, detailed manuscript edit, including developmental feedback and line editing services to help prepare your novel for publication.

Here is the gorgeous graphic designed by HRB's lead cover designer, Heather McDougal, which will grace the bookmarks, Indiegogo-only bookplates, and t-shirts used as perks for this campaign:


","The Short Pitch:If you believe the continued existence of independent small press publishing is important, or simply enjoy quality speculative fiction that prioritizes new voices from women and other historically marginalized points of view, please support Hadley Rille Books with your money and your time. Your support will allow us to keep producing fabulous fiction for your reading pleasure. We also offer a variety of perks as an expression of our appreciation.The Long Pitch, With Explanations Of Who We Are, What We Do and Why We Need Your Support:Founded in 2005, Hadley Rille Books is a quality small press that publishes exceptional titles in fantasy, science fiction, and historical fiction. Our critically acclaimed authors craft a variety of worlds with diverse, complex characters, including everyday people who face extraordinary challenges. We believe that the literary world needs more diverse voices, so we make a special effort to publish more women authors and to offer stories that feature women in prominent roles. Our stories portray both women and men as active, complex, interesting characters. Our novels, novellas, and short stories feature women of all ages and from all walks of life who play key roles in the histories of their people. In addition, Hadley Rille has made a professional commitment to help encourage and promote women’s involvement in the SFF community through projects like the Heroines of Fantasy blog and author appearances on panels and at conventions that engage with women’s changing roles as both authors and characters. Our authors and their work have earned many prestigious honors and awards, including Nebula and Hugo nominations. Many of our titles have garnered praise and positive reviews in industry review publications such as Publisher’s Weekly, Booklist, Locus and Library Journal. Our books have made their way into libraries across the globe. Some of our novels are already in translation for distribution in languages other than English
column3: by the end of the decade, Hadley Rille books intends to branch more fully into the international market and reach the hands, minds and hearts of even more readers.Hadley Rille Books prides itself on being an independent small press, and we are committed to establishing strong, lasting working relationships with our authors. Small press publishing provides a vital “middle way” between the faceless corporate machine of the big publishing houses and the gutsy if lonely jack-of-all-trades DIY attitude of self-publishing. We like to think that small press publishing is the way publishing really should be: collaborative with and respectful of authors, and focused on the goal of sharing quality stories in attractive packages that delight a diverse audience. We believe that authors can and do come to us in a variety of different ways
column4: that there are so many good stories to tell and wonderful ways to tell them. For this reason, we continue to accept open submissions from both agented and unagented sources, and give a thorough review of every submission received. Indeed, the majority of our published novels and stories were pulled from the “slush pile,” and, while labor-intensive, we have every intention of continuing this submission process.But here’s the truth: small press is more often a labor of love than a money-making machine. We are in it for the love of stories, for the joy in sharing good art with an audience who appreciates it. Running a story-centric, collaborative press takes a huge amount of time and energy, both from the creative side and the business side. Up until now, Hadley Rille has been successfully run as a one-man operation by our fearless founder, Eric T. Reynolds, with the capable assistance of a handful of other largely volunteer staff who help with submissions, editing, production and marketing. But things are changing: as a press, Hadley Rille has grown. Now we need help getting to the next level, where we can create even better products and get them in front of even more appreciative eyeballs. We have now produced nearly 50 terrific, top-quality titles that we want to continue to share with the world—but our ability to market and sell them with the finite resources we currently have is shrinking. Eric and his assistants can’t do it alone any longer. In order to get to the point where this renewable process of “make books to sell books to make books to sell books” becomes sustainable, we need to make a concerted push to market and sell more titles.Here’s where you come in.How You Can Support Hadley Rille BooksHere are our goals:

column1: Increase marketing and promotion to let the world know that we have
something special to offer the publishing world, that our stories are as
diverse, unique and engaging as the authors who write them.
Get more books on the shelves of local brick-and-mortar stores and into readers’ hands.
Create a stronger presence at professional conventions such as Worldcon, World Fantasy, ALA and SCBWI.
Sign more authors into the Hadley Rille family.
Maintain a strong list of print, ebook and audio titles with a permanently in-print backlist.

How You Can Help In The Short Term:First and foremost, we need your financial support to hire additional help on the marketing and sales front. If more people know about our books, we’ll sell more books, and if we sell more books, we’ll have more money to plow back into producing more top-quality products that readers enjoy.  Your support will help us employ professional publicists, create compelling marketing materials and opportunities (print and electronic catalogs, website upgrades, online advertising, postcards, bookmarks, flyers, advanced reader copies, presence at professional conferences), and run targeted marketing campaigns in order to boost awareness of and create buzz around our terrific books. We have set our goal at $12,500 because after paying for this campaign and its fees and perks, we think the amount left over will be the minimum amount we will need to reach our initial marketing goals. Of course, if we exceed our initial funding goal, we can do more--so keep an eye out for stretch goals!We also need help publicizing this campaign! Let your friends, family, and social networks know about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools. The wider we can spread the word, the more support we can grow. How You Can Help In The Long Term:Buy our books. Read them. Review them. Be a fan. Be an evangelist. Tell your friends about them. Tell your book groups, your librarians and bookstores about them. Nominate them for awards. Check back often to see what’s new. Suggest or submit compatible stories to us that you’d like to see published. Stay engaged.What You Get In Return For Supporting Hadley Rille Books (aka The List Of Fabulous Perks):

$5 - Appreciation and a BookmarkYour name will appear on a list of beloved campaign supporters on Hadley Rille's website and Facebook page, and we will send you an awesome ""I <3 True Heroines"" bookmark. Scroll all the way to the bottom to see the True Heroines graphic, created by HRB's lead cover designer, Heather McDougal.$10 - 1 HRB E-book Of Your ChoiceWhich do you like best: science fiction, fantasy, or historical fiction? My 12 year old son, Todd, died suddenly when he was struck by a car just over 21 years ago.  That day my world was shattered and I began a long and painful journey through grief.  Armed with little more than my pure grit and determination to keep Todd with me, I spent the next 20 years working my way through my own spiritual journey until I recently reconnected to him in the most amazing way.  Todd's dance helped to heal my broken heart and open my eyes to the unlimited possibilities in the Universe.  I am so grateful that it was captured so I can share it with you here.

It's my honor and privilege to establish a nonprofit organization in Todd's memory.  Our Mission Statement: We seek to provide a bridge to assist others through their grief, one step, one dance at a time. 

To that end, this campaign seeks your help in acquiring the funds to set up the nonprofit organization including all necessary federal and state filing fees and professional services including legal and accounting fees.  All funds raised will be dedicated to the formation of the nonprofit organization and any excess funds raised will be held on deposit until the organization's nonprofit status is approved by the Internal Revenue Service.

Our website, www.dancewithtodd.com was recently launched on Feb. 7th...on the 21st anniversary of Todd's death.  It was important that we turned the tragic event of his death at 12 into something triumphant 21 years later.  The website serves a sacred space where others who have lost loved ones, especially children, are loved and supported by us to help them in their healing process.  Parents are encouraged to share pictures or stories about their children on the site as well to build an inclusive community of support.  In creating a safe haven and community of support, the healing continues for all of us.  I encourage you to share the website with anyone you know that may benefit from our message.

Our next steps following the formation of the nonprofit will focus on: teaching others to move through grief using the power of music and dance, writing my Memoir of my personal journey, and generally sharing our message of hope, love and joy.

Each donor of $25 or more in this campaign will be recognized on our website, www.dancewithtodd.com as a supporter of our sacred mission.  Sharing our campaign with others is also truly appreciated to help us reach our goal. 

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your consideration of our cause.  Much love and light to each of you -

Sherri Sengsouvanna

Adon Williams
I am a young entrepreneur with sound business ethics and morals. I am also a
dreamer, “paint a picture with imagination and go for it in real life”. This
attitude reflects in my day to day life from my dreams to become a baseball
player or to visit every continent in the world I strive and push for these
dreams to come true. This reflects the Mad Chiller Lifestyle sending
positivity, relaxation and fun vibes to anyone with a dream.
Chad Miller
It’s a journey of self-discovery. I’ve spent the bulk of my life and career
reinventing myself to foster personal growth. I’ve lived in California, New
York, North Carolina, Vermont, Ukraine, and now Miami! After my travels, I
embrace both theoretical and practical knowledge. If I could do anything I
wanted tomorrow, I’d go snowboarding. Paul Newman’s a personal role model. He
spent the bulk of his life creating a great business that continues to
positively impact the world. Through Mad Chiller, we strive to be the best part

of your day. One love!

MAD CHILLER CAFE

For the last 50 years, Bob Marley's music has brought people together through a communal appreciation of peace, love, and harmony. In the image of the late Bob Marley, Mad Chiller strives to create the Mad Chiller Cafe, a sustainability focused cafe where people from around the world can come together and celebrate the finer things in life, like coffee, music, and community.

MAD CHILLER POWER

Mad Chiller commits to creating a network of cafes that run 100% from
onsight solar and wind generators and draws 0 power from the electric

grid.

SUSTAINABILITY AND ORGANICS

Your body and mind should be a temple.  It is our commitment to you that
we source all of Mad Chiller products from farms that share our
commitment to sustainability and organics.  For example, did you know
that all woods used in House of Marley products are Forest Stewardship
Council (FSC) Certified.  In addition, Marley Coffee boasts a full array
of USDA Certified Organic and Rainforest Alliance certified coffee
beans.  Its that voracious commitment to picking the right products that

differentiates Mad Chiller.

THE CHILDREN OF OCHO RIOS

On our last trip to Ocho Rios, we observed something that will shape
the future of the Mad Chiller Cafe Ocho Rios... Children of Ocho Rios
have nowhere to go after school. There were several instances of high
school kids passing by, book bags in tow, walking the streets of Ocho
Rios.  At the Mad Chiller Cafe, we will create a safe environment that
fosters growth and education.  We will give the local students a place
to study, tutor, and connect to the outside world with access to
dedicated computers and high speed internet.
MARLEY COFFEE
<div>
Marley Coffee® was founded by Rohan Marley, son of the legendary and beloved musician, Bob Marley [Robert Nesta Marley O.M.].
Bob Marley always said he would return to farming one day. With Marley
Coffee, Bob’s son Rohan fulfills the dream. Rohan remembers his
grandmother drying their wild coffee berries in the sun, then hulling
and roasting them for her own cup of coffee each morning. Marley Coffee
is determined to deliver that same intoxicating aroma and rich smooth
flavor into every cup.
Marley Coffee places a premium on sustainability and ethically farmed
beans.  Marley Coffee sources and artisan roasts it's gourmet coffee in
premier locations worldwide, including the famous Blue Mountains of

Jamaica.

THE HOUSE OF MARLEY



The House of Marley builds on the principles of superior quality,
earth-friendliness, and commitments to global charitable causes. The
House of Marley enhances lives through great product experiences, as
well as investing proceeds from product sales to enhance and support

community efforts around the world.

MAD CHILLER PROMISE

Mad Chiller continues to grow in popularity and awareness.  However, we
need your support to begin the next phase of our growth, the Mad Chiller
Cafe.  Please help us to shape what Mad Chiller becomes by donating
whatever you can to our effort. We will be opening our first cafe in
Ocho Rios Jamaica.  We commit to using the proceeds to enhance and
better the local communities of Jamaica. We promise to pay your donation
forward for generations to come.  Thank you for listening.
One Love,
Mad Chiller
