What is the International Beauty Project?

So you may be wondering why we’re doing this project. Why an international beauty project? and why a campaign for smiles?

Well, the answer is actually quite simple. We want to show the world that beauty can be found in each and every individual person. We are going to take pictures of everyday people: men, women, children. People who are old or young.

Our promise is that we will never Photoshop any of our images. Because they are already perfect. Well, perfectly imperfect. 

Being perfect and beautiful isn't worth it. It won’t make you happy and it won’t make you successful. Your imperfections make you who you are. And that is what we have set out to prove.

What We Need &
• As young adults, we don't have a ton of money for gas, food, or lodging while we're taking photos. Your generous donations will keep us moving.
• Read our section about perks to hear the exciting and sometimes tasty incentives!
• If we don't reach our entire goal we will still accept the donations. There will not be a refund.

The Impact

  • My sister and I decided to start this project as a way to help women like me accept that they are beautiful in their own way. We want to show that everyone has imperfections but that being imperfect makes us who we are. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise!! Spread the word about our campaign and like us on Facebook.

Short Summary

The GCT's Thailand partner, Urban Light, focuses on freeing and empowering boys from 6-18 years old from the bars and brothels that they were sold into when they were young. Unfortunately these boys were born in the mountain tribes of Thailand and are not considered Thai citizens so they don't have identification which makes it nearly impossible to receive education or a job that's not on the streets.  Urban Light provides a safe place for the boys to eat, sleep, and psychologically and spiritually heal from their horrifying experience. Urban Light then provides empowerment training in the form of reading, writing and math skills as well as basic skills like sewing and cooking in order for them to try to find employment that is safe and stable.  The GCT is partnering with Urban Light to raise prayers, funds and awareness to construct a coffee and pastry shop for the 300 boys Urban Light has taken under their wing. Coffee is huge in Thailand and the coffee shops are always packed.  We already have a manager at a Starbucks in New York City who is coming with us to train these boys on our next mission, but we need to raise the funds to have the small coffee shop built/renovated as well as purchase the tables, chairs, lighting, and coffee grinders, etc.  We're all very excited to partner with Urban Light to rescue these boys and give them a new life of healing and joy as they find new friends, family, education, employment, and hopefully a sense of spiritual freedom from the pain of being forced to work in the brothels in the past.  Please pray for them and this effort and if you feel called to donate $5, $500, or $5,000, it would literally be changing the course of 300 young lives with so much potential! Please forward this to your friends, family, or church to keep the word spreading! And if you'd like to be even more involved, you can email me at phoenix.eyre@thegct.com and we can chat about ways to further partner with The GCT, Urban Light and the boys of Chiang Mai, Thailand and beyond. If you can pray, donate the price of a coffee, and share this with another person, that would be INCREDIBLE. Thanks for everything and may your week be blessed and bright!

Note** The challenges we face are the relative economic and political instability in northern Thailand currently, especially when it comes to helping these specific victims of trafficking since they are displaced refugees from Burma/Myanmar. We're working in conjunction with IJM (The International Justice Mission) to help get the trafficking victims their citizenship papers so they can have access to better jobs, education and medical care in the near future. The coffee shop is step one in order for the kids to make enough money to keep them from returning to the brothels every night. Economic, educational, medical and psychological development and care are what we have planned coming down the pipeline to give them a new chance at a normal and healthy life.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need to raise $30,000 to help rent the shop, renovate it, buy the espresso machines, tables, chairs, lights, signs, etc. We also want to leave the coffee shop some cushion funding to pay the boys good wages for a few months in case the coffee shop has a hard time getting off the ground for any reason.
We have some really fun and frankly AWESOME perks if you can help out so check em out!
Other Ways You Can Help
Pray :-)

Tell some people about what we're doing so they can donate a few dollars and keep it in their prayers too! Send some emails, put it on your social media, tell some friends at work or church and tell your family about what they can do to help change the lives of these boys and give them hope in a bright future!
Come with us if you feel called to!

 This campaign
is raising funds on behalf of Future Boston Alliance thru Massachusetts Voter
Education, a verified nonprofit, as their fiscal sponsor .

Late Nite T Service Can Be Ours!

We at Future Boston know how much people in Boston long for late night T service. We have heard complaints about how much it sucks to have to leave a fun night to make the last train.  We have heard from entrepreneurs and 3rd shift workers about their lack of transportation options when getting off of work. 

Two years ago Future Boston Alliance called for Bostonians to come together and bring about a cultural renaissance in the city. Boston is ready to become a 21st century city reflective of the amazing institutions and people that make this city so great.  

On March 13 Governor Deval Patrick will announce the beginning of Late Night T Service for Boston. It's really going to happen and Bostonians we have help keep it.  Future Boston plans on throwing events to encourage late night ridership and supporting the MBTA in this effort.  

Your gift will help us make sure the Future Boston community is involved in making this pilot is a success.  

What We Need &
Boston will loose late night service if we don't use it.  We need to raise $35,000 in order to support the Late Night Service and promote accessibility and access for all residents of Boston.
• The goal of this campaign will ensure the public is involved in the roll out and longevity Late Night T Service.
• The $35,000 will be used to become a sponsor of this Late Night T Service and build out late night ridership programs including public education and T parties by targeted train stations.
• If the goal is not met, the funds will be used for a smaller roll out.

The Impact

Late Night T Service is something we all want.  Bostonians are tired of having to plan their night to catch a train by 12:30am.  This has a chilling effect on nightlife business and hurts people who work late night.  This program is a private/public partnership and Future Boston believes its a great opportunity to build out a space for community.  

By helping us reach this goal we will have the opportunity to
• From the beginning, we called for a shift in Boston including late night service, we believe to be strategically placed to help ensure citizens are represented publicly in this pilot.

• Since its inception, Future Boston has brought together thousands of Bostonians to support the creative economy in Boston.  We have a strong track record of impact, including supporting the launch of 8 creative businesses, through our business accelerator, brought 245 Boston youth together to begin to collectively create a shared vision for Boston and helped pass the home rule petition on liquor licenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute money, please consider giving in other ways:
• Let people know the T is going to start running later and encourage them to take advantage of it!
• Please spread the word about our fundraising campaign!

Future Boston Alliance is fiscally sponsored by MassVOTE.  Thanks you for your contribution.

About Us...

Axe throwing is a unique sport that quickly becomes addictive once you have stuck your first hatchet. My business partner, Stephanie and I have been throwing and traveling together for a little over a year now and want nothing more than to share the enjoyment of axe throwing with others. We have such love for the sport that we want to level up and run our venue. We have experienced many venues in many locations and we want to be able to put our own flare into presenting the sport to others. We have supported many venues and have seen first hand how amazing the axe world and the people within it are. With Stephanie’s background in business and project management and my design and managerial skills, the plan is to grow the business with our passion and connections we’ve built within the community as our best assets.

We will be bringing this experience to the Buffalo/Grand Island/Niagara Falls region following WATL official standards. One word that is often used to describe the sport is community. It really has a way of bringing folks together no matter the diversity. The sport is growing fast and is quickly becoming an impressive skill to brag to friends about. Another great thing about axe throwing is its a therapeutic stress reliever for all.  Axe throwing facilities are one-of-a-kind entertainment venues that breed a passion for the sport whether you’re simply there to enjoy a good time or you want to train to compete with the best.

Axe throwers use a hatchet and toss it down a fenced lane into a target that is no less than 12 feet away. Throwers can not cross the fault line, a barrier enforced for safety, until a judge deems it time for the player to retrieve their axe. Axe throwing establishments maintain the lanes and targets, provide coaching and ensure that everything meets with insurance and affiliation guidelines.

Axe throwing leagues started in 2006 in one man’s backyard in Toronto, ON Canada and consisted of a bunch of friends looking for something to do. Eventually there was so much interest he rented a space and created the business aspect of the sport in 2011. There are two factions within the sport, originally starting with IATF (International Axe Throwing Federation), formally NATF (National Axe Throwing Federation) and WATL (World Axe Throwing League) which was formed a bit later in 2016. In 2019 there are now more than 125 venues in the United States and 300 locations worldwide.

Our location is a border city and currently there is only one affiliated venue across the border offering IATF leagues and two unaffiliated venues on this side offering a WATL-like system that do not offer leagues.

We will have 5 bays, 2 targets per bay, for a total of 10 targets allowing a capacity of 240 guests in a total space of 3,994 square feet. We will have a merchandise area, a private VIP area, a lounge area to relax in, as well as areas to be involved in the axe action. We plan on offering open throw hours during the week where guest can visit at their leisure, league nights consisting of 7 weeks of round robin games and the 8th week being a playoff, as well as event bookings such as bachelor/bachelorette, birthdays, corporate team building, etc. We plan on being open if pre-booked every day, or 4 days without pre-bookings for open throw and league nights.

We intend to offer non-alcoholic beverage options as well as beer and wine once our license has been approved. This is meant to be an add on to the business, and not a major focus as we do not want to be considered a local bar. For alcohol consumption, customers will need to show their ID upon entrance to acquire a wrist band, staff can also check IDs at their discretion within the venue.

To abide by our liquor license requirements we will offer a limited menu on site, such as ramen and microwavable foods for purchase. There will be a preparation station, a microwave and hot plates. We plan to have a snow cone machine and a popcorn machine where guests can help themselves. We will be working with several food trucks to come during peak hours. We will be partnering with a local pizza place and other restaurants for delivery options. We have already talked with a few places and have had nothing but positive feedback.

Grand Island is an up and coming area that has great potential for growth. We will be situated in a complex that houses many other successful businesses, one is a pickle ball venue that hosts thriving leagues. If you can throw a ball you can most certainly throw an axe because it is an all inclusive activity that requires no experience. It was also announced that Amazon has bought more than 184 acres on Grand Island for a massive distribution centre that has the potential to house thousands of workers.

Grand Island is a tight knit community and we have had only positive reactions from locals upon hearing about our upcoming opening. Many have offered their assistance in what ways they could and are excited to try out the sport as well as join leagues.

Your donations will go towards merchandise, alcohol licensing, renovations and decor, a POS system, tablets and monitors, marketing, staff training as well as unforeseen costs due to the global pandemic. We want our venue to welcome those new to axe throwing and foster the inclusivity the sport encompasses.  The basic requirements to be operational will be handled by the landlords and we have negotiated their assistance with renovating the space.

We will need to do renovations to the location we have leased, this may have hidden cost we aren't anticipating. We have permission to completely change the space and we are confident in our design layout design. We will have to obtain permits such as a liquor licence and we are aware there many moving parts that may influence our target date, especially amidst the global pandemic.

We will be partnering with a local pizza place and other restaurants for delivery options. We have already talked with a few places and have had nothing but positive feedback.
Local Restaurants & Pizza Places

Grand Island is an up and coming area that has great potential for growth. We will be situated in a complex that houses many other successful businesses, one is a pickle ball venue that hosts thriving leagues. If you can throw a ball you can most certainly throw an axe because it is an all inclusive activity that requires no experience. It was also announced that Amazon has bought more than 184 acres on Grand Island for a massive distribution centre that has the potential to house thousands of workers.
Projected Customer Base

Grand Island is a tight knit community and we have had only positive reactions from locals upon hearing about our upcoming opening. Many have offered their assistance in what ways they could and are excited to try out the sport as well as join leagues.

Your donations will go towards merchandise, alcohol licensing, renovations and decor, a POS system, tablets and monitors, marketing, staff training as well as unforeseen costs due to the global pandemic. We want our venue to welcome those new to axe throwing and foster the inclusivity the sport encompasses.  The basic requirements to be operational will be handled by the landlords and we have negotiated their assistance with renovating the space.

We will need to do renovations to the location we have leased, this may have hidden cost we aren't anticipating. We have permission to completely change the space and we are confident in our design layout design. We will have to obtain permits such as a liquor licence and we are aware there many moving parts that may influence our target date, especially amidst the global pandemic.",9.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Grand Island, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/grand-throw-house-help-expand-the-axe-community/pica

Josie Nordman is a brave and inspiring young woman who needs new lungs.
We need to raise enough money to give them to her.

Josie was a student of mine when I taught at a summer theater program at the Goodman Theatre. I was blown away by her passion, her determination, and her bright, enduring optimism. Josie is now 19 and thriving while studying theater at Northwestern University.

She also has Cystic Fibrosis, her lung function is now down to 22%, and she needs a lung transplant. One of the many reasons I loved getting to know Josie during our summer at the Goodman is that I grew up in a family that was affected by her same disease - my little sister was diagnosed with Cystic Fibrosis when she was 17 months old. CF is a progressive disease that deteriorates lung function at its own unpredictable rate. There is, as of yet, no known cure. Josie's lungs can no longer function properly, and she needs new ones.

Luckily she is now on the lung transplant list and is just awaiting the call to receive new lungs. However, the cost of this procedure is astronomical, and I am asking for our communities to help alleviate this cost for Josie's family, as they are already struggling to cover other medical expenses.

Cystic Fibrosis is a terrible disease. Thankfully patients like Josie and my sister have the bravery to fight it, and to stay positive and strong while they do so. Someday there will be a cure, but for now, I hope you will consider donating to help Josie breathe freely once again.
A Note From Josie's Mother...
My 19 year old daughter Josie has a disease called Cystic Fibrosis CF is genetic disease (
column3: s=1"" rel=""nofollow noopener"" target=""_blank"">www.CFF.org) that she was diagnosed with at age 4 months. As time has progressed, so has her disease. After suffering a very large loss of lung function (normal is 100%, she now has 22%) in August, she was evaluated for a lung transplant. She was placed on the lung transplant list on December 12, 2012. With end stage lung disease, a lung transplant is the only hope of living. Josie is a Sophomore at Northwestern University, majoring in theater. Up until September, she was an avid equestrian but due to loss of lung function can no longer ride. She is still attending classes at Northwestern while waiting for her transplant. She has never seen herself as the kind of girl who ""just gives up"" or ""sits around feeling sorry for herself"". She knows the call for transplant could come at any time yet she is trying to enjoy her life to the fullest while waiting. She is a member of the Chi Omega Sorority and the Northwestern Equestrian team. She is producing a play at Northwestern in the spring if all goes well and someday hopes to study abroad.

column1: We recently found out that our portion of the cost of the lung transplant will be somewhere between $50,000 and $75,000. We were floored! We are struggling to pay our monthly bills due to so many medical costs that we have no idea how to come up with this kind of money. We need a miracle, I am hoping that the kindness of strangers will provide that.
Please help us raise the money we need to be able to pay for our portion of Josie's lung transplant and related expenses.

Help us help Josie get back to being able to attend school without carrying oxygen, act in shows without worrying about coughing or needing to sit down and help her to again ""fly"" on the back of the horses she loves so much.
Please contribute what you can to help Josie! NO DONATION IS TOO SMALL...Whether you have $5 to spare or $100, ANYTHING HELPS!
Note: We need to raise a lot more than the $10,000 goal listed! (The procedure will cost anywhere between $50,000 and $75,000!) So please, keep giving even if our goal is reached!

Help-Portrait (http://www.help-portrait.com) is movement of photographers who want to give back to their communities utilizing their time, gear, and expertise. Currently, Help-Portrait has around 1700 photographers involved in over 260 locations over more than 40 countries. We have been hosting help-portrait-vancouver events since Dec 2009, we are heading into our fourth year.
The premise is simple:
Find someone in need.
Take their portrait.
Print.
And deliver.
In  2011 Help-Portrait Vancouver was comprised of more than 64 volunteer photographers, a handful of wonderful hair and makeup artists, and dozens of other volunteers.

It is 2012 and this year our team has grown as well as our needs to cover expenses to continue to put on the events . With your support we can keep giving back to the community . We anticipate an even larger turn out for 2012 as we are heading into our 4th year for Help-Portrait-Vancouver and we have immediate needs to cover all the costs so we can keep moving forward.
Event info:
NOV 14th 2012 BC Children's Hospital:
this is the 3rd year we have been invited into BCCH , we hold this event right in the terminal ward of BCCH to serve the patients and families of BCCH.
DEC 1st 2012 DTES Event at UGM:

Help-Portrait Vancouver DTES has been lucky enough to partner with the Union Gospel Mission (or UGM) for 3 years now. UGM has been generous enough to provide us with a location for our DTES studio setups as well as some volunteers. We're estimating that over 1000 + guests will walk through our doors again this year to have their portraits taken. Each guest will receive 2 prints - one for themselves, and one to share - and will enjoy entertainment from a variety of local acts, including musicians, magicians, artists, and face painters. We also have a postage station with Christmas cards where our clients can mail their photos and a card to family or friends.

Your contributions will help us keep this amazing community event going so we can continue to touch the lives of those at the BC Children's' Hospital and in the Down Town East Side of Vancouver this year.

Thank you for supporting Help-Portrait-Vancouver!

Hello Brothers! Allow me to introduce myself if we haven't met before. I'm Michael, and I am a brother from the Omega Chapter at the University of Arizona. I served as Chapter President from Spring 2009 til June 1st, 2012. In this amount of time, Omega underwent a tremendous amount of growth, inside and out. Through our struggles we found our bonds of brotherhood strengthen as we jumped hurdle after hurdle together. Today, we are proud of our accomplishments, but just like all college students struggling with the battle of increasing tuition and budget cuts, money is sometimes a struggle.

After years of dedication to my chapter, I have worked extremely hard in a new work position I have acquired this summer, but still fall $300 short of being able to purchase a plane ticket from Cleveland (where I'm at currently for work) to Portland.

This is where I am reaching out all of you. If there is any nominal way that you help me achieve my goal of attending Convention to have my chapter represented, please contact me immediately. I must buy this plane ticket immediately if I want to attend, but I can only do it with the help of my brothers at this point.

My number is (520) 955-1986, and my email is azwebby@email.arizona.edu. You could also send me a message over Facebook (search: Michael Matthew) if you are interested in pitching in to the realization of this goal. I appreciate your time in reading my message.
In the Bond,

Michael Webb
Omega Chapter

La Leche League of Washington is a mother-to-mother breastfeeding support organization. La Leche League Leaders are volunteer mothers who have breastfed their own children, and are accredited by La Leche League International.

YOUR Seattle Central PM La Leche League Group supports families from all over Seattle!  We do home visits, provide free literature, a free monthly meeting to families and answer emails and phones calls! We are commited to supporting our community!

Your Seattle Central PM LLL leaders volunteer all their time, BUT it cost money to pay for literature, leaders dues to cover using the LLLI name and insurance and for continued education so that we can support the community we love!  We could NOT do this important work for our community without your support.  LLL has been able to provide FREE support for more than 50 years in the US and your Seattle Central PM LLL is looking forward to serving you and your babies in the future!  Your donatation of ANY level and membership ensures that current and future generations will continue to have educated support.
The Impact YOU Make!
Running an organization of any size requires funding.  Even though all our leaders are volunteer, each volunteer must find a way to pay for:
<ul>
• Continued Education, to stay up-to-date on current breastfeeding research.
• Pamplets, tear-off sheets and other accurate breastfeeding information
• Dues to LLLI for reduced costs for meeting materials, insurance, using the LLL name.
Your memberships and donations make it possible for Seattle Central PM LLL to continue to serve the Central District and all Seattle families.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support financially, we still need your support!  Please send our fundraiser to others you believe should know about Seattle Central PM LLL and the great work being done by our volunteers to support the communities we live in.

column2: >Bringing the Art of Wood Fired Cooking to Como

column6: >Local baker, Mark Risch, has been baking for years at restaurants around Columbia and already has a successful bread and baked goods business, Como Dough. He's been selling his goodies at Farmers' Markets and local businesses. His cinnamon buns have quite a following in these parts. It's been his dream for years to put a wood fired pizza oven on a trailer and go mobile. Nothing cooks pizza like a good fire. Mark's been tweaking his pizza dough recipe to perfection. It's delicious!! His goal is to bring the art of wood fired cooking to Columbia ... to offer <a href=""http://comodough.com/comodoughpizza.html"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><span style=""color: blue
column7: >artisanal pizzas and a variety of
column8: >other menu items cooked fresh in the wood fired oven.

column7: >We already have one of our ovens.  It’s a Forno Bravo and it does a great job. It runs at about 900° and cooks a pizza in roughly two minutes. We want to mount two Forno Bravo ovens side-by-side in our pizza trailer, which was just delivered last week.  It’s already fitted out with stainless sinks, water reservoirs and the type of doors, windows, etc that we specified.  We also have a stainless make table that we’re about to  install as well. We’re still needing a few things to get us going, which is why we’re turning to Indiegogo and the people in our community for that last little bump to get us rolling through the streets of Columbia.

column1: We live in a town that loves pizza and we’re excited about the idea of introducing  the people of Columbia to Neopolitan inspired pizza. We feel that we have a singular style of making pies . The difference is in the dough.  Mark has developed a unique method of fermentation. It’s an extended maturation of the dough that makes the difference. It’s his goal to introduce to the Columbia community the art of wood fired cooking.

By making the pizza oven mobile, Mark will be able to bring his unique style of pizza to the Columbia area making the possibilities almost endless ... private parties, festivals, catered events or rolling down the streets of Columbia.
","Como Dough Pizza
Bringing the Art of Wood Fired Cooking to Como
(Columbia, Missouri)

Local baker, Mark Risch, has been baking for years at restaurants around Columbia and already has a successful bread and baked goods business, Como Dough. He's been selling his goodies at Farmers' Markets and local businesses. His cinnamon buns have quite a following in these parts. It's been his dream for years to put a wood fired pizza oven on a trailer and go mobile. Nothing cooks pizza like a good fire. Mark's been tweaking his pizza dough recipe to perfection. It's delicious!! His goal is to bring the art of wood fired cooking to Columbia ... to offer artisanal pizzas and a variety of other menu items cooked fresh in the wood fired oven.

We already have one of our ovens.  It’s a Forno Bravo and it does a great job. It runs at about 900° and cooks a pizza in roughly two minutes. We want to mount two Forno Bravo ovens side-by-side in our pizza trailer, which was just delivered last week.  It’s already fitted out with stainless sinks, water reservoirs and the type of doors, windows, etc that we specified.  We also have a stainless make table that we’re about to  install as well. We’re still needing a few things to get us going, which is why we’re turning to Indiegogo and the people in our community for that last little bump to get us rolling through the streets of Columbia.
We still need a generator, a roll up screen to ventilate the back of the trailer, signage for the trailer, a bigger truck to hall our 16’ trailer, and other small wares.
We'll be using local, fresh and organic (as much as possible) ingredients. We're trying to support local businesses and agriculture as much as we can. So far we know that we'll be using:
Goatsbeard Farm cheeses,
Patchwork Family Farms ham,
Walk-About Acres pork,
Global Foods feta cheese & olives
local suppliers of fresh fruits and vegetables, just to name a few.

We live in a town that loves pizza and we’re excited about the idea of introducing  the people of Columbia to Neopolitan inspired pizza. We feel that we have a singular style of making pies . The difference is in the dough.  Mark has developed a unique method of fermentation. It’s an extended maturation of the dough that makes the difference. It’s his goal to introduce to the Columbia community the art of wood fired cooking.

By making the pizza oven mobile, Mark will be able to bring his unique style of pizza to the Columbia area making the possibilities almost endless ... private parties, festivals, catered events or rolling down the streets of Columbia.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Columbia, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-get-our-wood-fired-pizza-trailer-on-the-road/pica

Why Does This Matter?

My name is Brandon Nueman. I live in Los Angeles, California and have been working in the fishing industry for the past two years. I recently started a project called The Top Catch. Its goal is to help aid the survival of the fishing industry for both the consumer and its businesses.
This is necessary because the economy has ravaged this industry. Guides, who were once on the water 300 days a year, now sit at 100 days
column2: and they are starting to end their businesses due to this gigantic decrease in revenue. Over the past year, I have personally witnessed over 40 guides end their business. It is due to this, that I started thinking of ways to help bring them more customers.

column1: I then asked myself, my family, and my friends what would bring both new and old customers back into the fold for these fishermen? Luckily, I married a brilliant woman who said, “Brandon, you love blueberries. Every time they are on sale, you buy three packages of them…. But, you only buy them on sale. Why is that?”

That’s when it hit me. People want to go fishing, they need to go fishing. They just need to be reminded of that and shown that they are getting a deal. I searched the web and found that Groupon has actually done this in a few cases and the consumers went crazy. 1000+ trips booked per listing was normal.
Thus, thetopcatch.com was born.
What I Need…..
Today, The Top Catch has a filler page while the true website is being built. But with your help, I will be able to get it and keep it up. Please donate on Indiegogo  to make this dream a reality.

The website and its graphic design are going to cost me a little over $1500 {See gallery of what the site is going to look like}. The other costs, such as SEO ($300 per month) and email marketing ($250 per month) will cost significantly more
column2: but, they will most likely come once I can fit them into a monthly budget. Any help that you can give will go to making this site easier to find for the public.

column1: What's In It For You?

Beyond being awesome and believing that I can help change the fishing industry forever….. I have set up specific “thank you gifts” in exchange for your contributions. You will see them on the right hand side of this page.
Other Ways You Can Help…..

The economy is in a pretty dreadful state, and money is tight for many people. This is what has gotten me to setup the site in the first place. Please do not feel obliged to contribute. There are other ways you can help too:
Tell others about this project: blog it, tweet it, facebook it, tell your friends and family {Indiegogo has some sharing tools if needed}. Every little bit helps!
Leave a positive comment as the more traffic and activity on the campaign, the more visible it becomes on the site!
Thanks for your time and support, it is greatly appreciated!
Brandon.

As I'm sure many of you have heard already, the world lost yet another great woman on Thursday night.  The aunt of our very own ChrisHendrix88 passed in the late evening.  We, as a chat family would like to show our support.  It doesn't matter what chat you call home, this is about Chris.  All of the money from this fund will be going to purchase an arrangement to send to the family.  Any money left over will be sent to the family in the form of a check for them to use as needed.  Every dollar helps guys.  I know money is tight everywhere, but by working together we can send them something truly amazing.  Thanks in advance!

Six years ago I started grilling for my friends in the backyard. I thought I was doing up some good “barbecue” but it was only good grilling. At a local BBQ event a Pitmaster told me that true barbecue was low and slow. He gave me some tips and told me to practice every weekend. So I did. During this time I created a blog called Nor Cal BBQ to talk about my leaning experience. I also went to culinary school to learn the basics of cooking for commercial kitchens.

Since the start of my barbecue dream I have worked for mom and pop restaurants and for some of the biggest companies in California while teaching myself how to do true barbecue. Now its time to take what I have learned and put it to the test. Now its time to travel the Nation doing some of the biggest shows in barbecue vending.

My goal with this indiegogo campaign is to raise a least $20,000 to purchase a smoker, trailer, several grills and the needed materials to travel the nation. I have put together a team of people willing to go on this barbecue dream with me. We want to serve the masses.

What makes us different then other barbecue companies is we serve Bison or otherwise known as Buffalo. Bison is leaner, contains less fat and cholesterol. It’s a red meat that is good for you. In the last decade Bison Ranchers have been slowly bring back the mammal that used to roam our wonderful country in the millions. Today the numbers are much smaller but the demand for a healthier meat is on the rise.  Bisons are feed all natural materials. They can not be forced fed like other cattle. They need to roam and feed as they go or they do not reach the size needed to produce a product that is commercial grade.

Not only is Bison a healthier way to enjoy red meat but its good for the environment too. They naturally help our grass lands grow. These animals like to be outside year round to roam and graze as needed. They are not fed loads of grains and altered food sources to grow them in size faster then needed. As a barbecue company we want to promote the Bison movement. We want to help Bison Ranchers get the support they need.We want to feed barbecue lovers a better product.

The Buffalo Boys National Tour is all about showing off how we like to barbecue, promote a healthier side to barbecue and to educate the folks that don’t know about Bison and the effect these animals have on our world today. We want to do a least 30 events nation wide. Most of the event for our first year will be on the western part of the country but we are planning trips to Texas, New York, Florida and Michigan too.

We will also service Pork products but no traditional beef products. We need to stand out from these teams that have been traveling the country for decades. We are the new kids in the pit. Its going to take time, a lot of effort and constant battling. Bison are still in the low numbers compared to beef. So supply is going to be a constant battle but with the network of Bison Ranchers we are putting together, its going to be possible to serve a healthier product at every event.

Your support will help us promote healthy living, the love of true barbecue and do something good for the environment. No matter if you can donate a few bucks or just pass this information around to your friends, any support will help. Thank you for taking time to read this campaign and for watching our video. Hope to see you at one of our events very soon.

column3: > WHY IS ALMOST EVERYTHING IN HERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE NUMBER

column1: The 21st Chromosome is one of 23 pairs found in us humans. People normally have two copies of this chromosome. The trisomy of the 21st chromosome (an extra little guy that's attached) causes Down Syndrome. Chromosome 21 is the smallest human chromosome, 47 million nucleotides (the building material of DNA) and representing about 1.5 percent of the total DNA in cells.

In 2000, researchers working on the Human Genome Project announced that they had determined the sequence of base pairs that make up this chromosome. Chromosome 21 was the second human chromosome to be fully sequenced. Pretty cool eh!

Miles to go before we sleep...
When I found indiegogo, I knew we were finally 1st down 'n' 20 yards from the top of this mountain... (with your help I know we can reach the top)...
As the father of a son who was born with Down syndrome I have been taught by a master that many of life’s most perfect moments and accomplishments are the ones that are not so perfect.
<div>
My son has helped me understand that what the world often considers trivial is in reality truly exceptional and meant to be celebrated. My son absolutely loves accomplishing things
column2: better yet, celebrating them! Even more so!!! The acknowledgement that often comes with it!

column1: A reason to celebrate is exactly what we want not just for HIM, but for the hundreds of thousands of people with diverse abilities that face incredible challenges every day. Ultimately, we want to ensure two things. #1) that when he's old enough to work, he will have a fulfilling job waiting for him and that at the end of the day he can look back and be proud of the contributions he has made to his community. #2) To set an example and teach others how they can do it too!

<center>
<h2><span style=""color: red
</center>
<h3><em><span style=""color: #086b00

Our primary mission is to cultivate an overwhelming desire within Corporate America to shift their respective culture just enough so that everyone within the company has the same desire to make minor changes to their daily operations and join us in our quest to isolate the all-to-often ""Undiscovered Abilities"" many individuals with challenges have. We believe that as each company does so, they will ultimately be empowered to open their doors to hundreds of thousands of incredible individuals who will touch their lives forever and make valuable contributions to each companies success. Each of us, no matter what our conditions
column2: were born with special abilities and talents. When we have an opportunity to exercise them and if we are given an opportunity to succeed, we are able to touch the lives of others in unexpected ways. Through Club 21c Apparel, the Down4u Campaign, and several other planned projects
column3: (some listed here and some not) - we will do just that, create jobs for persons with undiscovered abilities. Through this process we will also create jobs for many qualified, educated, and skilled individuals who currently find themselves out of work as well. We figure, for every three skilled employees, we will be able to employ someone who may be challenged in one way or another but perfectly able to contribute to the success of the company they are hired to work for. As such, everyone involved will be vital to our success and growth.

column1: Our Mission:

Help create jobs for persons with varied physical, mental, and/or emotional challenges, set an example that can be easily duplicated, and help train like minded corporations and businesses how they can do it too.
HOW WE CAN ACCOMPLISH THIS: -- GOAL #1

Secure at least 4,200 (2,100 x2) subscribers to our magazine (6 Issues Annually) to raise money, awareness, and get the word out. 15,000 copies will be printed each run regardless of paid subscribers in order to distribute copies to Families in Need, Doctors, Caretakers, Politicians, Community Leaders, etc... Nationwide!

Currently, within the Down syndrome community there are no Nationwide subscription based publications in circulation catering to families, educators, community leaders, or medical providers and we intend to change that. With almost 10 years experience as a publisher starting in California and now here in Southern Utah, we now have the experience and a process in place to start publishing in January of 2013! Maybe even sooner with your help!!!
Share Your Story!

Are you the proud parent of a child, grandshild, or friend with Down syndrome? Do you have a blog or monthly newsletter within your organization? We want to help you get your stories published and out and into the mainstream public! We are looking to add writers, researchers, Mom's & Dad's, siblings, and especially Self-Advocates and other individuals with Down syndrome who can articulate their life experiences and help us bring the DS community closer together on a level never available before! Be sure to visit our website (in development) over the next two weeks (we will post regular updates right here) where you will be able to get more information and learn how you can be a part of this great project!
A Perfect Gift!!

Our magazine will make a perfect gift for your friends or loved ones. If you know someone who has a child with Down syndrome or who works in a field of medicine that would benefit from having a subscription, please take advantage of this opportunity and buy them a gift! As a contributor you are making it possible for us to accomplish something completely unexpected by hundreds of thousands of amazing families!
Send Subscriptions To Your Local Doctors Offices!!

Help us reach our Medical Professionals! If you are inspired by this idea but don't know anyone within the Down syndrome community, you can still help us!! We want to reach as many doctors' offices, gynecologists, hospitals, caregivers, and the like! So go grab your phone book, call your friends, and let's get this done!!!
Advertisers!

Are you a company, business owner, or product manufacturer that would benefit from reaching 15,000+ families, educators, politicians, and medical providers? This is your opportunity to secure a ""Founding"" position as an advertiser! Purchase/Sponsor subscriptions in bulk right here to get started!
Affiliates!!

We would love to become a partner with your organization and provide you with an amazing vehicle for reaching families throughout the country by helping you tell your stories. Order in bulk and get them to your members! Together we can make this a reality!!!
Here's How Possible This Is With Your Help!
For every 1000 subscribers we can print our first two issues.
We plan to print every other month to start
3000 subscribers will ensure our first years success.
6000 subscribers will make it possible to print every month!
We plan to print 15,000 copies for each run to start.
We will be USPS “Periodical Compliant”.
10,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 20,000 per month, distribute to box stores, and create our smartphone app.
20,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 50,000 per month.
One of our primary goals is to get each issue into as many doctors offices as possible.

We are looking for Angels, Founding Sponsors, Partners, Affiliates, Advertisers, Grandparents, and Businesses that would like to help us by sponsor subscriptions in bulk!If you would like to participate, here’s how you can help & ensure our success.

WHY IS ALMOST EVERYTHING IN HERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE NUMBER 21?

The 21st Chromosome is one of 23 pairs found in us humans. People normally have two copies of this chromosome. The trisomy of the 21st chromosome (an extra little guy that's attached) causes Down Syndrome. Chromosome 21 is the smallest human chromosome, 47 million nucleotides (the building material of DNA) and representing about 1.5 percent of the total DNA in cells.

In 2000, researchers working on the Human Genome Project announced that they had determined the sequence of base pairs that make up this chromosome. Chromosome 21 was the second human chromosome to be fully sequenced. Pretty cool eh!

Our Story
My elderly Mother was just robbed of all the money
she needs to get to our family in Michigan.  We had pooled it together
so she could afford to move.  Her portable moving container was pre-paid
so all her belongings are already on their way without her.
Her travel money was stolen by 2 people she had hired right off the
unemployment line to help her pack the last of her things.  In the kind,
“Spirit of giving” she opened her heart and home to these people and we
are just glad worse did not happen to her than stolen money.  The Police
can’t recover the money because last names were not given by the couple

and the cell phone number she had for they was a pre-pay.

Our
family is desperately seeking help because she has no choice but to
move.  We can’t afford another financial hardship after all we’ve

suffered already with other losses this year.

Please help us have a Merry Christmas and may you have one as well!


The Impact
Our family is desperate to help our Mother get home safely. Your contribution will help us all.
What We Need &
<div>
We need you to choose the “contribute now” button and give what you
can.  It’s not something we can afford to pay you back with other than
our thanks.  Please share our story with your family for us…no one
should have to worry about moving their Mother like this during the
holidays.

This is an urgent call to help this family.
This family consists of a mom, dad and 3 children who through whatever hurdles life throws their way always put others first.  We need to put this family first for once.

The children are Josh who is 19, Candace who will be 18 on Sept 12 and Parker who will be 15 on Sept 5.  Josh has mild mental retardation and Parker has Aspergers Syndrome. On top of these childrens disabilities, their mother, Samantha,  is disabled with Reflex Sympathetic Disorder and Fibromyalgia and cannot work.  Josh just recently lost his part time job due to his disability. Candace has started looking for a job to help her family but has had no luck.   Josh and Candace are both starting their senior year in  high school. Parker is homeschooled.  Samantha and Todd (mom and dad), through peoples amazements, through all they have been through will be married 22 years on September 22, 2012.  Many people all the time tell them how so many couples would not had stuck together with the turmoil thrown infront of this family and are amazed this has not happened.  Candace as a matter of fact, just made the remark the other day to someone this very statement that through it all her family is still together.  Lets help keep it that way.  We all know how little stressors can tear a family apart, but what this family has endured is too much and each time has been no fault of their own.

This family has been financially ruined by the UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT THREE TIMES.  The stories of each one is heartbreaking for such young people.  Folks, we need to step up and help them because you would NEVER want to endure the hell these 5 people have been through.  A family that not just takes care of their own, but reaches out to others in need, runs a no kill cat shelter, donates to others, etc.  NO family or person that thinks of others and not just what their family does not have, their needs and wants should EVER have to be put through the mill by anyone let alone our goverments.  The family is about to lose their home, they have already had to file bankruptcy because of their current situation caused by retaliation by animal control for Samantha filing a tort claim (lawsuit) against animal control. Because of being sold a house fraudulantly in 1992 these kids have not had the childhood a child should have.  These parents, thinking about their children's needs moved these kids to Depauw Indiana, a small country town to start  life over, to give  these kids a second chance to be kids and low and behold if 1 lone CPS caseworker conspired with 1 lone animal control officer to ultimately DESTROY this family.  This family is struggling and not because of anything they did wrong.  That is what makes this so important, their pleas for help just get over looked.  We need to stand and help this family, let them know we do care about what they do for others.   Show these kids that there are still good people in the world.
If you can contribute ANYTHING that would be great, if not then please share this. This is a current list of what this family needs.

1) They need $1600 to get their mortgage caught up.  The house is in foreclosure which is so ironic.  Samantha on November 16, 2011 helped a lady who was going to be evicted from  her home over feral cats.  This lady ""supposibly"" called in a complaint on Samantha.  Now Samantha, her husband and their children are losing their home.  $500 will be a great start to help get some of it caught up.

2) This family needs 2 vehicles fixed, they now own 5 vehicles of which now 1 is only running, it is a 95 Ford Ranger, in which Todd drives to work and works an hour away from home.   Josh before losing his job bought a car since Samantha's van broke down and within 7 days his car broke down.  They are assuming Josh's car needs an engine so now Josh is out of a car and $2600.  As of date they have a running 95 Ford Ranger, a 95 Kia Sportage with a blown head gasket, 2 99 Dodge Grand Caravans both needing engines and Josh's car a 98 Pontiac Bonnieville that most likely also needs an engine, it will be going to the shop on Monday if they can scrape the money together.

Samantha and todd live without financing things and pay cash for everything  to get caught up on life.  They live within their means, but life is just hammering them to death.  The harder they try to do right and do good and live like they are supposed to the more problems fall upon them.

3) The house was in the middle of being remodeled in winter of 2009 and the repairs  had to be left undone, those are 10 times worse now. The repairs are the basement, the kids bathroom and the kitchen.  The basement is a flooding mess and now retaining wall is caving in.  They need money to pay to have a backhoe to come in and remove the earth, the retaining walls  need torn out and rebuilt and new cement laid.  They are willing to do this work themselves to save money.  The basement will cost around $5000 if they do it on their own.  The kids bathroom just needs flooring so they can replace the broken commode, the commode leaks and they are not sure if they have water damage, but they need the money for the floor which is $200, the faucet for the sink is $135.  They will use existing plumbing for the claw foot tub as it will cost approximately $500 and is not urgent.  The kitchen floor needs replaced and will cost about $500.  The cabinet needs replaced and they are looking second hand for that.  The lower cabinets have water damage and are rotting.

4) The back porch is falling apart, the boards are warped.  Samantha qualifies to get this fixed but the family has been ousted by the community and the humilation is too much for Samantha to go sign up for Repair Affair.  (read further down about being outsted by the community).  The back porch is in a dangerous state especially come this winter.  They are trying to tear it down and build back something to use this winter and be able to add on to it later.  this will cost a minimum of $300 for the need, $700 for what is really needed, but they said, the urgency is something Samantha can use in winter without falling and getting hurt.  The kids as well but they are more agile than Samantha.

5) The family lives in a log cabin, it has been in the process of being stripped and stained since fall of 2009, the logs/chinking need maintanance BADLY and the worst part of it is all the chinking needs to be ripped out and replaced.  The chinking is falling off the house, has holes in it, etc.  These holes allow all sorts of things to get into the house and let air escape outside the house.  This is something easy to fix and the family can do it themselves but it will cost at least $500 to do it right.
Why should you contribute?

Because like I said, this is a family that puts others first.  Therefore once we make them whole again, give them support they need they are going to be in the postition to further making a difference to other people.  You may need their help someday,  you never know if you will end up like them.  They are currently in a lawsuit over what CPS/Animal Control did, if they win they are going to set up a fund to help others protect their children and their pets.   Imagine if we don't help them now their lawsuit may end.  If we can help them, and this helps this particular lawsuit, they are going to be lobbying for new laws pertaining to pet owners and children.  We need more people willing to take a stand for others and these people are willing to do at their expense.  It is this reason why you need to contribute.  Please make your contribution, $5 is a great contribution.
What happens if we don't raise the money needed?

The money is still needed regardless if we do not raise enough to cover all their needs.  Just helping with $40 a month will help cover their water bill and they can use that money on wood to build a safer back porch for Samantha and the children.  Any amount you contribute is going to impact this family.  When you struggle, $5 extra is a big difference.  I will also keep you up to date with photos of where your money is going.  There are photos of all their vehicles, 2 videos of Josh's car and Samantha's van to prove they need engines.  I will post the estimate as soon as I get it.  Photos of the house are posted as well as videos.  As the money is given to them via paypal they can make immediate repairs and I will post the photos.  You can see yourself the need, the repairs and how this will change this family's life.  We need to help a family that is not greedy and has a heart of gold and feels everyone should help one another.
You want to help but you are struggling yourself?

Alot of us are. All you need to do is post this story everyday for 1 hour all over the internet.  Help get it to someone that can make a contribution.  Sharing this is just as important as making a contribution.  Can you spare just 1 hour a day to get the word out?  That costs nothing out of your pocket and imagine  how many people you can get this to.  Share it on news  reports, on line news papers, facebook, twitter, digg, etc.  You get the idea.
Surely by now you can see the importance of helping this family.

I haven't even written the entire list of the help this family needs, I have just pointed out the urgent parts.  Can you see the need? Can you imagine what this family can do to help others if they were whole again?   Then please, contribute as little as you can.  It all adds up.  Can you imagine if we got 100,000 people  to donate just $1 how much better this family will be?  And how much this family can continue helping others?  Can you imagine yourself in their shoes in such dire need from being blind sided and destroyed because you chose to stand up for your childrens rights, your constitutional rights?  But yet this family still helps other people while fighting all this.  Most people would had turned their backs on society, but good hearted people like this family don't.  They try to see good in all humans. Please make your contribution today and please share this family's story.
How does this family's struggle currently impact you or those around them?

This family runs a no kill cat shelter and out of retaliation (from the lawsuit) they were raided.  All the animals were taken, charges of abuse were filed when in fact the accussers are the abusers.  Animal control killed 4 of their cats to get charges pressed.  All allegations of abuse are lies and can be proved they are lies.  Due to legality reasons I cannot post everything I know of the evidence against the prosecution, but it is something most people would not be able to handle.  Right now while the parents are fighting these trumped up charges their pets lives sit in limbo.  They need $800 to give to the animals attorney to get their pets home and the shelter will be up and running again.  Their children have begged Samantha to not give up this fight, they will wait as long as they  have to but do not give up their animals or the shelter.  The kids loved working in the shelter and loved helping animals and people. They also  loved having fundraiser parties.  All that is (temporarily) gone but the fact it is gone has impacted MANY, MANY families and cats needing their services.  They still get calls and emails monthly asking for help and they have to turn them down because their lives are in limbo.  Imagine how many cats have died because they can't help, imagine how many families had to give up their cats because the shelters Permenancy Program isn't in operation.  The Permenancy Program is for those facing foreclosure, eviction, deployment, fires, etc that have no where for their cat but do not want to rehome them.  This program gives them a place until the family can take them home.  That to me is a major impact in Indiana, Kentucky, Illinois and Ohio their shelter needs to be up and running.  Make your contribution today, get this family back on their feet so they can continue doing what they enjoy....helping others.
Thank you.
Here is the story about how the government has destroyed this family.
First time the government struck July 31, 1992............

Samantha and Todd (the parents) got married 9/22/90 and Samantha wanted to have a family and wanted to move to a family house before having kids, so they sought out and found the house of their dreams in January 1992.  Samantha's mother was put in the hospital in May 1992 and died July 1992, this was while Samantha was 5 months pregnant with Josh.  Samantha had a very  difficult time with her mothers death and they were having trouble with getting the dream home and fought very hard to get it.  When things were starting to dwindel down for them they decided with all the stress, being pregnant, etc that right then just was not a good time to purchase this particular  house.  Samantha and Todd was backing out.  The seller of the house threatened to sue them if they did.  Feeling uneasy about the whole deal they went ahead and went through with the purchase.
Samantha and Randell shortly after moving into the house realized this house no way could had been sold via FHA although they had an FHA loan.

January 1995 Candace was hospitalized with severe pneumonia caused by black mold. She was in a coma for 2 days.  She then had pediatric asthma and seizures.  She outgrew both of those and threw school learned she was mentally delayed, she was 18 months behind her peers.  Candace still struggles but works very hard to get good grades, she hates school but refuses to miss a day, she has worked very hard to get where she is right now and her parents are so proud of her.

There is alot more to this story but for those that don't want to read the whole story I am complining it and the newspaper clippings into a website.  Give me time to get that prepared. Keep checking back.
Second time the government struck December 2009, January 13, 2010 and Febuary 2010
Decemember 15, 2009 CPS was called to the house.  The allegations were unsubstantiated on December 21, 2009

January 13, 2010 really begain on January 6, 2010.  After unsubstantiating the allegations the caseworker decided she wasn't done.  This is a very long part of this and I will give you the link to read it.  But the short of it is this.  Samantha and Todd refused on 5 different days to allowing this same caseworker to open a case on them.  So after collecting information about the no kill cat shelter and the last time of asking the family to allow her to open a case, even telling them she could get them a grant to remodel their home, she went back to her boss and told them that Samantha and Todd were cat hoarders.  With that she got her open case.  CPS has not and refuses to turn over the photos to prove their innocence to Samantha or any of the attorney's that have been on the cases since 2010!!  The description of the house and the photos do not match!  The children were detained without a warrant and no detention hearing was ever held.  Many things that violated this family's rights.  As a matter of fact.  The case was dismissed by CPS because they proved by VET BILLS they were not cat hoarders.

February 1, 2010 Animal Control killed all 15 cats that he illegally seized.  He stated in a court of law that he did this ""because Samantha never came back for them"".  This was 18 days after he stole these cats from this family.  (I used the terms illegal and stole because the animal control officer lied to a judge to get a search and seizure warrant, that can be verified by the probable cause affidavit and 1 photo and 1 statement.)
I will post this too, this is about CPS conspiring with animal control because the Lee's refused to agree to the caseworker opening a case on them.
This story is listed on the Frisky Felines Foundation website and also on ratemycaseworker.com.  I will post the info soon.
Third time the goverment struck November 17, 2011...........

Samantha filed a tort claim on animal control over the 2010 incident.  A tort claim is your first step to suing the government in state court.  In November Samantha was set up to take some cats to prevent a lady from being evicted, this lady called in a complaint (supposibly) and within 18 hours of taking these cats the sheriffs department were on the family's porch.   (These cats were not part of Frisky Felines Foundation.  Samantha told this lady she could not take them as she was full.  When Samantha found out they were feral cats and were being shot at Samantha knew all someone had to do was take the cats to a feral colony.   Samantha was just helping cats that were being shot at and to help prevent a lady and her mother lose their home).

Animal control seized all the animals (including the chickens they had there for eggs) all based on a complaint from this woman that Samantha helped when she refused several times because Samantha's family was swamped with trying to get caught up on the past 10 days, but did not want to see this woman lose her home so took the cats with the intention of taking them to a feral colony the following day.  Animal control did not say ANYTHING pertaining to anything except this vague compalint.  Todd told Samantha things did not add up and that those cats were a set up.  You see, they were less than 2 months away from filing the actual lawsuit in court.  This animal control officer went further since immediate charges were not brought forth and killed 4 of the cats.  It took 4 weeks before charges were filed against samantha and Todd.  Charges of child neglect on the 19 year old and charges of animal neglect on the 4 cats that animal control killed.

Samantha is still fighting back but much harder.  They bailed out of jail (weren't really ""arrested"" their attorney got them a deal to lower the $10,000 bond if they turned themselves in and they did), she filed an injunction to put a stay on the animals until a hearing (which has yet to be heard) and then filed a federal lawsuit against CPS and the town marshall (that started all of this) and civil suit against animal control and the ac officier.  This is why the family is struggling to stand up for their rights as a US citizen!!!!   No family should ever have to pay out $10,000 (what they have paid in fees since Nov 17, 2011) to prove they are innocent from a situation of corruption, conspiracy, greed and retaliation.  All the proof lies within the vet bills, the flooded basement, the photos of the cats before the raid and the kdis own statements that there was nothing wrong until CPS and animal control destroyed their family.  This is small town corruption and Samantha will be fighting for new laws to protect pets, pet owners and rescues against these types of falsified seizures, raids and charges.  As well as she wanting to get new child protection laws changed to stop CPS from thinking they can do whatever they want with no proof whatsoever.
All of the above that this family has gone through can be proven and verified that it indeed happened.

Please contribute $5 to this family to get them back on their feet, to get working on better laws for the pets of America, families of America.  They are suing and if they win what they are asking for they are going to put up a legal fund for those that have been wrongly affected as they were to stand their legal ground and sue.  This reason right here is why governmental abuse is allowed to continue because there are no legal resources for people that do not have the funds to fight back to do anything to protect their given rights.  Help this family get that right and fund for you!  Contribute what you can today.  Share this campaign.
How would you feel if you life was fine one day and you began to see everything you worked so hard for began to slip away because of something you didn't do?  Help this family please.

Here is the story about how the government has destroyed this family.
First time the government struck July 31, 1992............

Samantha and Todd (the parents) got married 9/22/90 and Samantha wanted to have a family and wanted to move to a family house before having kids, so they sought out and found the house of their dreams in January 1992.  Samantha's mother was put in the hospital in May 1992 and died July 1992, this was while Samantha was 5 months pregnant with Josh.  Samantha had a very  difficult time with her mothers death and they were having trouble with getting the dream home and fought very hard to get it.  When things were starting to dwindel down for them they decided with all the stress, being pregnant, etc that right then just was not a good time to purchase this particular  house.  Samantha and Todd was backing out.  The seller of the house threatened to sue them if they did.  Feeling uneasy about the whole deal they went ahead and went through with the purchase.
Samantha and Randell shortly after moving into the house realized this house no way could had been sold via FHA although they had an FHA loan.

January 1995 Candace was hospitalized with severe pneumonia caused by black mold. She was in a coma for 2 days.  She then had pediatric asthma and seizures.  She outgrew both of those and threw school learned she was mentally delayed, she was 18 months behind her peers.  Candace still struggles but works very hard to get good grades, she hates school but refuses to miss a day, she has worked very hard to get where she is right now and her parents are so proud of her.

There is alot more to this story but for those that don't want to read the whole story I am complining it and the newspaper clippings into a website.  Give me time to get that prepared. Keep checking back.
Second time the government struck December 2009, January 13, 2010 and Febuary 2010
Decemember 15, 2009 CPS was called to the house.  The allegations were unsubstantiated on December 21, 2009

January 13, 2010 really begain on January 6, 2010.  After unsubstantiating the allegations the caseworker decided she wasn't done.  This is a very long part of this and I will give you the link to read it.  But the short of it is this.  Samantha and Todd refused on 5 different days to allowing this same caseworker to open a case on them.  So after collecting information about the no kill cat shelter and the last time of asking the family to allow her to open a case, even telling them she could get them a grant to remodel their home, she went back to her boss and told them that Samantha and Todd were cat hoarders.  With that she got her open case.  CPS has not and refuses to turn over the photos to prove their innocence to Samantha or any of the attorney's that have been on the cases since 2010!!  The description of the house and the photos do not match!  The children were detained without a warrant and no detention hearing was ever held.  Many things that violated this family's rights.  As a matter of fact.  The case was dismissed by CPS because they proved by VET BILLS they were not cat hoarders.

February 1, 2010 Animal Control killed all 15 cats that he illegally seized.  He stated in a court of law that he did this ""because Samantha never came back for them"".  This was 18 days after he stole these cats from this family.  (I used the terms illegal and stole because the animal control officer lied to a judge to get a search and seizure warrant, that can be verified by the probable cause affidavit and 1 photo and 1 statement.)
I will post this too, this is about CPS conspiring with animal control because the Lee's refused to agree to the caseworker opening a case on them.
This story is listed on the Frisky Felines Foundation website and also on ratemycaseworker.com.  I will post the info soon.
Third time the goverment struck November 17, 2011...........

Samantha filed a tort claim on animal control over the 2010 incident.  A tort claim is your first step to suing the government in state court.  In November Samantha was set up to take some cats to prevent a lady from being evicted, this lady called in a complaint (supposibly) and within 18 hours of taking these cats the sheriffs department were on the family's porch.   (These cats were not part of Frisky Felines Foundation.  Samantha told this lady she could not take them as she was full.  When Samantha found out they were feral cats and were being shot at Samantha knew all someone had to do was take the cats to a feral colony.   Samantha was just helping cats that were being shot at and to help prevent a lady and her mother lose their home).

Animal control seized all the animals (including the chickens they had there for eggs) all based on a complaint from this woman that Samantha helped when she refused several times because Samantha's family was swamped with trying to get caught up on the past 10 days, but did not want to see this woman lose her home so took the cats with the intention of taking them to a feral colony the following day.  Animal control did not say ANYTHING pertaining to anything except this vague compalint.  Todd told Samantha things did not add up and that those cats were a set up.  You see, they were less than 2 months away from filing the actual lawsuit in court.  This animal control officer went further since immediate charges were not brought forth and killed 4 of the cats.  It took 4 weeks before charges were filed against samantha and Todd.  Charges of child neglect on the 19 year old and charges of animal neglect on the 4 cats that animal control killed.

Samantha is still fighting back but much harder.  They bailed out of jail (weren't really ""arrested"" their attorney got them a deal to lower the $10,000 bond if they turned themselves in and they did), she filed an injunction to put a stay on the animals until a hearing (which has yet to be heard) and then filed a federal lawsuit against CPS and the town marshall (that started all of this) and civil suit against animal control and the ac officier.  This is why the family is struggling to stand up for their rights as a US citizen!!!!   No family should ever have to pay out $10,000 (what they have paid in fees since Nov 17, 2011) to prove they are innocent from a situation of corruption, conspiracy, greed and retaliation.  All the proof lies within the vet bills, the flooded basement, the photos of the cats before the raid and the kdis own statements that there was nothing wrong until CPS and animal control destroyed their family.  This is small town corruption and Samantha will be fighting for new laws to protect pets, pet owners and rescues against these types of falsified seizures, raids and charges.  As well as she wanting to get new child protection laws changed to stop CPS from thinking they can do whatever they want with no proof whatsoever.
All of the above that this family has gone through can be proven and verified that it indeed happened.

Please contribute $5 to this family to get them back on their feet, to get working on better laws for the pets of America, families of America.  They are suing and if they win what they are asking for they are going to put up a legal fund for those that have been wrongly affected as they were to stand their legal ground and sue.  This reason right here is why governmental abuse is allowed to continue because there are no legal resources for people that do not have the funds to fight back to do anything to protect their given rights.  Help this family get that right and fund for you!  Contribute what you can today.  Share this campaign.

How would you feel if you life was fine one day and you began to see everything you worked so hard for began to slip away because of something you didn't do?  Help this family please.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Depauw, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/urgent-rally-to-help-this-family-before-they-lose-it-all/pica

","The Impact
The WebSpirit campaign provides a network of online communication portals
to connect and support individuals, families, businesses, and the community at large to become employed
through their contributory offerings. Through online communication, we will
assess our individual and community resources and skills, articulate and implement
creative solutions that include benefits for all, and live in a collaborative sustainable whole life system.  In addition, we intend to
articulate the collaborative community model to help others in need that are
not in our region.  WebSpirit serves the
entire Rogue Valley in Southern Oregon.
The consequences of not receiving the money would be that
our communityâ€™s future would be compromised. We must make changes in our
society to alleviate this financial crisis.
How can people earn a living and get what they need to live if they canâ€™t
communicate what they can do, offer, or give?
This is the time for people to step up to the plate and make
a difference in the world.  We are
stepping up to benefit many, many people and we would greatly appreciate
financial support. It is completely fathomable that this will have a positive
global impact that turns financial crisis into evolutionary opportunity.
What We Need & What You Get
We need $4,000 to make it through 2 months of final
development to launch. This is bare bones expense funding: $1,500 per month for
the web developer/visionary, and $500 per month for her development assistant
who handles operations and content.
The project consists of developing and testing a network of web-based communication portals
to support new community alliances and projects that are solutions to our economic crisis.  We will advance our position
from economic instability and failure to a whole sustainable system that collaborates to share internal and  external resources.
The numbers of people that this project will affect and
serve is astronomical. The number of people that will be employed as a result would be the single most important reason for supporting this cause. Its model can be duplicated, the information will be
shared, and ANYONE who partakes in this community and global outreach may be
served.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share the awareness of this community
collaboration  model that we are
building. We are open to forming alliances and sharing ideas and  resources. Give what you can, spread  the
word using your â€œShareâ€ features, send emails with our links, and make
your own contribution to life by following your heart. Be inspired from within.
We appreciate all that you give and all that you do very
