0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>Hello - I am Stephanie, a single mother of four boys who has been struggling since 2006.  Due to the ""fall-out"" of sales of custom log homes that I use to love to build and a divorce, which has left me devestated and within days of losing the home I worked hard to build for my family.  Unfortunately, I built this home in an area in Iowa where there are no jobs that could support the payment.  This county has been deemed as one of the poorest and unhealthiest counties in the state of Iowa. This has left me working endless hours for the last three years for a ""miracle"" on a Project of Love - something I very much believe in...  and while helping myself ""save my home"", will help many, many people across the nation through new jobs, better health &amp
<div>

New Pioneer Organic, is an advocate for 100% PURE natural produce and realizes that The USDA needs a New Standard to Define “Organic” and that people cannot “afford” to continue to ignore the poisons that are consumed in the food we eat.  We think people should know where their food comes from and who’s growing it. We are building our business on this belief, and we will never compromise it. We believe in and support local produce—particularly the desire of people to have a higher-quality, fresher, better-tasting local PURE organic produce product. Quality comes first. At the same time, we’re focused on providing good agricultural jobs for people in the community.

Please take a look at my website http://www.newpioneerorganic.com. I am not a web-developer but feel our site will offer you some more information to help answer some of your questions.

<div>In the divorce, my ex managed to remove me from our joint checking account and sold all farm / livestock assets that we had jointly (over $300,000 equity), leaving me to struggle to try to start over again.  All the money we had earned while together had went back into the farm and this also included money from a head-on collission I had endured and received a minimal settlement.  It is very difficult to start a new business when you fight every month to just pay bills.  On top of that, since I do not have the ""means"" to fight my ex in court, he's managed to convince child support recovery that he only makes $200 per week
column2: therefore reducing child support to $70 per month for my two youngest boys.  He owns his own business, farms with his brother and father but because he farms, he's able to hide his income when filing taxes.  Hard some days to deal with when I ""try so hard"" and I can see him on Facebook buying new tractors, semi's etc.

column1: <div>YOUR contribution would be part of a ""Get It Green Project""... New Pioneer Organic will help stimulate our local, state and U.S. economy by using ""Green Earth Friendly &amp
column2: Wellness"" ideas.  Each one-acre Processing and Production Facility will provide jobs for approximately 35+ employees and provide new jobs to others in the community
column6: >.Your contribution is only a portion of what it takes to build a full-acre facility but with this contribution goal, I will be able to save my home as well as build a small facility that will enable me to prove to future investors that this ""Project of Love"" is very real.

column1: Please take a look at Backyard Farms located in New England or Euro Fresh Farms located in Arizona.  These companies have a very similiar concept however, they do not take into considerations the PURE Organic aspect of their produce and the over-all wellness aspect that we feel is very important.  This concept paired-up with an ""emerging market"" such as organic has more than potential to be successful.
If you are unable to contribute but feel you could be an asset with assisting with some aspect of this project, please do not hesitate to contact me at:
purefood@newpioneerorganic.com
In support of this project, there are various tax credits available.  I will provide the necessary tax information for your contribution received.

Thank you - Stephanie

Short Summary

Patricia’s Wellness Arts Café and Quilter’s Comfort Teas opened its doors as a place intending to be a momentary retreat from the wild rush of daily life.  From the response from visitors, we meet that goal.
My Team currently consists of Ash, B.J., Masaki and Yuko.   They are a great help.

Before leaving, many visitors say, “This place feels good and calming!  “I want to see more places like this”.   The café offers an eclectic mixture of Patricia’s proprietary Quilter’s Comfort certified organic herbal tea blends, herbal jellies, and syrups, including locally sourced herbal wine and beer jelly.  The small venue is host to an intimate fine arts and crafts gallery featuring local artist and artisans, family and friends
column2: meditation cushions, botanical dye, up-cycled clothing, wood items, jewelry
column3: a learning space for small group workshops, meetings and moveable display furniture to facilitate Spoken word events.

column1: Located at the western entrance of Arts Row in the BEAD (Bloomington Area Arts District), we are a funky little shop wanting to establish a daily morning market and a Thursday evening Farmers Market offering our teas, tea products, locally roasted coffee, whole grain, gluten free and vegan goodies, soups, appetizers, live and raw foods.    We received unanimous approval from both Planning and Zoning.  We made connections with a few other businesses and launched this campaign.    Since the campaign over ear, we are removing the perks.   In the possibility of someday launching the markets we offer up our amended list of
What We Need, Ways You Can Help
We received were enough to purchase a refrigerator.
Every contribution making that purchase possible is appreciated by Patricia’s Wellness Arts Cafe.
Thank you for your time and your attention.  We're honored to have your support.
It looks like the markets are not yet ready to come to life.
Current needs:
Tea Cart or funds to purchase or build once
Vita Mix (High Speed Blender)
Excalibur Dehydrator
Compact Digital Scale
Storage Cabinet
Display Shelving
Stainless Chafer
Clear food grade display cases for cookies, cakes, pies,
Air Pots (for hot and cold liquids)
Stainless baking sheets (commercial)
Stainless muffin tins
Storage Jars - glass
To-go packaging
Small Water dispenser
Donate any of the items above

Shop in the cafe so we wii have the funds to purchase necessaries.

Our Story

Sustainable Hudson Valley hatched the 10% Challenge to help communities save energy and improve their local environments through people-powered creativity.  It's a simple invitation:
Cut your community's energy use 10%.
And get 10% of your people involved.

The energy cuts can be any combination of municipal, business and residential, totaling 10% of electricity and heating fuel used in your community.  This can be achieved by ""picking the low hanging fruit"" such as home energy upgrades, and also by signature projects in the community such as creating bike-friendly streets.

Your household can participate by any combination of lifestyle changes and home improvements:  for instance,  by insulating your home, getting out of your car and onto your bike, or changing the way you use your appliances. People can step forward as demonstration households, or community advocates, or  volunteers helping a local campaign to progress.

We piloted this initiative in Red Hook, NY, a delightful town with two villages in its boundaries.  Over the year, we got the town supervisor to do a Lunch and Learn, the schools to run a contest for energy saving ideas, the Chamber of Commerce to invite business members in, and over 300 households to sign up and save.  The library bought a ""Kill-a-Watt Meter"" so that households can measure their electricity use.  The community launched the campaign with 10 different events from a foot race to a composting workshop. (The photo above is town board member Harry Colgan turning on the lights with bike power.)  We don't yet know the results in direct energy saving, but thanks to the Cost and Rate department at Central Hudson, our friendly utility, we will soon learn.

Meanwhile, the campaign has been taken up by a total of 14 communities representing over 100,000 people! 
They are competing for prizes donated by generous sponsors:  a solar thermal system from EarthKind Energy, a sail on the famous Sloop Clearwater for school children of the winning community
column3: R at the Omega Institute for the hard-working winning town board
column4: and a communitywide solar opportunity assessment from The Solar Energy Consortium, an important local organization helping to pave the way for a solar future.

column1: We are so excited.  But we have a problem.  This effort caught on faster than our fundraising could keep up!  We need to help them buy some basic tools - like kits of energy saving light bulbs and low-flow showerheads to give away, and lawn signs for participating households.  And we need to give the campaign as a whole some TLC - publicity, technical assistance, moral support.  To do this, we are raising support to hire an Americorps member.  This Indiegogo campaign will provide the needed funding to bolster our fall application and the program's January start date.
<div>
The Impact

How we use energy profoundly affects the earth's climate, as well as the cash that flows through our communities.  Saving energy is an act of both environmental and economic stewardship. Unfortunately, many people don't get excited about it.  This campaign gets people excited.  At the beginning, I received a letter from a state agency official. It was almost angry in tone.  He was afraid I was setting too high a goal (and he may have been right).  He said, ""You are going to set communities up for disappointment.""  To this I say no:  We are going to set communities up for adventure and creativity, and a greater investment in their shared future.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2:
What You GetAt Sustainable Hudson Valley, we are very frugal and careful not to waste paper... signs... and stuff.  But a campaign needs a few materials:  lawn signs for participating households, banners for in front of town halls (made out of eco-friendly materials, of course).  We want to make it easy to participate by offering free goody bags with low-flow shower heads and compact flourescent light bulbs, which we can buy at cost thanks to a business sponsor, Energy Management Solutions.  We also want to make sure that the local campaigns are supported for success. Our way to do this is by bringing in a member of Americorps, a blue-ribbon program helping recent college graduates to engage in meaningful service and have their expenses covered.

We are asking the Indigogo community to help us raise $10,000 to put a solid foundation under this exciting campaign.  Everyone who contributes will be part of building a model that is not just useful in the Hudson Valley, but in every community across America and beyond.   With this campaign, we are discovering how to wake up communities and generate sustained, positive commitment toward a low-carbon future with high quality of life for all.  

All contributors will have the option of being acknowledged on Sustainable Hudson Valley's website, with space for your comments about ways to get communities involved in saving energy. 

Contributors of $100 will receive their choice of books: 

Glenn Croston's 75 Green Businesses You Can Start to Make Money Now

Harvey Stone's Melting Down (a climate change thriller - really!)

Melissa Everett's Making a Living While Making a Difference. 

Other Ways You Can Help

column1: If you live in the Hudson Valley, please help spread the word.  If you work with a business that can benefit from visibility to these green communities, please consider sponsoring the 10% Challenge.  If you are a person of means, we'd love to be able to offer a cash prize to the first community to achieve that 10% reduction...  And wherever you are, feel free to touch base and we'll share the elements of a 10% Challenge campaign for your community.

(The photo above is town board member Harry Colgan turning on the lights with bike power.)  We don't yet know the results in direct energy saving, but thanks to the Cost and Rate department at Central Hudson, our friendly utility, we will soon learn.

Meanwhile, the campaign has been taken up by a total of 14 communities representing over 100,000 people!  They are competing for prizes donated by generous sponsors:  a solar thermal system from EarthKind Energy, a sail on the famous Sloop Clearwater for school children of the winning community
column2: a day of R & R at the Omega Institute for the hard-working winning town board
column3: and a communitywide solar opportunity assessment from The Solar Energy Consortium, an important local organization helping to pave the way for a solar future.

column1: We are so excited.  But we have a problem.  This effort caught on faster than our fundraising could keep up!  We need to help them buy some basic tools - like kits of energy saving light bulbs and low-flow showerheads to give away, and lawn signs for participating households.  And we need to give the campaign as a whole some TLC - publicity, technical assistance, moral support.  To do this, we are raising support to hire an Americorps member.  This Indiegogo campaign will provide the needed funding to bolster our fall application and the program's January start date.
The Impact

How we use energy profoundly affects the earth's climate, as well as the cash that flows through our communities.  Saving energy is an act of both environmental and economic stewardship. Unfortunately, many people don't get excited about it.  This campaign gets people excited.  At the beginning, I received a letter from a state agency official. It was almost angry in tone.  He was afraid I was setting too high a goal (and he may have been right).  He said, ""You are going to set communities up for disappointment.""  To this I say no:  We are going to set communities up for adventure and creativity, and a greater investment in their shared future.

What We Need & What You GetAt Sustainable Hudson Valley, we are very frugal and careful not to waste paper... signs... and stuff.  But a campaign needs a few materials:  lawn signs for participating households, banners for in front of town halls (made out of eco-friendly materials, of course).  We want to make it easy to participate by offering free goody bags with low-flow shower heads and compact flourescent light bulbs, which we can buy at cost thanks to a business sponsor, Energy Management Solutions.  We also want to make sure that the local campaigns are supported for success. Our way to do this is by bringing in a member of Americorps, a blue-ribbon program helping recent college graduates to engage in meaningful service and have their expenses covered. We are asking the Indigogo community to help us raise $10,000 to put a solid foundation under this exciting campaign.  Everyone who contributes will be part of building a model that is not just useful in the Hudson Valley, but in every community across America and beyond.   With this campaign, we are discovering how to wake up communities and generate sustained, positive commitment toward a low-carbon future with high quality of life for all.   All contributors will have the option of being acknowledged on Sustainable Hudson Valley's website, with space for your comments about ways to get communities involved in saving energy.  Contributors of $100 will receive their choice of books:  Glenn Croston's 75 Green Businesses You Can Start to Make Money NowHarvey Stone's Melting Down (a climate change thriller - really!)Melissa Everett's Making a Living While Making a Difference.  Other Ways You Can Help

If you live in the Hudson Valley, please help spread the word.  If you work with a business that can benefit from visibility to these green communities, please consider sponsoring the 10% Challenge.  If you are a person of means, we'd love to be able to offer a cash prize to the first community to achieve that 10% reduction...  And wherever you are, feel free to touch base and we'll share the elements of a 10% Challenge campaign for your community.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Kingston, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ten-percent-challenge/pica

<h1>The Countdown is on!<span style=""font-style: italic
column2:
> Order your copy today!


Setting the Bar Higher

Wow. In just ten short days, Terror reached our initial goal of $2,500. We cannot express in words how thankful our staff is for your support and encouragement. Now, it's time to raise the bar higher. Terror Magazine boasts a national reach, and it's time we meet our audience. Help us reach a new goal of $4,000 and we'll be able to embark on an 8 day promo tour of the east coast. We want to meet you in Austin, Dallas, DC, New York and Chicago and gush about how great you are. This May, bring Terror to you for a week of promotional mayhem and good times. Our Campaign ends on March 18th so waste no time!

Our Story

column1:
We're Terror Magazine - an Austin-based publication that connects readers to a community of smart and passionate young women across the country. With quarterly issues and regular web content, we provide coverage in 6 categories:

Art + Entertainment
Beauty + Fashion
Business + technology
Culture + Lifestyle
Craft + How to
Health and Well-being

Terror celebrates empowerment,
success and growth in the female community. Weâ€™re busting our chops to
create a publication that represents the multifaceted working girl - someone capable of caring as much about the world as she does her
wardrobe. Weâ€™re catering to the protesters, the beauty queens, the
punks, librarians and activists - the girls who are all of those things

combined and so much more. 

This publication is for
you. Terror is a safe place for your stories and experiences, a haven
for your weird quirks, triumphs and challenges. We've created a publication that is as well rounded and multifaceted as our readers and want to share it with the world.

Terror needs $2500 dollars to print our premier issue. If we meet our goal, we'll be able to print 1,000 high-gloss, full color magazines scheduled to hit stands on March 30th as well as promotional material. We've got 30 days to meet our goal and every contribution helps.

So what's in it for you? Any donation over 1 dollar offers contributors one of our many awesome perks. Pledges at the Party Pack tier or higher will include most to all of the following items:
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can, donate! Make sure to share this video with all of the fantastic people in their life and direct them to our indiegogo platform. We can't do this without you, so help Terror spread the word! Like our fan page on facebook, follow us on twitter @TerrorMagazine and visit our blog at terrormagazine.tumblr.com

column7: >Celebration of Life Foundation (COL) was formed in 2004 by members of the Inspirational hip-hop group, Sonz of the Most High (S.O.M), Darrell Murray, and Paris Simon, who were innocent victims in a shooting that occurred on May 31, 2003.  Their miraculous survival motivated them to give back to the community through the COL Foundation, an Outreach program encouraging community resident to â€œStop the Violenceâ€ and become involved in addressing the violence in the streets to create a relatively peaceful environment to live and work.  COL also partners with other organizations to help promote and provide opportunities such as
column8: HIV and health awareness, voters registration, and the importance of academic excellence. Since 2004, COL hosted the following annual events, Stop the Violence Week which has grown from a back yard bar-b-que to a week long event, Back to School Drive, Holiday Toy and Clothing Drive, and Feed the Homeless.

column1: ","Our Story

Celebration of Life Foundation (COL) was formed in 2004 by members of the Inspirational hip-hop group, Sonz of the Most High (S.O.M), Darrell Murray, and Paris Simon, who were innocent victims in a shooting that occurred on May 31, 2003.  Their miraculous survival motivated them to give back to the community through the COL Foundation, an Outreach program encouraging community resident to â€œStop the Violenceâ€ and become involved in addressing the violence in the streets to create a relatively peaceful environment to live and work.  COL also partners with other organizations to help promote and provide opportunities such as
column2: HIV and health awareness, voters registration, and the importance of academic excellence. Since 2004, COL hosted the following annual events, Stop the Violence Week which has grown from a back yard bar-b-que to a week long event, Back to School Drive, Holiday Toy and Clothing Drive, and Feed the Homeless.

column1: The Impact

The mission of Celebration of Life foundation is to raise awareness of the value placed on life by hosting and promoting networking and community service events.  Through these events individuals are encouraged and empowered to become more respectful and aware of their contributions to living a positive and productive life, therefore, creating a relatively peaceful environment to live and work.
What We Need & What You Get

To help assure the continued success, professionalism, and excitement generated by this annual event, we need your support to help us raise funds and reach others in the community.  We are inviting all Business owners, Pastors, Youth Pastors, Leaders and Kingdom Builders to come out and â€œCelebrate Lifeâ€ with us for the entire week.  All activities are free for the week.  Just come out and experience the move of God.  We have heard â€œGreat Testimoniesâ€ in how the Celebration of Life Experience has changed many lives.
We thank you in advance and greatly appreciate your time, attention, contributions, consideration and pray that you will join us for this life changing experience.
Other Ways You Can Help

WE NEED YOU TO SPREAD THE WORD!!! You can do this by sending emails, tweets, facebook messages, and most importantly by WORD OF MOUTH! If you would like to take part in any of our events please feel free to send your contact information to col.foundation@gmail.com",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
<ul>
• Introduce yourself and your background.
• Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
• Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<ul>
• Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
• Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
• Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.
<div>
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>
• Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
• Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
• Make it real for people and build trust.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
